Triatomini Jeannel.Abdomen: in most cases with well-developed dorsal and ventral connexival segments, the latter not covered by urosternites; in some cases, dorsal connexival segments fused with urotergites, with ventral connexival segments either well developed or obsolescent, in latter case dorsal and ventral surface of abdomen laterally separated by wide membranous area.
Triatomini Jeannel.Body: integument from smooth torugose, with or without small setiferous granules.
Triatomini Jeannel.Genae: from falling short of to slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus, the latter widened at base, narrow apically.
Triatomini Jeannel.Head: without setiferous callosities behind eyes.
Triatomini Jeannel.Ocelli: situated posterolaterally behind eyes, in most cases on conspicuous elevations, behind interocular sulcus, the latter not fully developed.
Triatomini Jeannel.Second antennal segment: with 4-10 trichobothria arranged in one row along length of segment.

Triatoma Laporte.Abdomen: from narrow to wide, with lateral portions of urotergites exposed or completely covered by hemelytra.
Triatoma Laporte.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at or behind middle of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma Laporte.Anterior lobe: of pronotum with or without discal and lateral tubercles.
Triatoma Laporte.Head: subcylindrical.
Triatoma Laporte.Humeral angles: rounded or angular but not spined.
Triatoma Laporte.Legs: with femora armed or unarmed; spongy fossulae of tibiae present or absent.
Triatoma Laporte.Rostrum: as long as head, extending to level of prosternum; first rostral segment invariably much shorter than second; third without rostral organ.
Triatoma Laporte.Venter: of abdomenrounded or flattened longitudinally along middle.

Triatoma amicitiae.Antenniferous tubercles: situated behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma amicitiae.Anteocular region: twice as long as postocular (1:0,45); postocular with sides slightly rounded, somewhat converging posteriorly.
Triatoma amicitiae.Anterior lobe: of pronotum without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma amicitiae.Anterolateral angles: with short, triangular, anterolaterally directed projections.
Triatoma amicitiae.Clypeus: widened on posterior half, elevated in lateral view.
Triatoma amicitiae.Corium: yellowish, lighter colored than rest of body, only its apex darkened.
Triatoma amicitiae.Eyes: unusually small, in lateral view not quite attaining level of lower surface and remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma amicitiae.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercles, second falling slightly short of level of posterior border of head.
Triatoma amicitiae.Genae: slightly tapering distally, their apex rounded, extending to level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma amicitiae.Head: strongly convex dorsally between eyes, slightly less than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,55) and as long as pronotum.
Triatoma amicitiae.Hemelytra: attaining posterior margin of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma amicitiae.Legs: stout, with fore femur about four times as long as wide, and without denticles.
Triatoma amicitiae.Length: 15 ; width of pronotum 4 , of abdomen 7 Overall color uniformly orange-brown, with only extreme apex of corium and entire membrane, dark.
Triatoma amicitiae.Overall color: uniformly orange-brown, with only extreme apex of corium and entire membrane, dark.
Triatoma amicitiae.Posterior process: almost as long as main body of scutellum, stout, subconical, its apex slightly upward turned.
Triatoma amicitiae.Rostrum: with short setae on all segments, slightly longer on apex of second and on third segment.
Triatoma amicitiae.Scutellum: with central depression limited by distinct carinae.
Triatoma amicitiae.Submedian carinae: evanescent before hind margin of pronotum; humeri rounded.
Triatoma amicitiae.Tibiae: without spongy fossulae (probably present in male).
Triatoma amicitiae.Venter: slightly flattened longitudinally along middle, its microsculpture consisting of meandering or labyrinthine wrinkles; transverse striation not developed.

Triatoma arthurneivai.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Anteocular region: two and one-half to three times as long as postocular (1:0,3-0,4), postocular with sides rounded, almost angulate.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Anterior lobe: not granulose, with obsolescent or without dorsal and invariably without lateral tubercles.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Connexivum: with orange-red subsemicircular spots in central portion of each segment and adjacent to outer margin, and black marks in shape of wide transverse bands on intersegmental sutures widened toward inner connexival suture; lightcolored areas longer than dark ones, at least along outer margin.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Corium: black; clavus black on basal third or fourth, light grayish brown on remainder, this color extending to adjoining portion of corium.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Eyes: in lateral view considerably surpassing level of under surface and approaching level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma arthurneivai.First antennal segment: falling considerably short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Fore: femora 7-8 times as long as wide; femora of fore and mid pairs of legs with a pair of small subapical denticles.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, almost pointed, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Head: black, delicately granulose, less than twice as long as wide (1:0,6), and slightly shorter than pronotum (1:1,1).
Triatoma arthurneivai.Hemelytra: extending to apex of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Integument: almost glabrous, setae very short and sparse.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Length: of male 22 , of female 19,5-21,0 ; width of pronotum of male and female 5,0 , width of abdomen of male 7,5 , of female 8,0 Overall color black, in some specimens with delicate blue pruinescence; orange-red markings on connexivum.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Membrane: fumose, light brown, lighter than corium, veins distinctly darker than cells.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Neck: dark, with a pair of very small yellow spots laterally.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Overall color: black, in some specimens with delicate blue pruinescence; orange-red markings on connexivum.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Posterior process: of scutellum subcylindrical, about as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, with apex slightly upturned, rounded in dorsal and obliquely truncate in lateral view.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Pronotum: entirely black, only very rarely humeral area tinged with orange.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Rostrum: reddish brown, lighter than head capsule.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Spiracles: very close to or adjoining connexival sutures.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Submedian carinae: extending to posterior third or almost to hind border of sclerite.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Urosternites: dark brown or black, spiracles surrounded each by small yellow area.
Triatoma arthurneivai.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened longitudinally along middle in female, delicately striate transversally, sparsely beset with short yellowish hairs.

Triatoma barberi.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind level of center of anteocular region.
Triatoma barberi.Anteocular region: slightly over twice as long as postocular (1:0,45), postocular with sides rounded, verrucose.
Triatoma barberi.Anterior lobe: slightly elevated, distinctly granulose on ridges, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma barberi.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, strongly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma barberi.Connexivum: from dark red to orange-red, segments with black markings of varied extension, from occupying entire anterior four-fifths of segment to somewhat reduced with two pointed posterior projections, the outer one shorter than the inner one , and to broken up into two dark spots, the outer one small, situated at anteroextemal angle of segment, the inner one large, elongate, adjacent to inner border of connexival segment Dark markings in no case forming continuous longitudinal
Triatoma barberi.Eyes: in lateral view not attaining level of dorsal but very close to level of under surface of head.
Triatoma barberi.First antennal segment: very short, attaining only two-thirds of distance between its base and level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma barberi.Fore: and median femora with two pairs of subapical denticles.
Triatoma barberi.Genae: narrowly tapered apically, almost attaining apex of clypeus.
Triatoma barberi.Head: , granulose and slightly rugose, distinctly convex above, twice as long as wide across eyes (l:0,55), and as long as pronotum.
Triatoma barberi.Hemelytra: falling short of apex of abdomen by 0,5-1,0 , in either sex; uniformly dark colored.
Triatoma barberi.Legs: uniformly dark, short and stout; fore femora 4,5 times as long as wide, minutely granulose.
Triatoma barberi.Length: of males 16-18, of females 18,5-20,0 ; width of pronotum of males 3,5-4,0 , of females 4,0-4,5 ; of abdomen of males 5,5-6,5, of females 6,5-7,0 Color from piceous to black, with reddish markings on connexivum.
Triatoma barberi.Posterior lobe: distinctly rugose, submedian carinae falling short of hind margin.
Triatoma barberi.Pronotum: entirely dark, trapezoidal, with sides delicately carinate, only faintly constricted at level of transverse sulcus.
Triatoma barberi.Rostrum: with relatively short hairs, somewhat longer toward apex of second and uniformly Jong on third segment.
Triatoma barberi.Scutellum: rugose; central portion distinctly impressed, limited laterally by sharp carinae.
Triatoma barberi.Spiracles: close but not adjacent to connexival suture.
Triatoma barberi.Venter: slightly but distinctly flattened longitudinally along middle, but flattened portion not distinctly separated from convex one.

Triatoma bouvieri.Abdomen: rounded below but faintly flattened longitudinally along middle, more perceptibly so in female.
Triatoma bouvieri.Anteocular region: twice or slightly more than twice as long as postocular (1:0,4-0,5); postocular with sides rounded.
Triatoma bouvieri.Anterolateral angles: shortly conical, rounded or tapered apically.
Triatoma bouvieri.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, rather abruptly widened on posterior half, conspicuously convex in side view.
Triatoma bouvieri.Corium: yellowish brown, with irregular central spot of varied size, extending to costal margin of hemelytron or separated from margin by more or less wide light colored stripe connecting subbasal and subapical light spots, or the latter separated by extended central dark spot.
Triatoma bouvieri.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under surface but remote from upper surface of head.
Triatoma bouvieri.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of hind border of head.
Triatoma bouvieri.Fore: lobe granulose on elevated areas, with faint discal and without lateral tubercles.
Triatoma bouvieri.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma bouvieri.Head: granulose and irregularly rugose above; its color dark reddish brown with 1 + I longitudinal black stripes on dorsum sublaterally.
Triatoma bouvieri.Hemelytra: almost attaining apex of abdomen in males and in some females; in other females not extending beyond mjddle of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma bouvieri.Legs: reddish brown, stout; fore femur 4,0-4,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma bouvieri.Length: of male 17,0-18,0 , of female 19,5-20,0 ; width of pronotum of male 4,0-4,5 , of female 4,8 ; width of abdomen of male 7,0-7,8 , of female 8,0 Overall color from yellowish to reddish brown, with dark brown or black markings on head, pronotum, corium, and connexivum .
Triatoma bouvieri.Membrane: as dark as dark portions of
Triatoma bouvieri.Overall color: from yellowish to reddish brown, with dark brown or black markings on head, pronotum, corium, and connexivum .
Triatoma bouvieri.Posterior process: of scutellum relatively short, only twice as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subconical, sharply tapering from wide base to narrow apex.
Triatoma bouvieri.Pronotum: light reddish brown; darkbrown or black on smooth areas of anterior lobe and with four longitudinal dark stripes on posterior lobe, I+ l in area between submedian carinae and lateral margin of pronotum, and I+ l in space between carinae, adjacent to same.
Triatoma bouvieri.Rostrum: with short, inconspicuous setae except on apex of second and on third segment, but not numerous and not forming brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma bouvieri.Scutellum: with variable color pattern, its basal portion dark brown or black, central depression and posterior process in most cases reddish.
Triatoma bouvieri.Second antennal segment: only with adpressed setae, shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma bouvieri.Spiracles: adjacent to connexival suture or remote from same by distance not larger than their own diameter.
Triatoma bouvieri.Tibiae: of first and second pair of male with spongy fossulae, absent in female.

Triatoma brasiliensis.Abdomen: slightly flattened below in both sexes, delicately striate transversally, sparsely setose.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted at or slightly before middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular (1:0,25), postocular with sides slightly rounded.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Anterior lobe: with very low discal tubercles, difficult to perceive when concolorous with overall surface of fore lobe; lateral tubercles absent.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Clypeus: distinctly but not abruptly widened behind middle.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Corium: light yellow, with dark areas of variable extension, mainly in lateral area limited by Sc, R + M and free portion of R, and on central area adjoining bases of membranal cells; areas mentioned joined in some specimens.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Eyes: in lateral view approaching but not attaining level of under surface and remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma brasiliensis.First antennal segment: attaining level of apex of clypeus; second segment subcylindrical, beset with declivous setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma brasiliensis.First rostral segment: extending to level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second to level of apex of middle of eyes.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Fore: and mid femora salient below subapically or with one or two weak denticles.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Genae: tapering distally but their apex narrowly rounded, not pointed, slightly projecting beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Head: dark brown or black, in some cases tinged with light brown dorsally; rugose dorsally and laterally, slightly granulose.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Hemelytra: extending to variable levels from base to apex of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Integument: with sparse, short, yellowish or black setae.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Legs: dark, with light markings on trochantera, on middle and rarely also at base of femora, as well as apically on tibiae.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Length: of male 22-25 , of female 23,0-25,5 ; width of pronotum of male 4-5 , of female 4,5-5,5 ; width of abdomen of male 6-9 , of female 7,5-10,0 Overall color from dark brown to black, in some cases lighter brown dorsally; brownish yellow markings on neck, pronotum, legs, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Membrane: fumose, from light yellow to light yellowish brown, as light as or slightly darker than light-colored areas of corium.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Neck: dark, with a pair of light-colored spots laterally.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Overall color: from dark brown to black, in some cases lighter brown dorsally; brownish yellow markings on neck, pronotum, legs, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Posterior process: as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, but slightly compressed laterally, apex slightly elevated, rounded.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Pronotum: very sparsely granulose, from dark brown to black, in some cases entirely dark, more frequently with some or all of the following yellow:collar, anterolateral processes, discal tubercles of fore lobe, submedian carinae along their entire length, a pair of large, elongate, subrectangular markings on hind lobe laterad of carinae, and narrower markings parallel to lateral margins.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Rostrum: thick, as dark as head capsule, with mediumsized hairs on first and on underside of second segment, and with long and very numerous hairs on upper surface of second and on entire third segment; hairs especially dense dorsally at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Scutellum: dark brown, posterior process with yellow point in light-colored specimens.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior fourth of hind lobe.
Triatoma brasiliensis.Venter: dark brown or black, in some specimens suffused with light brown; spiracles enclosed in minute yellow area.

Triatoma breyeri.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind center of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma breyeri.Anteocular region: two and onehalf to three times as Jong as postocular (l:0,35-0,40); postocular with sides feebly rounded.
Triatoma breyeri.Anterior lobe: feebly sculptured, not perceptibly granulose, with 1 + 1 small but distinct discal and 1 + I small lateral tubercles, the latter in some specimens obsolete.
Triatoma breyeri.Clypeus: narrow, distinctly but not abruptly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma breyeri.Connexivum: pale yellow, entirely so ventrally, but dorsally with disc of each connexival segment spotted with dark, in most specimens spot restricted to area adjacent to connexival suture, in others extending to a larger or smaller degree to outer area of
Triatoma breyeri.Eyes: large, in lateral view surpassing level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma breyeri.Femora: inermous, with short adpressed setae and ventrally with long bristles, most numerous on fore legs.
Triatoma breyeri.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma breyeri.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second extending beyond level of hind border of head.
Triatoma breyeri.Fore: femora about six times as long as wide.
Triatoma breyeri.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma breyeri.Head: dark, transversally rugose dorsally, weakly granulose.
Triatoma breyeri.Hemelytra: -closely approaching or attaining apex of abdomen; corium uniformly black; membrane fumose, greyish brown.
Triatoma breyeri.Length: of male 18,0-18,5 , of female 20-22 ; width of pronotum of male 4,0, of female 4,5 ; width of abdomen ofmale 5,5 ; of female 6,0-7,0 Overall color dark brown to black, with connexivum partly or entirely pale yellow.
Triatoma breyeri.Neck: dark, with I+ I distinct yellowish spots laterally.
Triatoma breyeri.Overall color: dark brown to black, with connexivum partly or entirely pale yellow.
Triatoma breyeri.Posterior process: of scutellum horizontal, about as long as main body of scutellum, slender, narrowly tapering or pointed apically .
Triatoma breyeri.Rostrum: light brown, not so dark as head.
Triatoma breyeri.Scutellum: heavily rugose, central depression ill defined, from linear to imperceptible.
Triatoma breyeri.Second antennal segment: with numerous semierect ciliate hairs twice as long as diameter of segment, and less numerous regularly spaced elongate bristles from twice to more than four times as long as diameter of segment ; similar hairs and bristles on third and fourth segments.
Triatoma breyeri.Submedian carinae: low, not extending beyond middle of hind lobe.
Triatoma breyeri.Venter: convex, carinate longitudinally along middle in male, almost imperceptibly flattened in female.

Triatoma carrioni.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted distinctly behind middle of anteocular area.
Triatoma carrioni.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (1:0,35), postocular with sides slightly rounded, converging towards behind.
Triatoma carrioni.Anterior lobe: margined laterally with red, with discal and 1 + 1 posterosublateral tubercles; lateral tubercles absent but lateral borders of anterior lobe angularly salient behind.
Triatoma carrioni.Anterolateral angles: and in some cases also center of collar, red.
Triatoma carrioni.Clypeus: narrow, elongate, slightly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma carrioni.Connexivum: black, with narrow transversal reddish spots straddling intersegmental
Triatoma carrioni.Corium: with one subbasal and one subapical very irregularly shaped transverse yellowish marking; apex of corium also yellowish.
Triatoma carrioni.Femora: of first and second pairs of legs with three, hind femora with two, unusually large denticles.
Triatoma carrioni.First rostral segment: only reaching to level of center of genae; second segment very long and slender, attaining level of ocelli,
Triatoma carrioni.Fore: and mid tibiae of male with spongy fossulae, absent in female.
Triatoma carrioni.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, in some cases pointed, not quite attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma carrioni.Head: black, dorsally along middle with elevated longitudinal granulose ridge.
Triatoma carrioni.Legs: black, stout; fore femur 5,5-6,0 times as long as wide.
Triatoma carrioni.Length: of male 19,5-21,0 , of female 20,0-22,5 ; width of pronotum of male 4,5-5,0 , of female 4,5-5,5 ; width of abdomen of male 6,0-7,5 , of female 6,5-8,0 Overall color dark brown or black, with orange-red or yellowish markings on thorax, hemelytra and connexivum.
Triatoma carrioni.Overall color: dark brown or black, with orange-red or yellowish markings on thorax, hemelytra and connexivum.
Triatoma carrioni.Posterior lobe: black, with lateral margin bordered with orange-red; additionally, one central and 1 + 1 subl ateral longitudinal markings ex - tending from transversal sulcus to pronotum, markings medially constricted or even interrupted.
Triatoma carrioni.Rostrum: dark brown or black, with short inconspicuous setae.
Triatoma carrioni.Scutellum: black, heavily rugose, its posterior process about as long as main body of scutellum, black at base, red distally, its apex spoon-shaped .
Triatoma carrioni.Second antennal segment: with stout decumbent setae slightly longer than diameter of segment.
Triatoma carrioni.Setae: slender, very short, golden colored, inconspicuous.
Triatoma carrioni.Spiracles: adjacent or very close to connexival suture.
Triatoma carrioni.Venter: of male convex, with faint trace of median longitudinal keel.

Triatoma cavernicola.Abdomen: light colored ventrally, with external genitalia darkened somewhat irregularly in both sexes (artifact?).
Triatoma cavernicola.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at middle of anteocular region of head, without apicolateral projection.
Triatoma cavernicola.Anteocular region: approximately three times as long as postocular (l:0,33); postocular region with sides rounded, heavily granulose.
Triatoma cavernicola.Clypeus: widened at base, but not abruptly so.
Triatoma cavernicola.Connexivum: delicately creased longitudinally along outer margin.
Triatoma cavernicola.Corium: almost entirely pale yellow, with one elongate black spot subapically and, in some specimens, with a small and faint spot at center.
Triatoma cavernicola.First antennal segment: light colored, falling short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment entirely dark.
Triatoma cavernicola.First rostral segment: attaining level of insertion of antenniferous tubercles, second segment attaining level of hind border of head.
Triatoma cavernicola.Genae: narrowly tapering apically but not pointed.
Triatoma cavernicola.Head: stramineous, with sides partly black, its surface slightly rugose and heavily granulose, approximately twice as long as wide across eyes (l:0,55), and as long as pronotum.
Triatoma cavernicola.Hemelytra: attaining or slightly surpassing middle of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma cavernicola.Integument: of venter with extremely small irregular wrinkles, giving it an overall minutely crinkled aspect.
Triatoma cavernicola.Legs: uniformly yellow, relatively slender; fore femur 6-7 times as long as wide, with one or two weakly developed or without denticles.
Triatoma cavernicola.Length: of males 18,5-20,5 , of females 20,5-21,0 ; width of pronotum of males 6,5-7,5 , of females 4,5 ; width of abdomen of males 6,5-7,5 , of females 7,0-7,5 General shape comparatively slender.
Triatoma cavernicola.Neck: of general body color, with 1 + 1 dark lateral spots, being part of discontinuous lateral dark area extending from sides of head to first visible urostemite.
Triatoma cavernicola.Overall color: pale stramineous, with dark brown or black markings mainly on head, pronotum, scutellum, apex of corium, connexivum, and on pleura.
Triatoma cavernicola.Posterior lobe: delicately rugose and granulose, with submedian carinae delimitating a central and l + l lateral depressed areas, the latter on their anterior half with l + l elongate dark markings; l + l similar but shorter markings, not distinct in all specimens, close to inner border of carinae, at sides of central depression.
Triatoma cavernicola.Posterior process: of scutellum subconical, shorter than main body of scutellum, horizontal , rounded apically; its color light yellow.
Triatoma cavernicola.Pronotum: with anterior lobe slightly granulose, almost flat, without discal or lateral tu bercles; its color uniformly light.
Triatoma cavernicola.Rostrum: with sparse short hairs except those on third segment which are more numerous and as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma cavernicola.Scutellum: granulose and coarsely rugose transversally, dark laterally and light colored at center.
Triatoma cavernicola.Tibiae: of first and second pair of legs of male with spongy fossulae, absent in female.
Triatoma cavernicola.Venter: flattened longitudinally along center, more pronouncedly so in female.

Triatoma circummaculata.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma circummaculata.Anteocular region: about two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,35-0,4), postocular with sides distinctly convex, angularly projecting.
Triatoma circummaculata.Anterolateral projections: laterally directed, very short, subconical, blunt apically.
Triatoma circummaculata.Clypeus: narrow, gradually widened on posterior half.
Triatoma circummaculata.Corium: dark brown or blackish, red at base and with smaller reddish spot subapically; these spots in some individuals more extended and occasionally confluent.
Triatoma circummaculata.Eyes: in lateral view surpassing level of under surface but remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma circummaculata.First antennal segment: very short, not projecting beyond middle of genae.
Triatoma circummaculata.Fore: lobe delicately granulose on ridges, and without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma circummaculata.Genae: large, rounded distally, slightly projecting beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma circummaculata.Head: of general body color, delicately rugose and granulose, with setae short and inapparent.
Triatoma circummaculata.Hemelytra: attaining or closely approaching apex of urotergite VII.
Triatoma circummaculata.Integument: of venter delicately striate transversally, sparsely and inconspicuously pilose.
Triatoma circummaculata.Legs: uniformly dark, comparatively short; fore femur 5,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma circummaculata.Length: of male 15-16 , of female 15-17 ; width of pronotum of male and female 3,0-3,5 , of abdomen of male 5-6 , of female 6 Overall color dark brown or black, with bright red markings on pronotum, corium, and connexivum; extension of markings variable .
Triatoma circummaculata.Membrane: brown, fumose, almost as dark as dark portions of corium.
Triatoma circummaculata.Neck: dark brown, with a pair of lateral reddish spots.
Triatoma circummaculata.Overall color: dark brown or black, with bright red markings on pronotum, corium, and connexivum; extension of markings variable .
Triatoma circummaculata.Pilosity: very short, inconspicuous, insects appearing glabrous.
Triatoma circummaculata.Posterior process: short, only half as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subconical, tapering to rounded and in some cases slightly upwardly bent point.
Triatoma circummaculata.Pronotum: with anterior lobe from dark brown to black, posterior lobe pigmented as anterior lobe, or from partially to entirely bright red .
Triatoma circummaculata.Rostrum: in most specimens light brown, contrasting with dark head.
Triatoma circummaculata.Scutellum: of general dark color, rarely apex of posterior process lighter colored; central depression of scutellum distinctly delimited by carinae.
Triatoma circummaculata.Second antennal segment: comparatively thick, beset with longitudinal rows of stout adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma circummaculata.Setae: of rostrum very short and sparse except scattered longer ones on apical portion of third segment.
Triatoma circummaculata.Spiracles: adjacent or very close to connexival suture.
Triatoma circummaculata.Submedian carinae: penetrating only to anterior fourth or fifth of posterior lobe, obsolete beyond.
Triatoma circummaculata.Venter: rounded below in both sexes, rarely very slighjly flattened in female.

Triatoma costalimai.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted at middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma costalimai.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular (1:0,25), postocular with sides almost straight, distinctly converging posteriorly.
Triatoma costalimai.Connexivum: extensively dark brown; connexival segments each with orange-red marking of variable width extending along outer connexival border; dark portion of connexivum advancing towards external border along intersegmental
Triatoma costalimai.Corium: and clavus black, apex of corium bordered with reddish, and conspicuous orange-red marking subapically adjacent to base of outer membranal cell.
Triatoma costalimai.Eyes: small, in lateral view approaching but not attaining level of under surface and distant from upper surface of head.
Triatoma costalimai.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus; second with decumbent setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma costalimai.First rostral segment: attaining or slightly surpassing level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma costalimai.Fore: lobe feebly sculptured and weakly granulose, with l + l barely perceptible discal tubercles; lateral tubercles absent.
Triatoma costalimai.Genae: pointed, projecting beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma costalimai.Head: black, feebly rugose and granulose-punctate, approximately twice as long as wide (1:0,45), and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,75).
Triatoma costalimai.Hemelytra: attaining posterior border of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Triatoma costalimai.Length: of male 26 , of female 25,5-26,5 ; width of pronotum of male and female 5,0-5,5 , of abdomen of male and female 7,5-8,0 Overall color dark brown to black, with reddish markings on neck, corium and connexivum.
Triatoma costalimai.Membrane: dark gray, faintly tinged with reddish; veins of membrane black.
Triatoma costalimai.Neck: dark, with pair of lateral reddish spots.
Triatoma costalimai.Overall color: dark brown to black, with reddish markings on neck, corium and connexivum.
Triatoma costalimai.Posterior process: almost as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical or somewhat compressed laterally, its apex slightly elevated, narrowly rounded in dorsal and obliquely truncate in lateral view.
Triatoma costalimai.Rostrum: as dark as head or somewhat lighter.
Triatoma costalimai.Scutellum: heavily rugose, with well-developed central depression.
Triatoma costalimai.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of male, absent in female.
Triatoma costalimai.Submedian carinae: extending close to posterior margin of sclerite.
Triatoma costalimai.Venter: convex in both sexes, highly polished, appearing glabrous, delicately striate transversally.

Triatoma deanei.Antenniferous tubercles: located at middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma deanei.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular (1:0,25), postocular with sides almost straight, distinctly converging toward behind.
Triatoma deanei.Anterior lobe: feebly sculptured, not granulose, with distinct although small discal and lateral tubercles, somewhat lighter colored than rest of surface of pronotum.
Triatoma deanei.Clypeus: elongate, abruptly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma deanei.Connexivum: pale yellow, with small dark mark at intersegmental suture along outer border of segment, and darkened along connexival suture dorsally but not ventrally; some of the intersegmental sutures of connexivum slightly and narrowly darkened, markings similar to musical
Triatoma deanei.Corium: light yellowish brown with veins mostly dark, central portion of corium also darkened, dark area extending apicad and proximad along cell formed by Sc, R+M and R.
Triatoma deanei.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus; remaining segments not preserved.
Triatoma deanei.Fore: and mid femora with pair of very small subapical denticles.
Triatoma deanei.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma deanei.Head: dark brown, delicately rugose and granulose, slightly less than twice as long as wide (1:0,55), and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,9).
Triatoma deanei.Legs: dark brown, trochantera and base of femora contrastingly yellow .
Triatoma deanei.Length: of male (holotype) 25 , width of pronotum 6 , of abdomen 8,5 Overall color dark brown.
Triatoma deanei.Membrane: light yellowish brown, withveins narrowly dark.
Triatoma deanei.Neck: dark, with pair of lateral yellowish spots.
Triatoma deanei.Posterior process: shortly subconical, wide at base, narrowly tapering apically, horizontal.
Triatoma deanei.Rostrum: reddish brown, relatively stout; first segment not quite attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma deanei.Scutellum: uniformly dark, with well-developed median impression.
Triatoma deanei.Spongy fossulae: present on fore and mid legs.
Triatoma deanei.Submedian carinae: extending close to hind margin of sclerite.
Triatoma deanei.Urosternites: dark brown, except for minute yellow spots enclosing spiracles.
Triatoma deanei.Venter: convex, delicately striate transversally, with sparse short setae.

Triatoma delpontei.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma delpontei.Anteocular region: from three to four times as long as postocular, the latter with sides rounded.
Triatoma delpontei.Anterior lobe: slightly granulose, with I+ I pointed vertical discal and 1 + I smaller, apically rounded lateral tubercles, as well as with I+ I obsolescent posterosublateral tubercles.
Triatoma delpontei.Anterolateral angles: of pronotum small but distinct, conical, laterally directed.
Triatoma delpontei.Eyes: in lateral view attaining or falling slightly short of level of lower surface and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma delpontei.First antennal segment: falling considerably short of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma delpontei.Fore: and mid femora with a pair of obsolescent subapical denticles.
Triatoma delpontei.Genae: pointed, heavily sclerotized distally, extending considerably beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma delpontei.Head: dark reddish brown or black, pilose, sparsely granulose.
Triatoma delpontei.Hemelytra: attammg apex of urotergite VII, in both sexes.
Triatoma delpontei.Integument: of venter coarsely although shallowly striate transversally; setae adpressed, numerous, but less so than in T platensis.
Triatoma delpontei.Legs: uniformly dark brown or blackish, stout, fore femur about five times as long as wide.
Triatoma delpontei.Length: of male 24-26 , of female 25-27 ; width of pronotum of male and female 6,5-7,5 ; width of abdomen of male 7,5-9,5 , of female 8,5-10,0 Robust, heavily sclerotized species .
Triatoma delpontei.Neck: dark, with I+ I lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma delpontei.Overall color: dark reddish brown or black, matte or slightly polished, with yellow markings on neck and connexivum, and with elytra also partly yellowish.
Triatoma delpontei.Pilosity: pale golden colored, adpressed, distinct but not as abundant as in T platensis, the most closely related species.
Triatoma delpontei.Posterior lobe: coarsely and irregularly wrinkled, moderately setose.
Triatoma delpontei.Posterior process: of scutellum two-fifths as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subconical, wide at base, subcylindrical on apical portion, rounded distally.
Triatoma delpontei.Pronotum: of general body color, from matte to slightly polished, covered with adpressed setae less numerous than in T platensis.
Triatoma delpontei.Scutellum: heavily rugose; central depression with scattered setae, remainder more densely setose.
Triatoma delpontei.Setae: of rostrum very short on first and most of under surface of second segment; distal portion of under surface and entire upper surface of second as well as entire third segment dorsally, ventrally and laterally with very dense setae much longer than diameter of segment, longest at base of third segment, progressively decreasing in length toward apex of rostrum.
Triatoma delpontei.Spiracles: adjacent or very close to connexival suture, included in small, round yellow spot.
Triatoma delpontei.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of males, absent in female.
Triatoma delpontei.Submedian carinae: evanescent just before hind border of pronotum.
Triatoma delpontei.Venter: convex, in female slightly flattened longitudinally along middle.

Triatoma dimidiata.Abdomen: convex below, minutely striate transversally, shortly pilose.
Triatoma dimidiata.Antenniferous tubercles: subcylindrical, comparatively elongate, situated slightly posterior of middle of anteocular region of head; first antennal segment attaining level of apex of clypeus; second segment with many strong setae slightly longer than diameter of segment, as well as with numerous short, delicate erect hairs.
Triatoma dimidiata.Anteocular region: from 2,5 to 3,0 times as long as postocular (1:0,3-0,4), postocular with sides rounded, converging posteriorly.
Triatoma dimidiata.Anterior lobe: with I+ l discal and I+ l smaller lateral tubercles, but not pointed and not elevated.
Triatoma dimidiata.Anterolateral angles: anterolaterally directed, short, subconical, in some specimens yellowish apically.
Triatoma dimidiata.Corium: from pale to orange-yellow, its extreme apex black, and with a dark central spot which varies from barely perceptible to very extensive, forming an almost complete transversal band across hemelytron.
Triatoma dimidiata.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Triatoma dimidiata.Fore: and mid femora with l + l small subapical denticles.
Triatoma dimidiata.Head: rugose dorsally, from slightly less to slightly more than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,4-0,6) and about as long as pronotum (1:0,9-1,1).
Triatoma dimidiata.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen but leaving female genital segments exposed, and in some cases surpassing apex of abdomen in male.
Triatoma dimidiata.Length: of male 24,5-32,0 , of female 24,5-35,0 ; width of pronotum of male 5,5-7,0 , of female 6,5-9,0 ; width of abdomen of male 9,0-12,0 , of female 9,5-13,0 Overall color from piceous to black, with connexivum and corium from pale yellow to orange yellow.
Triatoma dimidiata.Membrane: smoky brown, distinctly darker than corium, in many specimens darkest on basal area of membranal cells.
Triatoma dimidiata.Neck: dark, with l + l lateral spots yellowish.
Triatoma dimidiata.Ocelli: large, as long as distance from their anterior border to posterior margin of eye.
Triatoma dimidiata.Overall color: from piceous to black, with connexivum and corium from pale yellow to orange yellow.
Triatoma dimidiata.Ratio width of eye to synthlipsis: 1:1,0-2,0, varying considerably even among sympatric specimens.
Triatoma dimidiata.Rostrum: slender; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of posterior border of head.
Triatoma dimidiata.Scutellum: shallowly rugose, central area not depressed; apical process about as long as body of scutellum, subcylindrical, slightly downwardly bent at apex.
Triatoma dimidiata.Spiracles: close but not adjacent to connexival suture .

Triatoma dispar.Abdomen: rounded or very slightly flattened below, minutely striate transversally.
Triatoma dispar.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted slightly behind middle of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma dispar.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,3), postocular with sides only very feebly convex, distinctly converging toward behind.
Triatoma dispar.Anterior lobe: with elevated areas reddish brown, smooth areas black.
Triatoma dispar.Anterolateral projections: subtriangular, salient, elongate, somewhat compressed laterally.
Triatoma dispar.Clypeus: extremely narrow, only very slightly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma dispar.Connexivum: black, each segment with two orangeyellow marks:one, incomplete, on anterior third of disc of segment, adjacent to outer but not attaining inner border of segment, the other large spot extending over entire width of segment, situated on its basal third, adjoining intersegmental suture which is also light colored; dark markings (in some specimens) much reduced, as shown in figure
Triatoma dispar.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of ventral but not of dorsal surface of head.
Triatoma dispar.Femora: nodulose, nodules light red; pilosity distinct.
Triatoma dispar.First rostral segment: short, not extending beyond middle of genae, second very long and slender, reaching to level of posterior border of head; third longer than first.
Triatoma dispar.Fore: and mid femora subapically with four or five denticles, hind femora with two.
Triatoma dispar.Genae: narrow, rounded apically, not quite attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma dispar.Head: rugose and granulose, reddish brown, with 1 + 1 glabrous black stripes extending dorsally from level of base of clypeus to ocellar tubercles, enclosing elevated median granulose band.
Triatoma dispar.Hemelytra: covering entire length of abdomen, including genitalia of female.
Triatoma dispar.Legs: dark reddish brown, relatively slender, with fore femur seven times as long as wide.
Triatoma dispar.Length: of male 21,0-22,5 , of female 23-24 , width of pronotum of male 5,0-5,5, of female 7,0 ; width of abdomen ofmale 5,5-6,5 , of female 8,0-8,5 Overall color dark reddish brown, with black markings on head, fore lobe of pronotum and connexivum, and with red or yellowish red markings on hind lobe of pronotum, scutellum, connexivum, and hemelytra.
Triatoma dispar.Overall color: dark reddish brown, with black markings on head, fore lobe of pronotum and connexivum, and with red or yellowish red markings on hind lobe of pronotum, scutellum, connexivum, and hemelytra.
Triatoma dispar.Posterior lobe: dark brown, with submedian carinae, one median and 1 + 1 sublateral elongate red markings extending from transverse furrow to posterior margin of pronotum, red.
Triatoma dispar.Posterior process: of scutellum light red or yellowish, stout, not over half as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subcylindrical, roundedtruncate apically.
Triatoma dispar.Rostrum: reddish brown, with short, inconspicuous setae.
Triatoma dispar.Scutellum: reddish brown, in some cases black at middle of central depression, anteriorly with convolute wrinkles.
Triatoma dispar.Second antennal segment: with decumbent setae of two sizes, the larger ones slightly longer than diameter of segment.
Triatoma dispar.Spiracles: adjacent or very close to connexival suture.
Triatoma dispar.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior third of pronotum.
Triatoma dispar.Venter: from reddish brown to dark brown; spiracles yellowish.

Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at middle of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (l:0,3-0,35); postocular with sides faintly convex, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Anterior lobe: feebly sculptured, with 1 + 1 low but invariably distinct discal tubercles; lateral tubercles small, variable, from perceptible to absent.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Anterolateral projections: small, from blunt to narrowly conical.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Body: hairs short except long hairs on appendages .
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Clypeus: narrow, slightly widened at apex and gradually so on posterior half.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Connexivum: orange or rarely pale yellow, with areas of lighter color slightly advancing onto urosternites along intersegmental sutures.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Corium: dark brown or black; membrane fumose, somewhat lighter brown.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Eyes: large, in lateral view surpassing level of lower surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.First antennal segment: from almost attaining to very slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Fore: femur 6,5-8,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Genae: blunt apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Head: and thorax from highly polished to rarely dull.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Length: of male 18,5-21,0 , of female 21-24 ; width of pronotum of male 5,0-5,5, of female 5-6 ; width of abdomen ofmale 6-7 , of female 7,0-7,5 Overall color from dark brown to black, with connexivum and portions of adjacent urostemites orange yellow or rarely pale yellow colored.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Neck: somewhat lighter than head capsule, with 1 + 1 small distinct yellow spots laterally.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Ocelli: very large, their length equal to their distance from eye.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with connexivum and portions of adjacent urostemites orange yellow or rarely pale yellow colored.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Pronotum: uniformly dark, its surface in most cases highly polished, rarely only slightly polished or dull.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Rostrum: reddish brown, lighter than head capsule.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Scutellum: with surface heavily rugose, its median depression ill defined, from narrowly linear to absent.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Submedian carinae: extending to posterior third of hind lobe.
Triatoma eratyrusiforme.Venter: convex, in female flattened longitudinally along middle but not sharply so.

Triatoma flavida.Abdomen: with venter from convex to, in most cases, slightly but distinctly flattened, in both sexes.
Triatoma flavida.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma flavida.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (l:0,33-0,38), postocular with sides subparallel, very slightly converging behind.
Triatoma flavida.Anterolateral angles: yellowish, elongate conical with narrowly rounded apex.
Triatoma flavida.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, abruptly widened behind middle, and very narrow again on posterior third.
Triatoma flavida.Connexivum: light yellowish brown; in wellpreserved specimens each segment with two dark spots:a large anterior one adjacent to anterior margin of segment, irregularly shaped posteriorly, extending across entire width of segment although darkest along outer margin, and one very small dot, obsolescent in some specimens, adjacent to posterior border of segment, remote from lateral
Triatoma flavida.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Triatoma flavida.First rostral segment: not attaining level of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to level of neck; third shorter than first.
Triatoma flavida.Fore: and mid femora ventrally on apical half with from eight to ten very small setiferous denticles, some arranged in pairs, others single; subapical denticles the largest.
Triatoma flavida.Genae: attaining level of apex of clypeus, narrowly tapering apically but not pointed.
Triatoma flavida.Head: dorsally strongly rugose and faintly granulose, light yellowish brown, with l + 1 longitudinal dark brown or black stripes extending from level of antenniferous tubercles to neck.
Triatoma flavida.Hemelytra: slightly variable in length, reaching to seventh urotergite, in some cases not extending beyond its basal third, in others covering urotergite completely.
Triatoma flavida.Integument: rugose and faintly granulose in some areas.
Triatoma flavida.Legs: dark reddish brown, relatively slender; fore femur from six to seven times as long as wide.
Triatoma flavida.Length: of male 21-28 , of female 24-30 ; width of pronotum of male and female 5-7 , of abdomen of male and female 7-9 Overall color light yellowish brown, with small dark brown spots; under surface dark.
Triatoma flavida.Neck: dark brown, with l + l lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma flavida.Overall color: light yellowish brown, with small dark brown spots; under surface dark.
Triatoma flavida.Pilosity: of venter very short, sparse, adpressed, scalelike .
Triatoma flavida.Posterior lobe: margined with dark along declivous hind border.
Triatoma flavida.Pronotum: of general body color; smooth area of fore lobe black, impressions of posterior lobe dark brown.
Triatoma flavida.Ratio width of eye to synthlipsis: 1:2 in small specimens, 1:1,7 in large males and 1:1,5 in large females.
Triatoma flavida.Rostrum: slender, with short inconspicuous setae except scattered long hairs on distal segment.
Triatoma flavida.Scutellum: dark, elevated portion yellowish, coarsely and irregularly rugose, anteriorly with l + l forwardly inclined projections of variablesize, overlapping declivous posterior margin ofpronotum .
Triatoma flavida.Second antennal segment: with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma flavida.Spiracles: close but not adjacent to connexival suture, their distance from suture equal to at least diameter of spiracles.
Triatoma flavida.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior third of lobe, interrupted by transverse rugosities.
Triatoma flavida.Tibiae: of first and second pairs of legs of males with spongy fossulae; females with spongy fossulae only on fore tibiae, or absent.
Triatoma flavida.Venter: dark reddish brown, spiracles enclosed in small yellow area.

Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Abdomen: rounded below, with minute transverse wrinkles.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,35), postocular with sides subparallel, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Anterior lobe: slightly elevated, smooth, ridges not prominent.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Anterolateral angles: obliquely forward directed, conical, narrowly tapering apically.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Clypeus: very narrow, its posterior portion widening gradually.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Eyes: in lateral view approaching level of upper and attaining or slightly surpassing level of lower surface of head.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Fore: and mid femora subapically with 1 + 1 small denti cles.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Genae: tapering apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Head: slightly rugose above along midline, otherwise smooth, twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,5), and of varied length as compared to pronotum (l:0,9-1,1).
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Hemelytra: in most specimens attaining apex of abdomen, in some individuals, mainly females, falling short of apex by 0,5 to 1,0 Overall color of hemelytra from dark brown to black, somewhat lighter on and adjacent to apex of clavus.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Legs: uniformly black, slender; fore femora eight to nine times as long as wide.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Length: of male 23-26 , of female 24,0-28,5 ; width of pronotum of male 5,0-6,5 , of female 5,5-7,0 ; width of abdomen of male 7,5-9,5 , of female 9,5-11,0 Color from dark brown to black, with yellow or orange-yellow markings on neck, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Neck: black, laterally with 1 + 1 conspicuous yellow spots.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Ocelli: large, their distance from eyes equal to their diameter.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Overall color: of hemelytra from dark brown to black, somewhat lighter on and adjacent to apex of clavus.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Posterior lobe: heavily rugose; submedian carinae not attaining posterior border.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Posterior process: almost as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, slightly compressed laterally; downward bent at apex.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Pronotum: of general body color, distinctly constricted at level of transverse sulcus.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Rostrum: with very short and sparse setae, longest and most numerous on third segment.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Scutellum: with depressed portion shallowly rugose, limited by distinct carinae.
Triatoma gerstaeckeri.Spiracles: close to connexival suture, distant from latter by about twice their diameter.

Triatoma guasayana.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma guasayana.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,35), postocular with sides slightly rounded, converging toward behind.
Triatoma guasayana.Anterior lobe: with discal and with lateral tubercles, none prominent.
Triatoma guasayana.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum small, conical, somewhat flattened dorsoventrally.
Triatoma guasayana.Clypeus: narrow, only slightly widened behind middle.
Triatoma guasayana.Corium: largelypale yellow, irregularly darkened at center,with veins of central portion conspicuouslydark.
Triatoma guasayana.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma guasayana.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment compressed, beset with adpressed setae shorter than its diameter.
Triatoma guasayana.First rostral segment: very short, extending only to level of apex of jugae, second not quite reaching level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma guasayana.Fore: and mid femora with pair of stout denticles subapically.
Triatoma guasayana.Genae: narrowly tapering or pointed distally, distinctly extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma guasayana.Head: dark, rugose and granulose, heavily so on sides of head before and behind eyes.
Triatoma guasayana.Hemelytra: attaining or surpassing apex of seventh urotergite in male, in female more variable in length, from falling short of apex of seventh urotergite by up to 2 to closely approaching it.
Triatoma guasayana.Legs: with coxae dark brown; trochantera and femora pale yellow, the latter with subapical annulus, in some cases also darkened subbasally.
Triatoma guasayana.Length: of male 16,0-18,5 , of female 18,0-20,5 ; width of pronotum of male 3,5-4,0, of female 4,0-4,5 ; width of abdomen of male 5,5-6,5 , of female 6-9 Overall color very dark brown or black, with pale yellow markings on neck, hemelytra, legs and connexivum.
Triatoma guasayana.Membrane: fumose, light brown, much lighter than darker portions of corium.
Triatoma guasayana.Neck: dark, with a pair of lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma guasayana.Overall color: very dark brown or black, with pale yellow markings on neck, hemelytra, legs and connexivum.
Triatoma guasayana.Posterior process: of scutellum slightly less than half as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subcylindrical, obliquely truncate at apex, in lateral view.
Triatoma guasayana.Pronotum: sparsely granulose, blackish, in some specimens with anterior and lateral tubercles of anterior lobe and with apex of anterolateral projections yellowish.
Triatoma guasayana.Rostrum: from yellowish to light brown, contrasting with dark head.
Triatoma guasayana.Scutellum: coarsely rugose, with distinct central depression.
Triatoma guasayana.Setae: of rostrum sparse and short, those of apical segment more elongate, but not longer than diameter of segment.
Triatoma guasayana.Spiracles: close but not adjacent to connexival suture.
Triatoma guasayana.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of males, absent in females.
Triatoma guasayana.Submedian carinae: not prominent, evanescent on posterior third of hind lobe.
Triatoma guasayana.Tibiae: from yellow to brown, with narrow basal annulus very pale, and apex darkest; yellow portions of legs of varying color intensity.
Triatoma guasayana.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened in females, delicately striate transversally.

Triatoma guazu.Abdomen: wide , with most urotergites narrowly exposed.
Triatoma guazu.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at middle of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma guazu.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular (1:0,25), postocular with sides straight, converging toward behind.
Triatoma guazu.Anterior lobe: weakly sculptured, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma guazu.Clypeus: narrow, only slightly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma guazu.Connexivum: black, disc of each segment with large subrectangular yellow spot, extending ventrally from outer margin to connexival suture and enclosing spiracle on adjacent portion of urosternite; dorsally, yellow spot not attaining connexival suture.
Triatoma guazu.Eyes: large, in lateral view slightly surpassing level of lower and but little distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma guazu.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma guazu.Fore: femora 6,3 times as long as wide.
Triatoma guazu.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, extending considerably beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma guazu.Head: black, rugose, weakly granulose, twice as long as wide (1:0,5), and longer than pronotum (1:0,9).
Triatoma guazu.Hemelytra: attaining apex of eighth urotergite, their overall color pale.
Triatoma guazu.Length: 30 , width of pronotum 7 , of abdomen 12 Overall color black, with yellow markings on neck, corium and connexivum .
Triatoma guazu.Neck: black, with l+ 1 lateral spots yellow.
Triatoma guazu.Ocelli: large, their distance from eyes equal to their length.
Triatoma guazu.Overall color: black, with yellow markings on neck, corium and connexivum .
Triatoma guazu.Posterior lobe: rugose; submedian carinae extending to posterior third of posterior lobe.
Triatoma guazu.Posterior process: of scutellum short, one-half as long as main body of sclerite, narrowly rounded distally, horizontal, with apex slightly downtumed.
Triatoma guazu.Rostrum: dark reddish brown; first article falling slightly short of level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma guazu.Scutellum: black, strongly rugose, median depression shallow, small.
Triatoma guazu.Spiracles: close to but not adjoining connexival suture .
Triatoma guazu.Venter: convex, slightly flattened longitudinally along middle, delicately striate transversally, with sparse short setae.

Triatoma hegneri.Abdomen: flattened below longitudinally along middle, but flattened portion not sharply divided from lateral rounded portion of venter.
Triatoma hegneri.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma hegneri.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (l:0,3); postocular with sides subparallel, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma hegneri.Corium: without perceptible setae, yellow, with large central dark spot of variable size but not reaching costal margin; apex of corium dark.
Triatoma hegneri.Eyes: large, in lateral view surpassing level of lower but not quite attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma hegneri.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus, appearing bare,
Triatoma hegneri.Fore: and mid femora with one pair of subapical denticles.
Triatoma hegneri.Genae: tapering distally, almost attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma hegneri.Head: transversely rugose dorsally, punctate, about twice as long as wide across eyes (l:0,45-0,50) and slightly shorter than pronotum (1:1,1).
Triatoma hegneri.Legs: of medium length, fore femur six times as long as wide.
Triatoma hegneri.Length: 28-29 ; width of pronotum 6,5-7,0 , of abdomen 10,5-11,0 mm .
Triatoma hegneri.Neck: dark, with l + l orangeyellow spots laterally.
Triatoma hegneri.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with orange-yellow spots on neck and connexivum and yellow markings on corium.
Triatoma hegneri.Posterior lobe: conspicuously rugose, in some specimens sublateral carinae crossed by rugosities; carinae not attaining posterior margin.
Triatoma hegneri.Posterior process: stout, about as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, slightly deflected apically.
Triatoma hegneri.Pronotum: with anterior lobe black, posterior lobe contrastingly dark reddish brown.
Triatoma hegneri.Rostrum: with very short, inconspicuous hairs, becoming longer only on third segment.
Triatoma hegneri.Scutellum: with central portion depressed, rugose, not limited by distinct ridges.
Triatoma hegneri.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by from one to two times their diameter.
Triatoma hegneri.Venter: and connexivum uniformly dark, or connexival segments on posteroextemal angle each with small orange yellow spot of variable extension, extending onto connexival suture

Triatoma incrassata.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind level of center of anteocular region.
Triatoma incrassata.Anteocular region: over twice as long as postocular (1:0,4), postocular with sides rounded but less prominently so than in barberi, verrucose.
Triatoma incrassata.Anterior lobe: distinctly elevated, granulose on rough areas, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma incrassata.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, very strongly swollen posteriorly.
Triatoma incrassata.Connexivum: entirely yellow ventrally and broadly along entire connexival margin dorsally; inner portion of dorsal connexival segments of general body
Triatoma incrassata.Eyes: remote from level of dorsal and almost attaining level of under surface of head.
Triatoma incrassata.First antennal segment: extending beyond two-thirds of distance between its base and level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma incrassata.Fore: and mid femora with four to five small denticles subapically.
Triatoma incrassata.Genae: narrowly tapered anteriorly, almost attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma incrassata.Head: granulose, distinctly convex above, slightly less than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,6), and distinctly shorter than pronotum (1:1,2).
Triatoma incrassata.Hemelytra: falling short of apex of abdomen by 0,5 in female, practically attaining apex of abdomen in male; of general body color, but membrane dark brown, fumose, somewhat lighter colored along base.
Triatoma incrassata.Legs: uniformly dark, short and stout; fore femora 3,5-3,7 times as long as wide, minutely granulose.
Triatoma incrassata.Length: of male 17,5, of female 19,0-19,8 ; width of pronotum of male 4,0, of female 4,5 , of abdomen of male 6,0, of females 6,5 Head granulose, distinctly convex above, slightly less than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,6), and distinctly shorter than pronotum (1:1,2).
Triatoma incrassata.Posterior lobe: rugose, submedian carinae falling short of hind margin.
Triatoma incrassata.Pronotum: uniformly dark, trapezoi dal, with sides conspicuously diverging toward behind, delicately carinate, only faintly constricted at level of transverse sulcus.
Triatoma incrassata.Rostrum: with relatively short hairs, the latter becoming longer at apex of second and uniformly long on third segment.
Triatoma incrassata.Scutellum: rugose, central portion distinctly impressed, limited laterally by sharp carinae.
Triatoma incrassata.Spiracles: close but not adjacent to connexival suture.

Triatoma indictiva.Abdomen: except connexivum uniformly dark; ventrally with abundant but short pilosity; delicately striate transversally.
Triatoma indictiva.Antenniferous tubercles: situated on basal third of anteocular region.
Triatoma indictiva.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (1:0,4).
Triatoma indictiva.Anterior lobe: with I+ I low but distinct discal tubercles; lateral tubercles absent.
Triatoma indictiva.Anterolateral angles: of pronotum short and stout, conical or blunt and widely rounded apically.
Triatoma indictiva.Connexivum: from piceous to black; posterior sixth or seventh of each connexival segment narrowly reddish, reddish color extending on to suture; markings identical ventrally and dorsally, not extending on urosternites.
Triatoma indictiva.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Triatoma indictiva.Femora: of first and second pairs with I+ I subapical pointed denticles.
Triatoma indictiva.First antennal segment: falling short of apex of clypeus; second segment only with adpressed hairs shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma indictiva.Head: granulose, about twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,5-0,6), and as long as or slightly shorter than pronotum (1:1,0-1,1).
Triatoma indictiva.Legs: uniformly dark, stout, fore femora about six times as long as wide.
Triatoma indictiva.Length: of male 18,0-20,5 , of female 18,5-22,0 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 4,5-5,0 , of female 5,0-5,5 ; maximum width of abdomen of male 6,5-7,5 , of female 7-8 Overall color from piceous to black, with reddish markings on connexivum; base and subapical region of corium faintly lightened, hind lobe of pronotum equally somewhat lighter, possibly due to fading of preserved specimens; lighter areas in no case distinctly contrasting with dark areas.
Triatoma indictiva.Neck: with I+ I lateral reddish spots.
Triatoma indictiva.Ocelli: comparatively small, their diameter smaller than their distance from eyes.
Triatoma indictiva.Overall color: from piceous to black, with reddish markings on connexivum; base and subapical region of corium faintly lightened, hind lobe of pronotum equally somewhat lighter, possibly due to fading of preserved specimens; lighter areas in no case distinctly contrasting with dark areas.
Triatoma indictiva.Pilosity: inconspicuous, most distinct on under surface of abdomen and on legs.
Triatoma indictiva.Posterior lobe: rugose; submedian carinae extending along entire length of hind lobe.
Triatoma indictiva.Pronotum: uniformly piceous or black, almost imperceptibly lightened on posterior lobe.
Triatoma indictiva.Ratio width of eye to synthlipsis: 1:1,35-1,70 (1:0,8-1,1 in specimens from west coast of Mexico).
Triatoma indictiva.Rostrum: only with short, scattered hairs; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second segment attaining level of neck.
Triatoma indictiva.Scutellum: heavily rugose, with cordiform central depression, sublateral carinae acute, continuous.
Triatoma indictiva.Spiracles: close to but not contiguous with connexival suture .
Triatoma indictiva.Tibiae: of first and second pairs of male with minute spongy fossula, absent in female.
Triatoma indictiva.Venter: from convex to slightly flattened on center

Triatoma infestans.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma infestans.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,3), the latter with sides rounded.
Triatoma infestans.Anterior lobe: with I+ 1 small discal tubercles, their apex in many cases yellowish, and in some specimens with l + 1 feeble posterosublateral tubercles; lateral tubercles invariably present although small.
Triatoma infestans.Connexivum: black, each segment with large yellowspot, remote from anterior but closely approaching posterior border of segment and adjoining connexival suture; yellow area brieflyextending on urostemite mainly at area of
Triatoma infestans.Corium: in most specimens with one pale yellow spot subbasally and invariably with yellow subapical spot situated at apex of cell formed by r and m.
Triatoma infestans.Eyes: in lateral view very close to or attaining level of under surface of head but remote from level of its upper surface.
Triatoma infestans.First antennal segment: approaching but not attaining level of apex of clypeus; second segment with numerous adpressed bristles not more than half as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma infestans.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of jugae,
Triatoma infestans.Fore: and mid femora with 1 + l small subapical denticles, very rarely present also on hind femur.
Triatoma infestans.Genae: rounded distally, slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma infestans.Head: black, delicately rugose and sparsely granulose.
Triatoma infestans.Hemelytra: falling short of apex of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Triatoma infestans.Integument: sparsely granulose; pilosity short and sparse.
Triatoma infestans.Legs: with fore femur from five to six times as long as wide.
Triatoma infestans.Length: of male 21-26 , of female 26-29 ; width of pronotum of male 5,5-6,5 , of female 6,0-6,5 ; width of abdomen of male 8-10 , of female 8,5-10,0 Overall color black (dark brown in many museum specimens), with yellow markings on corium, legs, and connexivum.
Triatoma infestans.Neck: black, with I+ 1 lateral spots yellow.
Triatoma infestans.Overall color: black (dark brown in many museum specimens), with yellow markings on corium, legs, and connexivum.
Triatoma infestans.Posterior process: of scutellum elongate, conical, wide at base, narrowly tapering apically, horizontal, slightly shorter than main body of scutellum.
Triatoma infestans.Rostrum: as dark as or distinctly lighter colored than head.
Triatoma infestans.Scutellum: entirely black, strongly rugose, with distinct central depression.
Triatoma infestans.Setae: of rostrum very short on first and most of under surface of second segment.
Triatoma infestans.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of males, absent in females.
Triatoma infestans.Submedian carinae: extending to posterior third of hind lobe but evanescent before posterior margin.
Triatoma infestans.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened longitudinally along middle, rather coarsely striate transversally, sparsely and inconspicuously setose.

Triatoma lecticularia.Abdomen: convex below in male, from convex to distinctly flattened in center longitudinally in female.
Triatoma lecticularia.Antenniferous tubercles: situated on posterior third of anteocular region, comparatively close to eyes.
Triatoma lecticularia.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (1:0,35), postocular with sides convex, converging posteriorly.
Triatoma lecticularia.Corium: with large central spot of general color, with basal and subapical spots orange-yellow; outer border of corium narrowly bordered with light color; entire surface of corium with conspicuous adpressed black setae .
Triatoma lecticularia.Eyes: in lateral view attaining or slightly surpassing level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma lecticularia.First antennal segment: falling short of apex of clypeus; second segment with short hairs only.
Triatoma lecticularia.Fore: and mid femora with 2+2 very short denticles subapically.
Triatoma lecticularia.Head: granulose, uniformly dark, conspicuously convex between eyes; slightly less than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,6) and slightly shorter than pronotum (1:1,1-1,2).
Triatoma lecticularia.Legs: hairy, dark, but with coxae in many cases lightened.
Triatoma lecticularia.Length: of male 16-22 , of female 18-23 , width of pronotum of male 3,7-5,5 , of female 4,2-6,0 ; width of abdomen of male 5-8 , of female 6,5-8,5 Overall color piceous, with orange or orange-yellow markings on pronotum, pleura, corium, connexivum, and ventral surface of abdomen.
Triatoma lecticularia.Overall color: piceous, with orange or orange-yellow markings on pronotum, pleura, corium, connexivum, and ventral surface of abdomen.
Triatoma lecticularia.Pilosity: well developed on entire body including corium.
Triatoma lecticularia.Posterior lobe: rugose, with conspicuous dark setae on entire surface; submedian carinae evanescent posteriorly.
Triatoma lecticularia.Pronotum: dark, with 1+ 1 orange bands on lateral margins of posterior lobe, narrow anteriorly, becoming wider posteriorly and extending onto humeri; posterior margin of pronotum in some specimens lighter colored, as are submedian carinae and collar with anterolateral processes; in some specimens, dark areas of posterior lobe of pronotum reduced to one wide median and 1 + 1 sublateral stripes, with orange color extending as 1 + 1 wide lateral and 1+ 1 submedian spots occupying carinae and triangularly widened posteriorly, confluent behind with lateral markings.
Triatoma lecticularia.Rostrum: conspicuously hairy, especially on second and third segments; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of neck.
Triatoma lecticularia.Scutellum: dark; central portion only very slightly depressed, limited by irregular carinae; apical process shorter than main body of scutellum, setose, tapering distally, its apex deflected.
Triatoma lecticularia.Tibiae: of first and second pair of male with small spongy fossulae, absent in female.
Triatoma lecticularia.Venter: conspicuously pilose, piceous with orangeyellow markings at level of light-colored connexival markings, covering intersegmental sutures and extending along lateral borders of urosternites; in some cases, entire venter tinged with orange, especially on basal half.

Triatoma lenti.Abdomen: unusually wide ; lateral portions of urotergites not covered by hemelytra.
Triatoma lenti.Antenniferous tubercles: unusually long and slender, their apex situated slightly before middle of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma lenti.Anteocular region: four to five times as long as postocular (1:0,20-0,25), postocular with sides slightly rounded, distinctly converging toward behind.
Triatoma lenti.Anterior lobe: feebly sculptured, not granulose, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma lenti.Clypeus: elongate, gradually widened on posterior half.
Triatoma lenti.Connexivum: black, with disc of each segment occupied by yellow or orange-yellow spot; size of light-colored spots variable , attaining or not connexival suture, and almost invariably remote from intersegmental sutures and generally closer to anterior than to posterior
Triatoma lenti.Corium: and clavus black, membrane fumose, dark brown, with black veins; small yellowish stripe between apical portion of corium and adjacent area of membrane.
Triatoma lenti.Eyes: small, in lateral view not attaining level of lower and remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma lenti.First antennal segment: attaining level of apex of clypeus; second segment with numerous adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma lenti.Fore: femora seven to eight times as long as wide, conspicuously narrowed submedially .
Triatoma lenti.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, slightly projecting beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma lenti.Head: black, feebly rugose and granulosepunctate, approximately twice as long as wide (1:0,45-0,50), and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,80-0,85).
Triatoma lenti.Hemelytra: in most cases conspicuously shorter than abdomen; in males generally not extending beyond base or middle of seventh urotergite; in female, hemelytra extending to middle or to apical portion of sixth urotergite.
Triatoma lenti.Length: of male 25-26 , of female 26,5-27,5 ; width of pronotum of male and female 5,5-6,0 ; width of abdomen of male 8,5-l0,0 ; of female ll mm .
Triatoma lenti.Neck: black, with pair of lateral orange-yellow spots.
Triatoma lenti.Overall color: black, with yellow or orangeyellow markings on neck and connexivum, rarely on corium.
Triatoma lenti.Rostrum: black; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle; second segment extending approximately to level of center of eye or slightly longer, but invariably falling short of level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma lenti.Scutellum: with median depression shallow, its posterior process elongate, about as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, horizontal, rugose at base, rounded apically.
Triatoma lenti.Submedian carinae: extending over twothirds or three-fourths of lobe, evanescent posteriorly.
Triatoma lenti.Urosternites: dark brown or black, except small yellow areas enclosing spiracles.
Triatoma lenti.Venter: convex, almost imperceptibly flattened in female, delicately striate transversally, with sparse short setae.

Triatoma leopoldi.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (l:0,35); postocular with sides slightly rounded, convergent posteriorly.
Triatoma leopoldi.Anterior lobe: granulose on elevated areas, with obsolescent discal and without lateral tubercles.
Triatoma leopoldi.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, abruptly widened on basal half.
Triatoma leopoldi.Connexivum: yellowish or orange-red, dorsally and ventrally with large dark spot at center of eachsegment, spots not attaining outer border orintersegmental
Triatoma leopoldi.Corium: yellowish red at base and subapically.
Triatoma leopoldi.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercles, second attaining level of hind border of head.
Triatoma leopoldi.Fore: and mid femora with 3-4 subapical denticles.
Triatoma leopoldi.Head: granulose and slightly rugose dorsally, dark reddish brown with 1 + 1 longitudinal black stripes on dorsum sublaterally.
Triatoma leopoldi.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen in male; in female extending only slightly beyond center of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma leopoldi.Legs: dark reddish brown, stout; fore femur five times as long as wide.
Triatoma leopoldi.Length: of male 19,5-20,5 , of female 21-23 ; width of pronotum of male5,0-5,5, of female 5,5-6,5 ; width of abdomen of male 7,5 , of female 8,5-9,5 Overall color dark brown or black, with yellowish or orange-red markings on pronotum, corium and connexivum.
Triatoma leopoldi.Membrane: as dark as darkest area of corium.
Triatoma leopoldi.Overall color: dark brown or black, with yellowish or orange-red markings on pronotum, corium and connexivum.
Triatoma leopoldi.Posterior process: as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subcylindrical, slightly compressed laterally.
Triatoma leopoldi.Pronotum: dark brown or black, with collar and anterolateral processes, lateral margins, elevated areas of anterior lobe, and large central spot and lateral areas of posterior lobe, light reddish brown.
Triatoma leopoldi.Rostrum: with short inconspicuous setae except distally on second and on third segment, setae not forming brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma leopoldi.Scutellum: with sides dark, central area and posterior process red.
Triatoma leopoldi.Second antennal segment: only with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma leopoldi.Tibiae: of first and second pair of legs of male with small spongy fossulae, absent in females.
