Triatoma leopoldi.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened longitudinally along middle in male, more distinctly but not conspicuously so in female.

Triatoma limai.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma limai.Anteocular region: about two and one-half times as long as postocular (l:0,40-0,45); postocular with sides distinctly convex, angularly projecting.
Triatoma limai.Anterior lobe: delicately granulose on elevated portions, and without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma limai.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum sublaterally directed, subconical, very short.
Triatoma limai.Clypeus: narrow, gradually widened on posterior half.
Triatoma limai.Connexivum: pale yellow, with transverse black stripe straddling intersegmental suture, the portion occupying hind border of anterior segment smaller than that on anterior portion of posterior segment.
Triatoma limai.Corium: dark brown or blackish, with large basal and apical areas light yellow, connected by narrow yellow line along costal margin.
Triatoma limai.Eyes: in lateral view surpassing level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma limai.First antennal segment: very short, not projecting beyond middle of genae.
Triatoma limai.First rostral segment: very short, not attaining basal third of distance between apex of antenniferous tubercle and apex of head.
Triatoma limai.Fore: and mid femora with one pair of small subapical denticles.
Triatoma limai.Genae: large, rounded distally, slightly projecting beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma limai.Head: of general body color, distinctly rugose and granulose, with setae- short, inapparent.
Triatoma limai.Hemelytra: attaining or closely approaching apex of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma limai.Legs: uniformly dark, comparatively short; fore femur six times as long as wide.
Triatoma limai.Length: of male 15-17, of female 16,5-18,0 ; width of pronotum of male 4 , of female 4,0-4,5 , width of abdomen of male 6 , of female 6,0-6,5 Overall color from dark brown to black, with pale yellow markings on corium and connexivum.
Triatoma limai.Membrane: light brown, fumose, much lighter than dark portions of corium; veins of membrane conspicuously dark.
Triatoma limai.Neck: dark, with a pair of lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma limai.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with pale yellow markings on corium and connexivum.
Triatoma limai.Posterior process: subcylindrical, horizontal or slightly upward bent at tip, more than half as long as main body of scutellum, narrowly tapering apically.
Triatoma limai.Pronotum: uniformly dark brown, in some cases humeri slightly lighter.
Triatoma limai.Rostrum: of same color or only slightly lighter than head.
Triatoma limai.Scutellum: of general body color, with distinct median depression.
Triatoma limai.Second antennal segment: comparatively thick, very slightly flattened, beset with longitudinally arranged stout adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma limai.Setae: of rostrum very short and sparse, except scattered longer ones at apex of third segment.
Triatoma limai.Submedian carinae: extending to middle of posterior lobe.
Triatoma limai.Venter: rounded in both sexes, delicately striate transversally, sparsely and inconspicuously pilose.

Triatoma longipennis.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma longipennis.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (1:0,30-0,35); postocular with sides subparallel, very slightly rounded.
Triatoma longipennis.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, shortly and abruptly widened on basal half.
Triatoma longipennis.Connexivum: dark brown or black, each segment on posterior half or third with yellow or orange-red irregularly shaped marking adjoining abdominal margin and extending or not to connexival suture.
Triatoma longipennis.Corium: with short (0,1 ) adpressed setae , or somewhat longer (0,2 ) decumbent ones.
Triatoma longipennis.Eyes: in side view from barely attaining to slightly surpassing level of under surface and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma longipennis.First antennal segment: from attaining to slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus; second segment with decumbent stiff setae about as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma longipennis.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, either attaining but not surpassing level of apex of clypeus, or falling slightly short of it.
Triatoma longipennis.Head: black, weakly granulose, shallowly rugose transversally along center above, with numerous forwardly inclined setae.
Triatoma longipennis.Hemelytra: and wings fully developed although appearing narrow as compared to unusually wide abdomen, leaving extreme lateral portions of urotergites exposed.
Triatoma longipennis.Legs: as in phyllosoma; fore femora 6,1-6,9 times as long as wide.
Triatoma longipennis.Length: of male 29-34 , of female 30-37 ; width of pronotum of male 6,5-7,0 , of female 6,5-8,0 ; width of abdomen of male 12,0-13,5 , of female 13-15 Body unusually wide.
Triatoma longipennis.Neck: laterally with I+ I orange-red markings.
Triatoma longipennis.Overall color: dark brown or black, with yellow or orange spots on neck, rarely on humeri, on corium and on connexivum.
Triatoma longipennis.Pronotum: uniformly dark brown or black, in some specimens with small orange spot on humeri.
Triatoma longipennis.Spiracles: remote from connexival suture by one to several times their diameter.
Triatoma longipennis.Venter: convex, delicately but shallowly striate transversally; pilosity of venter varying from short and decumbent (in specimens with short setae on metastemum) to long and semierect (in specimens with long hairs on metasternum).

Triatoma maculata.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma maculata.Anteocular region: from three to four times as long as postocular (l:0,25-0,35), postocular almost entirely occupied by ocelliferous tubercles with ocelli, its sides rounded but strongly converging toward behind.
Triatoma maculata.Anterior lobe: entirely dark, or with discal and lateral tubercles, or only discal tubercles, or also with small area on each side between base of longitudinal carinae and lateral tubercles, orange or yellow.
Triatoma maculata.Anterolateral projections: elongate subtriangular, compressed dorsoventrally, anterolaterally directed.
Triatoma maculata.Connexivum: from light yellow to orangeyellow or reddish, with wide transverse black bands on intersegmental sutures, occupying entire width of connexival segments.
Triatoma maculata.Corium: with more or less extensive yellowish or orange longitudinal markings intermixed with dark areas.
Triatoma maculata.Eyes: very large, in lateral view considerable surpassing level of under, and almost attaining level of upper, surface of head.
Triatoma maculata.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma maculata.First rostral segment: not quite attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma maculata.Fore: femur 4,5-5,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma maculata.Genae: tapering apically but not pointed, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus .
Triatoma maculata.Head: comparatively wide, very high posteriorly in lateral view, delicately rugose and granulose, especially at sides.
Triatoma maculata.Hemelytra: closely approaching or attaining apex of urotergite VII, in both sexes; their color from light to very dark brown , with veins of membrane and of central portion of corium contrastingly blackish.
Triatoma maculata.Integument: almost glabrous, setae very short and sparse.
Triatoma maculata.Length: of male 16,5-21,5 , of female 17,5-22,0 ; width of pronotum of male 4-5 , of female 4,0-5,5 , width ofabdomen of male and female 5,5-8,0 Overall color from dark brown to black, with light yellow, orange-yellow or light red marks on head, neck, thorax , corium and connexivum.
Triatoma maculata.Membrane: fumose, lighter colored than dark portions of corium.
Triatoma maculata.Neck: with pair of lateral light-colored spots.
Triatoma maculata.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with light yellow, orange-yellow or light red marks on head, neck, thorax , corium and connexivum.
Triatoma maculata.Posterior lobe: dark, in most specimens with three pairs of yellow or orangeyellow spots, one pair anterosublateral, one humeral, and one posteromedian.
Triatoma maculata.Posterior process: of scutellum subcylindrical, about as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, rounded apically.
Triatoma maculata.Pronotum: not distinctly granulose, its overall color from dark brown to black.
Triatoma maculata.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule, relatively stout.
Triatoma maculata.Scutellum: entirely dark, coarsely rugose, with distinct central depression; sides of scutellum swollen.
Triatoma maculata.Second antennal segment: slightly compressed, beset with numerous short adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma maculata.Setae: of rostrum short and sparse on first and second and very numerous and elongate on third segment, as long as diameter of same.
Triatoma maculata.Spiracles: close but not adjacent to connexival suture.
Triatoma maculata.Submedian carinae: extending close to hind margin of sclerite.
Triatoma maculata.Tibiae: of first and second pair of legs of male with spongy fossulae , absent in female.
Triatoma maculata.Urosternites: from dark brown to black, except small lateral yellow area enclosing spiracles.
Triatoma maculata.Venter: convex, slightly flattened longitudinally along middle in females, delicately striate transversally, sparsely setose.

Triatoma matogrossensis.Abdomen: wide, lateral portions of urotergites exposed in many specimens.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Antenniferous tubercles: relatively slender, situated at center of anteocular region.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Anteocular region: four to five times as long as postocular (1:0,2-0,25), postocular with sides almost straight, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Anterior lobe: sparsely granulose, with discal tubercles from small but distinct to forming inconspicuous elevations.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Anterolateral projections: shortly conical, rounded or almost pointed apically.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Clypeus: narrow, gradually widened on posterior half.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Connexivum: light yellow or yellowish brown, dorsally with narrow transverse markings straddling intersegmental sutures; these markings very narrowly constricted at middle, widened along connexival suture and in some cases along outer margin posterior to intersegmental sutures.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Corium: light brownish yellow, with area limited by Sc, R + M and R, a subapical spot, and part of veins, dark brown.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Eyes: in lateral view attaining or closely approaching level of lower surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma matogrossensis.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment with numerous adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma matogrossensis.First rostral segment: falling considerably short of level of apex of antenniferous tubercle; second segment extending to level of posterior border of eyes.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Fore: and mid femora with one pair of small denticles subapically.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Head: dark brown, feebly rugose and granulose-punctate, more than twice as long as wide (1:0,4), and much longer than pronotum (1:0,75).
Triatoma matogrossensis.Hemelytra: approaching or attaining posterior margin of seventh urotergite in male, approaching base of seventh urotergite in female.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Legs: light yellowish brown; femora subapically with faint but perceptible dark spot or annulus; apex of tibiae darkened.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Length: of male 24,5-28,0 , of female 28-30 ; width of pronotum of male 4,8-6,0, of female 5,5-6,0 ; width of abdomen of male 7-9 , of female 9-10 Overall color dark brown or dark reddish brown, with light yellowish brown areas on neck, hind lobe of pronotum, hemelytra, legs, and connexivum.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Membrane: fumose, light grayish brown, darker than light areas of corium; veins of membrane dark brown.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Neck: dark, with pair of lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Overall color: dark brown or dark reddish brown, with light yellowish brown areas on neck, hind lobe of pronotum, hemelytra, legs, and connexivum.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Pilosity: short and sparse, even on legs.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Pronotum: dark brown or reddish brown, with l+ 1 yellowish brown spots on humeri.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Rostrum: yellowish brown, lighter than head capsule, very slender.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Setae: of rostrum short and sparse, only slightly longer at base of upper surface of third segment.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of male, absent in female.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Submedian carinae: extending to posterior third of hind lobe, evanescent posteriorly.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Urosternites: dark brown except small yellowish area enclosing spiracles.
Triatoma matogrossensis.Venter: distinctly flattened longitudinally along middle in female, slightly so in male, delicately striate transversally, with distinct although short golden setae.

Triatoma mazzottii.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind center of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma mazzottii.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,3), postocular with sides almost straight, subparallel.
Triatoma mazzottii.Connexivum: black, posterior third or half of each segment with subquadrate orange red marking.
Triatoma mazzottii.Corium: with long (0,3-0,4 ) decumbent hairs , its surface dull black,with one basal triangular and one subapicalsubquadrate spot red or orange-red.
Triatoma mazzottii.Eyes: in lateral view invariably attaining level of lower surface and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma mazzottii.First antennal segment: extending distinctly beyond level of apex of clypeus; second segment with decumbent stiff setae about as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma mazzottii.First rostral segment: extending to level of middle of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to level of neck.
Triatoma mazzottii.Fore: femur 7,5-8,3 times as long as wide.
Triatoma mazzottii.Head: black, faintly rugose along center above, not granulose, with long hairs.
Triatoma mazzottii.Hemelytra: and wings of normal size, but leaving entire connexivum and lateral portions of urotergites of unusually wide abdomen exposed.
Triatoma mazzottii.Length: of male 33 , of female 34 Width of pronotum of male and female 7 , of abdomen of male 13 , of female 14 Body unusually wide.
Triatoma mazzottii.Neck: laterally with I+ l reddish markings.
Triatoma mazzottii.Overall color: dark brown to black, with orange-red markings on corium and connexivum.
Triatoma mazzottii.Setae: numerous, most delicately hairlike , up to 0,5 in length.
Triatoma mazzottii.Spiracles: remote from connexival suture by a distance equal to from two to three times their diameter.
Triatoma mazzottii.Venter: convex, delicately and shallowly striate transversally, with numerous decumbent long hairs.

Triatoma melanocephala.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma melanocephala.Anteocular region: from two and onehalf to three times as wide as postocular (1:0,30,4), postocular with sides straight, converging toward behind.
Triatoma melanocephala.Anterior lobe: with one pair each of small but distinct discal and lateral tubercles.
Triatoma melanocephala.Anterolateral projections: subconical, somewhat compressed dorsoventrally, their outer border yellowish.
Triatoma melanocephala.Eyes: in lateral view attaining but not surpassing level of under surface and remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma melanocephala.First antennal segment: extending slightly beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma melanocephala.Genae: narrowly tapering apically but not pointed, attaining or very slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma melanocephala.Head: black, rugose, delicately granulose, less than twice as long as wide (1:0,6) and approximately as long as pronotum.
Triatoma melanocephala.Hemelytra: attaining posterior border of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma melanocephala.Length: of male 25,5-26,5 , of female 28 ; width of pronotum of male 6-7 , of female 7 ; width of abdomen of male 9,5-10,0 , of female 10 Overall color from dark brown to black, with yellowish markings on neck, pronotum, hemelytra and connexivum.
Triatoma melanocephala.Neck: dark, with a pair of yellow spots laterally.
Triatoma melanocephala.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with yellowish markings on neck, pronotum, hemelytra and connexivum.
Triatoma melanocephala.Posterior process: of scutellum subcylindrical, about as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal; apex slightly upturned, distally rounded.
Triatoma melanocephala.Pronotum: dark brown, with I+ l yellowish brown oval markings on disc of anterior half of posterior lobe, laterad of submedian carinae.
Triatoma melanocephala.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule; first segment extending to level of insertion of antennae, second extending slightly beyond level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma melanocephala.Second antennal segment: (remaining not preserved) about three times as long as first, with semierect setae almost as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma melanocephala.Spiracles: very close to or adjoining connexival suture.
Triatoma melanocephala.Submedian carinae: relatively short, evanescent on posterior third of posterior lobe.
Triatoma melanocephala.Urosternites: uniformly dark, except minute yellow spot enclosing spiracles.
Triatoma melanocephala.Venter: convex, delicately striate transversally, with short setae.

Triatoma mexicana.Abdomen: convex, flattened ventrally on segments III-V, flattened portion not limited by a ridge.
Triatoma mexicana.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly bel;ind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma mexicana.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular, the latter with sides faintly rounded, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma mexicana.Anterior lobe: smooth, ridges not prominent; discal tubercles present, elongate conical.
Triatoma mexicana.Connexivum: yellow, with irregularly shaped black markings on anterior third or half of each segment adjacent to intersegmental suture.
Triatoma mexicana.Corium: yellow, including deflexed portion at its base, with large black spot along R extending almost
Triatoma mexicana.Eyes: prominent, in lateral view extending below level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma mexicana.First antennal segment: falling considerably short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma mexicana.First rostral segment: attaining level of center of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of base of neck.
Triatoma mexicana.Fore: and mid femora with a pair of small subapical denticles.
Triatoma mexicana.Genae: narrowly tapered apically, not attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma mexicana.General color: black, with yellow markings on neck, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma mexicana.Head: long and narrow, longer than pronotum (l:0,85), delicately and sparsely granulose, dorsum transversally rugose along middle.
Triatoma mexicana.Hemelytra: from approaching to slightly surpassing apex of abdomen.
Triatoma mexicana.Length: 25-26 ; width of thorax 5,5-6,0 , of abdomen 9-10 General color black, with yellow markings on neck, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma mexicana.Neck: black, with I+l lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma mexicana.Posterior lobe: rugose, with lateral portions flaring; sides forming conspicuous angle with sides of fore lobe.
Triatoma mexicana.Posterior process: about as long as main body of scutellum, cylindrical, declinate apically.
Triatoma mexicana.Rostrum: slender, with very short and sparse setae, becoming slightly longer on third segment.
Triatoma mexicana.Scutellum: with central portion depressed, rugose, sclerite carinate laterally.
Triatoma mexicana.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by approximately twice their diameter.
Triatoma mexicana.Submedian carinae: not attaining hind border of pronotum.
Triatoma mexicana.Venter: polished, minutely striate transversally, its setae inconspicuous.

Triatoma migrans.Abdomen: rounded below although only very slightly so along center longitudinally.
Triatoma migrans.Anteocular region: approximately three times as long as postocular (l:0,35), postocular with sides rounded, subsemicircular.
Triatoma migrans.Anterior lobe: granulose on elevated areas, with obsolescent discal and without lateral tubercles.
Triatoma migrans.Anterolateral angles: with unusually elongate, fingerlike, distally rounded projections.
Triatoma migrans.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, abruptly widened on basal half which is conspicuously elevated in side view.
Triatoma migrans.Connexivum: reddish, dorsally and ventrally with subrectangular transverse dark spot at center of each
Triatoma migrans.Corium: dark at base, at apex and along extemal margin, and with irregularly shaped large central spot dark.
Triatoma migrans.Eyes: distinctly surpassing level of under surface and close to level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma migrans.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercles, second attaining level of hind border of head.
Triatoma migrans.Fore: and mid femora with 3-4 subapical denticles.
Triatoma migrans.Genae: rounded apically in lateral view, considerably surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma migrans.Head: granulose and slightly rugose dorsally, reddish brown with 1 + l longitudinal black stripes on dorsum sublaterally.
Triatoma migrans.Hemelytra: extending to apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
Triatoma migrans.Legs: dark reddish brown, stout; fore femora 4,0-4,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma migrans.Length: of male 22,5-24,5 (very rarely 20 ), of female 23,5-25,0 ; width of pronotum of male 6,5-7,0 , of female 6,5-7,5 ; width of abdomen of male 9-10 , of female 6,5-7,0 Overall color from yellowish to reddish brown, with dark brown or black markings on head, pronotum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma migrans.Membrane: as dark as dark portions of corium.
Triatoma migrans.Ocelli: unusually close to eyes, distance from ocellus to eye shorter than diameter of ocellus.
Triatoma migrans.Overall color: from yellowish to reddish brown, with dark brown or black markings on head, pronotum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma migrans.Posterior process: only two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subconical, strongly tapering from wide base to narrow apex.
Triatoma migrans.Pronotum: reddish brown; dark brown or black on smooth areas of anterior lobe and with four dark longitudinal stripes on posterior lobe, I+ I in areas between submedian carinae and outer border and 1 + 1 in space between carinae, adjacent to same.
Triatoma migrans.Rostrum: with short, inconspicuous setae except distally on second and on third segment, but not forming brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma migrans.Scutellum: with variable color pattern, in many cases black on anterior half and with apical process light colored, but in some specimens either color more or less widely extended.
Triatoma migrans.Second antennal segment: only with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma migrans.Spiracles: adjacent to connexival suture or distant from same by diameter of spiracles.
Triatoma migrans.Tibiae: of first and second pair of males with small spongy fossulae, absent in females.

Triatoma neotomae.Antenniferous tubercles: situated closer to eyes than to level of apex of anteocular region.
Triatoma neotomae.Anteocular region: from two to three times as long as postocular (1:0,30,45); postocular with sides rounded, widest at middle, somewhat convergent toward behind.
Triatoma neotomae.Anterior lobe: slightly elevated, polished, without discal or lateral tubercles, very sparsely granulose.
Triatoma neotomae.Anterolateral angles: in shape of dorsoventrally flattened flap, broadly rounded and very short.
Triatoma neotomae.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, abruptly and strongly widened toward posterior half.
Triatoma neotomae.Corium: without perceptible setae, orange or pale yellow with large dark central spot which is longer than wide; dark also base of clavus and apex of corium.
Triatoma neotomae.Eyes: in lateral view remote from level of upper but very close to level of under surface of head.
Triatoma neotomae.First antennal segment: short, not attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma neotomae.Fore: and mid femora with 2+2 denticles subapically.
Triatoma neotomae.Genae: conspicuously rugose transversally, tapered apically, almost attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma neotomae.General color: from dark brown to blackish, with orange-yellow markings on neck, humeral angles and connexivum, the corium partially light yellow.
Triatoma neotomae.Head: heavily rugose, slightly granulose, distinctly convex above eyes, not over twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,50,6), and as long as or slightly shorter than pronotum (1:1,0-1,1).
Triatoma neotomae.Hemelytra: attammg or surpassing middle of eighth urotergite.
Triatoma neotomae.Legs: of general body color, stout; fore femora 3,6-3,8 times as long as wide.
Triatoma neotomae.Length: of males 16,5-17,5 , of females 17,5-19,5 , width of pronotum of males 4,0-4,5, of females 4,2-5,5 , of abdomen of males 5,0-5,5, of females 6,0-6,5 General color from dark brown to blackish, with orange-yellow markings on neck, humeral angles and connexivum, the corium partially light yellow.
Triatoma neotomae.Pronotum: subquadrate, with sides carinate, not constricted at level of transverse sulcus.
Triatoma neotomae.Rostrum: with hairs becoming progressively longer toward apex of second and on third segment, forming dense brushlike structure at junction of second and third segment.
Triatoma neotomae.Scutellum: with depressed central portion limited by broad carinae; posterior process not more than half as long as main body of scutellum, pointed, declinate at apex.
Triatoma neotomae.Spiracles: distant by one to three times their own diameter from connexival suture.
Triatoma neotomae.Spongy fossulae: present on fore and mid tibiae of males and only on fore tibiae of females.
Triatoma neotomae.Urosternites: and urotergites of general body color.
Triatoma neotomae.Venter: convex, sharply flattened longitudinally along middle, delicately striate transversally, with inconspicuous setae.

Triatoma nigromaculata.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted at center of anteocular region.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Anteocular region: three to four times as long as postocular (l:0,25-0,30), postocular with sides straight, distinctly converging toward behind.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Anterior lobe: with 1 + I discal but without lateral tubercles.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Anterolateral projections: strongly flattened dorsoventrally, large, prominent, cat-ear like.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Clypeus: elongate, very narrow subapically, gradually widened on posterior half.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Connexivum: light yellowish brown, disc of each segment dorsally with dark anvil-shaped spot at center, reduced in size on first and last visible segments.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Corium: with small elongate dark markings in lumen of cells; apical half of clavus also dark.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Eyes: in lateral view slightly surpassing level of lower but not attaining level of upper surface of head, and in dorsal aspect from slightly narrower to slightly wider than synthlipsis (l:0,9-1,2).
Triatoma nigromaculata.First antennal segment: falling considerably short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment with numerous inclined setae as long as or longer than diameter of segment.
Triatoma nigromaculata.First rostral segment: unusually short, not extending beyond middle of distance from apex of antenniferous tubercles to level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Fore: and mid femora with three or four stout spinelike denticles, two or three of which arranged continuously on one side, and one median less strongly developed one closer to apex.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Genae: blunt apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Head: dark laterally and ventrally, yellowish brown dorsally on clypeus, dorsal surface of jugae, and entire dorsal surface of head from base of clypeus to hind border of head.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Hemelytra: attaining apical margin of urotergite VII, in both sexes.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Jugae: unusually small, narrowly rounded at apex.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Length: of male 21-22 , of female 23-24 ; width of pronotum of male 5,0-5,5 , of female 5,5-6,0 ; width of abdomen of male 7,0-7,5 , of female 8-9 Overall color yellowish brown or light reddish brown, with numerous black areas and markings dorsally and dark brown areas ventrally.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Membrane: with dark markings in cells and spaces between veins which are light colored; membranal cells with dark areas occupying almost entire lumen of cells, dark spot of inner membranal cell interrupted near base.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Overall color: yellowish brown or light reddish brown, with numerous black areas and markings dorsally and dark brown areas ventrally.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Pronotum: light yellowish brown, with conspicuous black markings.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Scutellum: light colored, with sides and central depression black, heavily rugose; posterior process reddish, almost as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, rounded apically in dorsal and obliquely truncate in lateral view.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Setae: yellow, short and sparse except longer and more numerous on venter.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior fourth of hind lobe.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Urosternites: II-IV of male carinate longitudinally along middle; venter slightly flattened in female.
Triatoma nigromaculata.Venter: dark brown, with lateral portions of urosternites light colored, light areas forming undulate band.

Triatoma nitida.Antenniferous tubercles: closer to eyes than to apex of head.
Triatoma nitida.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,4); postocular with sides only very slightly rounded, widest anteriorly, converging toward behind.

Triatoma nitida.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, abruptly widened toward posterior half.

Triatoma nitida.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma nitida.Fore: and mid femora with 2 + 2 denticles subapically.
Triatoma nitida.Genae: conspicuously rugose transversally, tapered at apex, almost attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma nitida.General color: dark brown to black, with orange-yellow markings on head, neck, pronotum, acetabula, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma nitida.Head: of general body color but dorsally with orange-yellow markings of varied extension, from covering almost entire surface to only covering clypeus.
Triatoma nitida.Legs: stout, fore femora 4,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma nitida.Length: of male 19,5-21,5 , of female 21,0-22,5 ; width of pronotum of male 4,5-5,0 , of female 5,0-5,5 ; of abdomen of male 6,5-7,0, of female 7,2 8,0 General color dark brown to black, with orange-yellow markings on head, neck, pronotum, acetabula, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma nitida.Neck: dark at center, light colored laterally.
Triatoma nitida.Pronotum: subquadrate, with sides carinate, not distinctly constricted laterally at level of transverse sulcus.

Triatoma nitida.Scutellum: of general body color but posterior process orange-yellow.

Triatoma obscura.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma obscura.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (l:0,4); postocular with sides subparallel, slightly converging toward behind.

Triatoma obscura.Connexivum: dark brown, segments with posterior fourth occupied by narrow transverse yellowish band, wider at external than at internal border of segment.

Triatoma obscura.Legs: with femora dark brown, tibiae slightly lighter reddish brown.
Triatoma obscura.Length: of female examined, 25 , width of pronotum 5,5 , of abdomen 8,5 Overall color from dark brown to black, with small yellowish brown spots on neck, anterolateral projections, discal and lateral tubercles of fore lobe of pronotum, apex of scutellum and on connexivum.
Triatoma obscura.Neck: dark brown, with I+ 1 yellowish lateral spots.
Triatoma obscura.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with small yellowish brown spots on neck, anterolateral projections, discal and lateral tubercles of fore lobe of pronotum, apex of scutellum and on connexivum.

Triatoma obscura.Scutellum: dark, apex of posterior process yellow.
Triatoma obscura.Setae: short but distinct, more slender than those of fiavida.
Triatoma obscura.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by their own diameter.
