Triatoma oliveirai.Abdomen: very wide, lateral portions of urotergites widely exposed.
Triatoma oliveirai.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at middle of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma oliveirai.Anteocular region: approximately three times as long as postocular (1:0,3); postocular with sides straight, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma oliveirai.Anterior lobe: feebly sculptured, with I+ I low discal and I+ I more conspicuous lateral tubercles; these tubercles black or orange yellow.
Triatoma oliveirai.Clypeus: elongate, slightly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma oliveirai.Eyes: small, in lateral view close to but not attaining level of under surface and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma oliveirai.Femora: of all pairs of legs with pair of small denticles subapically.
Triatoma oliveirai.First antennal segment: approaching level of apex of clypeus; second segment with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma oliveirai.Fore: femora seven times as long as wide.
Triatoma oliveirai.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, extending considerably beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma oliveirai.Head: black, rugose, weakly granulose, approximately twice as long as wide (l:0,45) and much longer than pronotum (l:0,75-0,80).
Triatoma oliveirai.Hemelytra: much shorter than abdomen, attaining or slightly surpassing limit between sixth and seventh urotergites.
Triatoma oliveirai.Length: 25-27 ; width of pronotum 5 , of abdomen 10 Overall color black, with orange or yellow markings on neck, in some cases on pronotum, and on connexivum; hemelytra largely yellow.
Triatoma oliveirai.Ocelli: small, their distance from eyes equal to twice their length.
Triatoma oliveirai.Overall color: black, with orange or yellow markings on neck, in some cases on pronotum, and on connexivum; hemelytra largely yellow.
Triatoma oliveirai.Posterior process: of scutellum unusually short, only about half as long as main body of scutellum, oblique, subconical, its apex rounded.
Triatoma oliveirai.Pronotum: black, with I+ l large humeral spots yellowish.
Triatoma oliveirai.Rostrum: dark reddish brown; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to slightly beyond level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma oliveirai.Scutellum: black, heavily rugose, with deep but narrow median depression; lateral portions of scutellum strongly elevated.
Triatoma oliveirai.Submedian carinae: extending to middle of posterior lobe.
Triatoma oliveirai.Urosternites: black; connexivum black, disc of each segment with large yellow mark extending from outer margin to connexival suture and ventrally enclosing spiracles; intersegmental sutures enclosed in narrow transverse black
Triatoma oliveirai.Venter: convex, distinctly but not sharply flattened longitudinally along middle, delicately striate transversally, with sparse, short setae.

Triatoma pallidipennis.Antenniferous tubercles: short, situated slightly before middle of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,35); postocular with side feebly rounded, subparallel.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Clypeus: narrow, somewhat widened on posterior half.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Connexivum: unusually wide, black; connexival plates posteriorly with orange-red markings of varied size , in most cases subtriangular and longest along outer connexival
Triatoma pallidipennis.Corium: with numerous short (0,1-0,2 ) decumbent or adpressed setae , most of its surface yellowish white, faintly tinged with orange at base, dark at extreme apex.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Eyes: in lateral view approaching or attaining level of under surface and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma pallidipennis.First antennal segment: extending distinctly beyond level of apex of clypeus; second segment with stiff decumbent hairs about as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma pallidipennis.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle; second extending to level of hind border of head.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Genae: very narrowly tapering apically, pointed in some specimens.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Head: black, faintlyrugose above along center, not granulose, and with numerous stiff black setae.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Hemelytra: and wings leaving entire connexivum and lateral portions of urotergites exposed.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Legs: as in phyllosoma; fore femora 6,3-7,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Length: of male 31-34 , of female 32-35 Width of pronotum of male 6-7 , offemale 6,0-7,5 ; width of abdomen of male12-13 , of female 13-16 Body very wide , with relativelynarrow wings.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Membrane: from dark brown to sooty black, yellowish white on narrow area adjacent to corium.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Neck: laterally with I+ I orange-red spots.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Overall color: from very dark brown to black, with orange-red markings on neck and connexivum, and with corium almost entirely yellowish white.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Pronotum: black, strongly constricted at level of transverse sulcus, not granulose, with numerous short, strongly decumbent or adpressed setae not longer than 0,3  and scutellum otherwise as in phyllosoma .
Triatoma pallidipennis.Ratio of rostral segments: 1:1,40-1,75:0,40-0,65 Neck laterally with I+ I orange-red spots.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Rostrum: dark reddish brown to in most cases black.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Setae: of dorsal surface numerous, most short, not more than 0,3 long .
Triatoma pallidipennis.Spiracles: remote from connexival suture by a distance equal to several times their diameter.
Triatoma pallidipennis.Venter: convex, delicately striate transversally, and with numerous long semierect hairs.

Triatoma patagonica.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma patagonica.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,4), postocular with sides faintly convex, converging posteriorly.
Triatoma patagonica.Anterior lobe: with central portion conspicuously elevated, with l + l obsolescent discal tubercles.
Triatoma patagonica.Anterolateral projections: small, their apex rounded or blunt.
Triatoma patagonica.Connexivum: yellow, rarely reddish, light-colored area briefly extending to urotergites and urosternites, in latter including spiracles.
Triatoma patagonica.Corium: brownish black, with large yellow subtriangular mark basally, not extending onto clavus.
Triatoma patagonica.Eyes: in lateral view attaining or slightly surpassing level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma patagonica.First antennal segment: extending close to level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma patagonica.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of jugae, second extending to level of posterior margin of eyes.
Triatoma patagonica.Fore: and mid femora with a pair of small denticles subapically, hind femora slightly prominent subapically below.
Triatoma patagonica.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma patagonica.Head: black, delicate rugose dorsally, sparsely granulose, twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,5) and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,8-0,9).
Triatoma patagonica.Hemelytra: approaching or attaining apex of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Triatoma patagonica.Legs: dark, femora with very narrow complete or incomplete apical annulus yellow .
Triatoma patagonica.Membrane: almost as dark as or slightly lighter than dark portion of corium, with veins slightly darker than membrane.
Triatoma patagonica.Neck: dark, with a pair of light-colored spots laterally.
Triatoma patagonica.Overall color: blackish brown or black, with yellow or rarely reddish markings on neck, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma patagonica.Posterior process: of scutellum about three-fifths as long as main body of sclerite, horizontal, subcylindrical or slightly compressed laterally, rounded at apex.
Triatoma patagonica.Pronotum: polished, black, in some specimens outer margin of anterolateral processes narrowly yellow.
Triatoma patagonica.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule or more or less reddish.
Triatoma patagonica.Scutellum: entirely dark, slightly convex, heavily rugose, its central depression well developed.
Triatoma patagonica.Second antennal segment: flattened, beset with numerous setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma patagonica.Setae: of rostrum very short, except at apex of second and on third segment where setae are more numerous and about as long as diameter of segment, decreasing in length toward apex of third segment.
Triatoma patagonica.Spiracles: adjacent or close to connexival suture, distant from latter by not more than their own diameter.
Triatoma patagonica.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of males, absent in females.
Triatoma patagonica.Submedian carinae: extending to middle or posterior third of hind lobe.
Triatoma patagonica.Venter: convex, feebly flattened at center in female, shallowly striate transversally, sparsely setose.

Triatoma peninsularis.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at level of center of anteocular region.
Triatoma peninsularis.Anteocular region: twice as long as postocular (1:0,45-0,50), postocular with sides prominently rounded.
Triatoma peninsularis.Anterior lobe: only faintly convex, without discal and lateral tubercles, slightly granulose.
Triatoma peninsularis.Body: and appendages with short, inconspicuous setae.
Triatoma peninsularis.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, strongly widened posteriorly; arcuate impression at base of clypeus absent.
Triatoma peninsularis.Connexivum: twice as wide dorsally as ventrally.
Triatoma peninsularis.Corium: of general body color, slightly lighter on area adjacent to clavus, and on apical half of the latter; membrane smoky brown.
Triatoma peninsularis.Eyes: Yery small, in lateral view not attaining level of upper and lower surface of head.
Triatoma peninsularis.First antennal segment: very short, barely exceeding middle of distance between its base and level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma peninsularis.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of hind border of head.
Triatoma peninsularis.Fore: and mid femora with two pairs of denticles subapically.
Triatoma peninsularis.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, not attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma peninsularis.Head: granulose, convex above, as long as pronotum and twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,45-0,50).
Triatoma peninsularis.Hemelytra: almost attaining apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
Triatoma peninsularis.Legs: unicolorous, short and stout; fore femur 3,4-3,8 times as long as wide.
Triatoma peninsularis.Length: of male 10,5-11,0 , of female 11-12 ; width of pronotum of male andfemale 2,5-3,0 , width of abdomen ofmale and female 3,5-4,0 Overall color ,dark brown or black, only neck and membrane lighter colored.
Triatoma peninsularis.Overall color: ,dark brown or black, only neck and membrane lighter colored.
Triatoma peninsularis.Posterior lobe: rugose, submedian carinae not attammg hind border.
Triatoma peninsularis.Pronotum: of general body color, smooth, trapezoidal, carinate laterally, only very slightly constricted at level of transverse sulcus.
Triatoma peninsularis.Rostrum: with long hairs, not forming dense brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma peninsularis.Scutellum: with central portion depressed, limited by distinct carinae.
Triatoma peninsularis.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by several times their diameter .
Triatoma peninsularis.Tibiae: without spongy fossulae, in either sex.

Triatoma petrochii.Abdomen: slightly flattened below in male and more distinctly so in female.
Triatoma petrochii.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at or slightly before middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma petrochii.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular (1:0,25), postocular with sides from very faintly rounded to almost straight, distinctly converging toward behind.
Triatoma petrochii.Anterior lobe: with discal tubercles reduced to suboval transverse callosities; lateral tubercles absent.
Triatoma petrochii.Connexivum: dark brown, segments on disc with large yellowish spot occupying two-thirds of surface of each segment, approaching but not adjoining posterior and remote from anterior intersegmental suture.
Triatoma petrochii.Corium: dark brown, with irregularly shaped large light yellow markings basally and subapically; entire costal margin narrowly yellow.
Triatoma petrochii.Eyes: small, in lateral view approaching but not attaining level of lower and remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma petrochii.Femora: either only slightly salient below subapically, or with one or two inconspicuous denticles.
Triatoma petrochii.First antennal segment: appearing unusually short, extending only slightly beyond half the distance from its base to apex of head,
Triatoma petrochii.Genae: narrowly tapering or pointed apically, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma petrochii.Head: uniformly dark, slightly rugose and granulose, somewhat over twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,40-0,45) and unusually elongate as compared to pronotum (1:0,70-0,75).
Triatoma petrochii.Hemelytra: attaining or closely approaching apex of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma petrochii.Integument: appearing glabrous, only with very sparse, short, inapparent setae.
Triatoma petrochii.Legs: uniformly dark, femora in some specimens slightly lighter at middle.
Triatoma petrochii.Length: of male 17,0-21,5 , of female 18-23 ; width of pronotum of male andfemale 3,5-5,0 ; width of abdomen of male6-8 , of female 6-9 Overall color dark brown, with yellowishmarkings on pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma petrochii.Membrane: yellowish white, lighter than yellow areas of c rium.
Triatoma petrochii.Neck: dark, with a pair of light colored spots laterally.
Triatoma petrochii.Overall color: dark brown, with yellowishmarkings on pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma petrochii.Posterior process: almost entirely yellow, about two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, horizontal, rounded apically.
Triatoma petrochii.Pronotum: very sparsely granulose, dark brown, yellow on collar, on discal callosities and in some cases on lateral margins of anterior lobe, on entire submedian carinae and on humeral area.
Triatoma petrochii.Rostrum: slender, practically glabrous, except for group of long hairs at apex of third segment.
Triatoma petrochii.Scutellum: rugose, dark brown, with shallow central depression.
Triatoma petrochii.Submedian carinae: extending close to hind margin of sclerite.

Triatoma phyllosoma.Antenniferous tubercles: short, situated slightly behind middle of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Anteocular region: from two and one-half to three times as long as postocular (1:0,3-0,4); postocular with sides subparallel, very slightly rounded.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Anterior lobe: with elevated areas pilose, remaining surface smooth, dull.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Body: unusually wide, with short and narrow wings.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Connexivum: unusually wide , black, connexival plates posteriorly with red or orange-red markings extending over entire width of segment, their shape varying from transverse band-shaped to subtriangular, with apex of triangle directed cephalad.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Corium: with numerous long (0,3-0,4 ) decumbent hairs , its surface dull black, with one basal triangular and one subapical subquadrate spot red or orange-red.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Eyes: in most cases not attaining, very rarely slightly surpassing level of under surface and invariably distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma phyllosoma.First antennal segment: extending slightly but distinctly beyond level of apex of clypeus; second antennal segment with stiff decumbent setae about as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma phyllosoma.First rostral segment: attaining level of middle of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of neck.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Fore: and mid femora with two subapical denticles, in some individuals barely perceptible.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Genae: narrowly rounded distally, attaining or very rarely surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Head: black, faintly transversally rugose along center above, not granulose, with numerous stiff black setae.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Hemelytra: and wings short and narrow, leaving entire connexivum and lateral portions of urotergites exposed.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Legs: black, elongate; fore femora 6,0-7,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Length: of male 26,5-38,0 , of female 29,0-39,5 ; width of pronotum of male and female 5,5-7,3 ; width of abdomen of male 12,0-14,5 , of female 11,5-18,5 Body unusually wide, with short and narrow wings.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Neck: laterally with I+ I reddish spots.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with red or orange-red markings on corium and connexivum.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Posterior lobe: distinctly rugose, transversely between carinae, more irregularly so on lateral portions.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Pronotum: black, strongly constricted at level of transverse sulcus, not granulose, with numerous long erect hairs pointing in several directions.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Rostrum: with first segment dark brown or black, second and third segments dark or light reddish brown.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Scutellum: with median depression distinct but shallow and narrow; posterior process two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, horizontal or slightly elevated obliquely, rounded distally and with extreme apex declinate in some cases.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Setae: numerous, most delicately hairlike , up to 0,5 in length.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Spiracles: remote from connexival suture by a distance equal to several times their diameter .
Triatoma phyllosoma.Submedian carinae: not extending beyond basal two-thirds of length of posterior lobe.
Triatoma phyllosoma.Venter: convex, delicately striate transversally, more irregularly so on lateral portions, and with numerous semierect hairs.

Triatoma picturata.Antenniferous tubercles: short, situated slightly behind center of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma picturata.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,30-0,35); postocular with sides very slightly convex, almost straight, subparallel.
Triatoma picturata.Clypeus: narrow, distinctly but shortly widened subbasally.
Triatoma picturata.Connexivum: yellowish or reddish orange, in most specimens examined dorsally with subrectangular black spot on anterolateral portion of each connexival segment, adjoining outer but distant from inner connexival margin .
Triatoma picturata.Corium: with decumbent or adpressed very short setae (0,1-0,2 ), its overall color dark brown to black, with one large subtriangular basal and one irregularly shaped subapical mark orange-red.
Triatoma picturata.Eyes: in lateral view attaining but not surpassing level of under and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma picturata.First antennal segment: attaining or shortly surpassing level of apex of clypeus; second segment with stiff decumbent setae about as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma picturata.Fore: femur 5,6-6,7 times as long as wide.
Triatoma picturata.Genae: very narrowly tapering apically, in some cases pointed, attaining or slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma picturata.Head: black, faintly rugose dorsally along center, not granulose, with stiff decumbent setae.
Triatoma picturata.Hemelytra: fully developed, but leaving in most specimens entire connexivum and lateral portions of urotergites exposed, due to the unusually wide abdomen.
Triatoma picturata.Length: of male 30,5-32,0 , of female 32-33 ; width of pronotum of male 6,5-7,0, of female 7,0-7,5 ; width of abdomen of male 12-14 , of female 12-15 Body unusually wide .
Triatoma picturata.Neck: dark, laterally with pair of orange red spots.
Triatoma picturata.Overall color: dark brown to black, with orange-red markings on neck, hind lobe of pronotum, propleura, occasionally on apex of scutellum, and extensively on corium.
Triatoma picturata.Pronotum: moderately constricted at level of transverse sulcus, not granulose, with adpressed setae not longer than 0,3 Overall color of pronotum black, with orangered areas of varied extension, from almost entirely occupying hind lobe to restricted to portion laterad of submedian carinae.
Triatoma picturata.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule, its segments narrowly subcylindrical.
Triatoma picturata.Scutellum: with median depression shallow but distinct, narrow; posterior process two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, horizontal or slightly elevated, rounded distally.
Triatoma picturata.Setae: numerous, adpressed, short (0,1-0,2 on corium, 0,20,3 on
Triatoma picturata.Spiracles: remote from connexival suture by several times their diameter .
Triatoma picturata.Submedian carinae: extending over anterior two third of posterior lobe.
Triatoma picturata.Venter: convex, delicately and shallowly striate transversally, more irregularly so on lateral portions, and with numerous long semierect hairs.

Triatoma platensis.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma platensis.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (l:0,3), postocular with sides rounded.
Triatoma platensis.Anterior lobe: with 1 + 1 discal and 1 + 1 lateral tubercles densely covered with adpressed setae as are other elevated areas of fore lobe.
Triatoma platensis.Corium: tinged with light yellow, sparsely spotted with dark.
Triatoma platensis.Eyes: in lateral view attaining or slightly surpassing level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma platensis.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma platensis.Fore: and mid femora with a pair of subapical denticles.
Triatoma platensis.Genae: pointed, heavily sclerotized distally, extending considerably beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma platensis.Head: dark reddish brown, very densely pilose dorsally and laterally, setae forwardly directed; surface sparsely granulose.
Triatoma platensis.Hemelytra: closely approaching, attaining or slightly surpassing apex of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma platensis.Legs: uniformly dark reddish brown, stout; fore femora from four to five times as long as wide.
Triatoma platensis.Length: of male 22-24 , of female 22,5-26,0 Width of pronotum of male and female 6-7 , of abdomen of male 7,5-8,5 , of female 8-9 Robust, heavily sclerotized species.
Triatoma platensis.Membrane: irregularly mottled with dark, dark pigment elements coalescing into large dark spot straddling vein separating membranal cells.
Triatoma platensis.Neck: dark brown, with 1 + 1 lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma platensis.Overall color: dark brown, matte, with yellowish markings on neck and connexivum.
Triatoma platensis.Pilosity: golden colored, adpressed, elongate scalelike, very dense on most body areas.
Triatoma platensis.Posterior lobe: irregularly wrinkled and densely beset with backwardly directed adpressed setae.
Triatoma platensis.Posterior process: of scutellum about three-fifths as long as main body of sclerite, horizontal, subconical, wide at base, narrow at apex, rounded distally.
Triatoma platensis.Scutellum: heavily rugose; central depression glabrous or with scattered setae, remainder densely setose.
Triatoma platensis.Setae: of rostrum very short on first and part of under surface of second segment; distal portion of under surface and entire upper surface of second as well as entire third segment dorsally, laterally, and ventrally with very dense setae much longer than diameter of segment, longest at base of third segment, progressively decreasing in length towards apex of rostrum.
Triatoma platensis.Spiracles: adjacent or very close to connexival suture .
Triatoma platensis.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of male, absent in female.
Triatoma platensis.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior third of hind lobe.
Triatoma platensis.Venter: prominently convex, feebly flattened longitudinally along middle in female, coarsely striate transversally.

Triatoma protracta.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at level of center of anteocular region.
Triatoma protracta.Anteocular region: slightly less than three times as long as postocular (1:0,34-0,4), postocular with sides rounded.
Triatoma protracta.Anterior lobe: only slightly elevated, without discal or lateral tubercles, slightly granulose.
Triatoma protracta.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, strongly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma protracta.Eyes: in lateral view attaining levels of upper or lower surface of head.
Triatoma protracta.First antennal segment: very short, barely exceeding middle of distance between its base and level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma protracta.Fore: and mid femora subapically with two pairs of denticles.
Triatoma protracta.Genae: narrowly tapered apically, not attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma protracta.General color: of abdomen as on rest of body, from light reddish brown to black; intersegmental sutures of dark specimens in most cases narrowly yellow .
Triatoma protracta.Head: granulose and slightly rugose, distinctly convex above, about twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,450,55), and about as long as pronotum.
Triatoma protracta.Hemelytra: almost attaining apex of abdomen, their color from brownish in light colored to almost black in dark specimens, in some cases membrane lighter than corium, and the latter with faint light-colored subapical spot; rarely center of corium darker than rest of hemelytra.
Triatoma protracta.Legs: short and stout; fore femora from four to five times as long as wide.
Triatoma protracta.Length: of male 13,0-19,5, of female 15-23; width of pronotum of male 3,5-4,0, of female 3,5-5,0 , width of abdomen of male 5,0-5,5, of female 5,0-8,5 Color either from piceous to black, with intersegmental connexival sutures light, and membrane in .
Triatoma protracta.Posterior lobe: rugose, submedian carinae almost attaining hind margin; humeri rounded.
Triatoma protracta.Pronotum: from light brown to black, smooth, carinate laterally, trapezoidal, only very slightly constricted at level of transverse sulcus.
Triatoma protracta.Rostrum: with short hairs becoming progressively longer toward apex of second segment, uniformly long on third segment, but not forming dense brushlike structure at junction of second and third.
Triatoma protracta.Scutellum: with central portion depressed, limited by distinct carinae.
Triatoma protracta.Tibiae: of both sexes without spongy fossulae.
Triatoma protracta.Venter: rounded or slightly flattened, irregularly wrinkled transversally.

Triatoma pseudomaculata.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (l:0,30-0,35), postocular with sides rounded but strongly converging posteriorly.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Anterior lobe: of pronotum with distinct discal and lateral tubercles.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Connexivum: light yellow or reddish orange, with wide transversal black bands across entire width of connexival segment, on intersegmental sutures.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Corium: with subbasal and subapical spots yellow or reddish.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Eyes: large, in lateral view surpassing level of under and almost attaining level of upper surface of eyes.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus, second slightly compressed, with numerous short adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Fore: femur 5,0-5,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Genae: tapering or pointed apically, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Head: uniformly dark brown or black, less high in lateral view than in maculata, delicately granulose, especially at sides.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Hemelytra: almost attaining or in some males slightly surpassing apex of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Integument: almost glabrous, setae very short and sparse.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Length: of male 17 -19 , of female 19-20 ; width of pronotum of male 4,0-4,8 , of female 4,5-5,0 ; width of abdomen of male 5,5-7,0 , of female 6,5-7,5 Overall color from dark brown to black, with yellow or orange-red marks on neck, thorax, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Membrane: either black and as dark as dark portions of corium, or fumose, brown, distinctly lighter than dark portion of corium, and with veins conspicuously dark.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Neck: with I+ 1 lateral yellow or orange spots.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with yellow or orange-red marks on neck, thorax, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Posterior lobe: dark, with three pairs of yellow or reddish spots, one pair anterosublateral, one humeral and one posteromedian, the latter in many cases reduced in size, or obsolescent.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Posterior process: subcylindrical, about as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal but apex slightly upturned, obliquely truncate in lateral view.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Pronotum: not distinctly granulose, its overall color from dark brown to black, with variable yellowish or orange-red pattern elements.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Rostrum: dark as head capsule, relatively slender (as compared to T maculata).
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Scutellum: entirely dark, coarsely rugose, with distinct central depression; sides of scutellum swollen.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Setae: of rostrum short and sparse on first and second segments but very numerous and longer on third, although not quite as long as diameter of segment.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Spiracles: adjacent or very close to connexival suture.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior fourth of hind lobe.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Tibiae: of first and second pair of legs of male with spongy fossulae, absent in female.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Urosternites: dark brown, in some specimens irregularly clouded with yellowish brown; small lateral area enclosing spiracles yellow.
Triatoma pseudomaculata.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened longitudinally along middle in female, delicately striate transversally, sparsely setose.

Triatoma pugasi.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma pugasi.Anteocular region: about two and onehalf times as long as postocular (1:0,40-0,45); postocular with sides slightly convex, somewhat converging toward behind.
Triatoma pugasi.Anterior lobe: granulose on elevated portions, with 1+ I obsolescent discal but without lateral tubercles.
Triatoma pugasi.Anterolateral angles: with short subtriangular forward directed projections.
Triatoma pugasi.Corium: light yellowish brown, extensively brown fumose on basal half and at extreme apex.
Triatoma pugasi.Eyes: in lateral view distinctly surpassing level of under surface but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma pugasi.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercles, second attaining level of middle of neck.
Triatoma pugasi.Fore: and mid femora with 2+2 subapical denticles.
Triatoma pugasi.Genae: narrowly tapering apically but not pointed, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma pugasi.Head: dorsally faintly rugose and distinctly granulose; dark reddish brown with 1 + 1 submedian black lines on dorsum.
Triatoma pugasi.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen in male, reaching to posterior margin of seventh urotergite in female.
Triatoma pugasi.Legs: dark reddish brown, stout; fore femur five times as long as wide.
Triatoma pugasi.Length: of male 24,0-24,5 , of female 24,0 , width of pronotum of male 6,5 , of female 6,0 ; width of abdomen of male 10,0 , of female 9,5 Overall color dorsally light orange-brown or yellowish brown, with head, antennae, membrane, legs, and venter darker.
Triatoma pugasi.Membrane: darker than dark portions of corium.
Triatoma pugasi.Ocelli: small, their diameter equal to or smaller than their distance from eyes.
Triatoma pugasi.Overall color: dorsally light orange-brown or yellowish brown, with head, antennae, membrane, legs, and venter darker.
Triatoma pugasi.Posterior process: of scutellum less than half as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, narrowly subconical.
Triatoma pugasi.Rostrum: with short inconspicuous setae except distally on second and on third segment but not forming brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma pugasi.Scutellum: orange-brown, its central depressed portion rugose, limited by distinct carinae.
Triatoma pugasi.Second antennal segment: only with adpressed setae much shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma pugasi.Submedian carinae: very short, evanescent at middle of posterior lobe.
Triatoma pugasi.Tibiae: of first and second pair of legs of male with small spongy fossulae, the latter present in females only on fore tibiae.
Triatoma pugasi.Venter: slightly flattened longitudinally along middle in male and more strongly so in female, with flattened portion not distinctly separated from lateral convex area.

Triatoma recurva.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region, without apical spiniferous process.
Triatoma recurva.Anteocular region: from three to four times as long as postocular (l:0,25-0,35), postocular with sides straight, slightly converging toward behind.
Triatoma recurva.Anterior lobe: with halves distinctly convex, delicately granulose, with 1 + 1 discal tubercles and 1 + 1 less well developed but still perceptible lateral tubercles.
Triatoma recurva.Clypeus: very narrow, gradually widened behind its middle.
Triatoma recurva.Connexivum: wide, in many specimens strongly reflexed.
Triatoma recurva.First antennal segment: falling short of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma recurva.Fore: femora 7,5-10,0 times as long as wide.
Triatoma recurva.Genae: pointed apically, falling short of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma recurva.General color: from piceous to black, in some cases hind lobe of pronotum slightly lighter colored; connexivum orange-yellow along outer margin.
Triatoma recurva.Head: narrow, rugose transversally along middle on dorsum, faintly granulose, slightly more than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,40-0,45), and longer than pronotum (1:0,9).
Triatoma recurva.Hemelytra: uniformly dark, those of male attaining or slightly surpassing apex of abdomen, those of female only attaining base or at most middle of urotergite VIII.
Triatoma recurva.Legs: slender and elongate, only with short sparse setae.
Triatoma recurva.Length: of males 25,5-30,0 , of females 29-33 ; width of pronotum of males5,5-7,0 , of females 6,0-7,5 ; width ofabdomen of males 8,5-10,5 , of females11,0-13,5 General color from piceous to black, in some cases hind lobe of pronotum slightly lighter colored; connexivum orange-yellow along outer margin.
Triatoma recurva.Posterior lobe: shallowly rugose, submedian carinae not attaining posterior margin of pronotum.
Triatoma recurva.Pronotum: with sides conspicuously constricted at level of transversal sulcus.
Triatoma recurva.Rostrum: slender, first and second segments with very short, sparse setae, third with a few long hairs.
Triatoma recurva.Scutellum: heavily rugose, with central portion only slightly depressed; apical process elongate cylindrical, almost as long as disc of sclerite, horizontal, its apex slightly tapering, from horizontal to slightly downward bent.
Triatoma recurva.Spiracles: very close to connexival suture, their distance from suture equal to once or twice their diameter.

Triatoma rubida.Abdomen: uniformly dark except connexivum, sharply flattened below longitudinally along middle in both sexes, flattened portion bordered by sharp, posteriorly converging carinae .
Triatoma rubida.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted at center of anteocular region.
Triatoma rubida.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (l:0,35-0,40), postocular with sides rounded.
Triatoma rubida.Anterior lobe: not granulose, smooth, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma rubida.Anterolateral angles: outwardly directed, very short, rounded apically.
Triatoma rubida.Corium: dark, rarely unicolorous, in most cases with large triangular area at base, most of costal margin, and small subapical spot, light colored.
Triatoma rubida.Eyes: in lateral view distinctly surpassing level of under surface of head.
Triatoma rubida.Femora: of first and second pair with 1 + 1 small denticles subapically.
Triatoma rubida.First antennal segment: attaining or slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus; second antennal segment with short, stiff, decumbent hairs.
Triatoma rubida.Fore: and mid tibiae of male with small spongy fossulae, absent in female.
Triatoma rubida.Head: rugose, not perceptibly granulose, uniformly dark, only slightly elevated between eyes; as long as pronotum, and distinctly less than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,60-0,75).
Triatoma rubida.Hemelytra: extending close to apex of abdomen.
Triatoma rubida.Length: of male 15,5-20,0 , of female 19,5-23,0 ; width of pronotum of male 4,0-4,5 , of female 5,0-5,5 ; width of pronotum of male 5-6 , of female 6,5-8,0 Overall color from light reddish brown to dark reddish brown or black, with light markings from deep red to orange-red and yellow, on neck, pronotum, corium, and connexivum; pronotum and corium in some cases entirely dark.
Triatoma rubida.Neck: yellowish on anterior, dark on posterior half.
Triatoma rubida.Overall color: from light reddish brown to dark reddish brown or black, with light markings from deep red to orange-red and yellow, on neck, pronotum, corium, and connexivum; pronotum and corium in some cases entirely dark.
Triatoma rubida.Posterior lobe: shallowly rugose, with submedian carinae almost attaining hind border.
Triatoma rubida.Pronotum: dark, with sides, posterior margin, humeral angles and anterolateral processes light colored, with in some cases several or all of these regions dark.
Triatoma rubida.Rostrum: stout, with short setae except at apex of second and base of third segment where there are very long, dense hairs.
Triatoma rubida.Scutellum: dark, rugose, central depression shallow, limited by narrow ridges.

Triatoma rubrofasciata.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at center of anteocular region.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Anteocular region: about 2,5 times as long as postocular (1:0,35), postocular with sides slightly rounded.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Anterolateral angles: short, subconical, or narrowly rounded apically.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Corium: granulose, from dark brown to black, its entire outer margin delicately bordered with orange-red.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under surface but remote from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.First antennal segment: distinctly projecting beyond apex of clypeus; second segment with adpressed hairs shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of posterior border of head.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Fore: and mid femora subapically with two to four obsolescent denticles.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.General color: of abdomen from dark brown to black; spiracles orange.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Head: heavily granulose dorsally, uniformly dark, slightly less than twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,6) and slightly shorter than pronotum (1:1,1).
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Hemelytra: variable in length, in most specimens reaching only to basal portion or at most to middle of seventh urotergite, but in some males attaining apical portion of said urotergite.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Legs: uniformly dark, relatively short and stout, with fore femur about five times as long as wide.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Length: of male 19,5-24,0 , of female 20-25 ; width of pronotum of male andfemale 4,5-6,0 , of abdomen of male6,5-9,0 , of female 7-10 Overall color dark brown to black, with yellowish and orange-red markings on neck, pronotum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Membrane: fumose, slightly lighter than dark portions of corium.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Overall color: dark brown to black, with yellowish and orange-red markings on neck, pronotum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Posterior lobe: from very faintly to distinctly rugose transversally, most conspicuously so on central portion between sublateral carinae; the latter evanescent befre posterior margin.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Posterior process: conical, subtriangular, strongly tapering from wide base to point, about two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Pronotum: dark brown or black, with sides and anterolateral processes reddish, in some cases also collar light colored; occasionally, red color invading central portion of hind lobe of pronotum.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Rostrum: with abundant pilosity, hairs short on first and basal half of second segment, becoming progressively longer toward apex of second and on third segment, but not forming dense brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Scutellum: of general body color but in some cases with apex of process reddish, rugose-granulose, with distinct median depression limited by posteriorly confluent carinae.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Spiracles: of variable position, either adjacent to connexival suture or remote from latter by once or twice their own diameter.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of male, absent in females.
Triatoma rubrofasciata.Venter: flattened longitudinally along middle, more conspicuously so in females; flattened portion not sharply delimited from lateral convex area.

Triatoma rubrovaria.Abdomen: very wide in some specimens , with lateral areas of urotergites exposed.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (l:0,3); postocular with sides very faintly convex.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Anterior lobe: of pronotum with elevated portions smooth, shining; with I+ I weak discal elevations which are not distinct tubercles; lateral tubercles not developed.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Clypeus: narrow, gradually and only slightly widened behind middle.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Connexivum: black, each segment with large central red or orange spot attaining external margin of segment.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Corium: black, with basal and subapical light-colored spot of variable size, spots connected by narrow lightcolored line along margin of hemelytron.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Eyes: in lateral view slightly surpassing level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma rubrovaria.First antennal segment: approaching but not attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma rubrovaria.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of jugae, second attaining level of hind border of eyes.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Fore: and mid femora with a pair of small denticles subapically, femora of third pair slightly salient below subapically.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Head: long and slender, black, delicately rugose transversally on dorsum, faintly granulose.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Hemelytra: attaining apex of seventh urotergite in males and in some females, in other females not projecting beyond middle of seventh urotergite.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Integument: sparsely granulose; setae short, sparse, integument appearing glabrous.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Legs: uniformly dark, slender; fore femora from six to seven times as long as wide.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Length: of male 21-24 , of female 22-25 , width of pronotum of male 4,5-5,5 , of female 4,5-7,0 ; width of abdomen of male 6,5-8,5 , of female 8-12 Overall color black, with red, orange, or rarely yellowish markings on neck, pronotum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Membrane: brown, fumose, somewhat lighter than dark area of corium.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Neck: dark, with pair of light-colored lateral spots.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Overall color: black, with red, orange, or rarely yellowish markings on neck, pronotum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Posterior lobe: of pronotum distinctly rugose; submedian carinae extending to posterior fourth of hind lobe, evanescent before posterior margin.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Posterior process: of scutellum short, about two-fifths as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, broad at base, cylindrical on apical portion, its apex rounded.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Pronotum: with anterior lobe invariably black; posterior lobe rarely entirely black or entirely red, in most specimens with area between submedian carinae, with carinae included, black to a varied degree .
Triatoma rubrovaria.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule or with second and third segments reddish.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Scutellum: entirely dark, convex, heavily rugose, basal projections obsolete.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Second antennal segment: flattened, with numerous adpressed hairs shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Setae: of rostrum short, except at apex of second and on third segment where setae are about as long as diameter of segment, decreasing in length toward apex of last segment.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Spiracles: close to connexival suture, distant from latter by not more than their diameter.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of males, absent in females.
Triatoma rubrovaria.Venter: convex, faintly flattened longitudinally along middle in females.

Triatoma ryckmani.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (l:0,4); postocular with sides rounded.
Triatoma ryckmani.Anterior lobe: elevated, granulose but not forming distinct tubercles with ridges prominent.
Triatoma ryckmani.Clypeus: narrow, with short abrupt swelling on basal third.
Triatoma ryckmani.First antennal segment: falling distinctly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma ryckmani.First rostral segment: almost attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of hind margin of head.
Triatoma ryckmani.Fore: and mid femora with two pairs of denticles followed by one or two rows of small setiferous tubercles.
Triatoma ryckmani.Genae: with inner margin light colored, their apex pointed, extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma ryckmani.Head: heavily rugosegranulose dorsally and laterally, smooth below along middle, about twice as long as wide across eyes (l:0,55), and slightly shorter than pronotum (l:1,1).
Triatoma ryckmani.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen, appearing narrow compared to wide abdomen, leaving entire connexivum and narrow lateral portion of urotergites exposed.
Triatoma ryckmani.Legs: stout, fore femora 4,0-4,5 times as long as wide.
Triatoma ryckmani.Posterior lobe: heavily granulose, its lateral margin carinate; humeri rounded, sublateral carinae approaching posterior margin.
Triatoma ryckmani.Posterior process: over half as long as main body of scutellum, cylindrical, its apex rounded or subtruncate, slightly elevated.
Triatoma ryckmani.Pronotum: dark brown, light to varied degree on sublateral carinae, borders of posterior and ridges of anterior lobes.
Triatoma ryckmani.Rostrum: slender, with very short hairs only.
Triatoma ryckmani.Scutellum: with central depressed portion heavily rugose, limited by broad carinae; at its base 1 + 1 conspicuous submedian tubercles, overlapping posterior border of pronotum.
Triatoma ryckmani.Setae: of body surface short, black, adpressed, but longer and semierect on under surface of thorax and on abdominal urosternites.
Triatoma ryckmani.Urosternites: yellowish brown; genital area dark brown.
Triatoma ryckmani.Venter: conspicuously flattened below along middle; flattened portion limited laterally by 1 + 1 distinct carinae converging medially at base of third and at middle of seventh segment.

Triatoma sanguisuga.Antenniferous tubercles: situated on posterior third of anteocular region.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Anteocular region: somewhat more than twice as long as postocular (l:0,45).
Triatoma sanguisuga.Corium: with sparse, short, inconspicuous setae; basal triangle reddish orange or yellowish, a large central area dark brown and extending over entire width of corium, a smaller subapical spot orange-red or yellowish, extreme apex of corium dark; clavus dark on basal, light brown on apical half.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Eyes: in side view attaining or slightly surpassing level of under surface of head, remote from level of upper surface.
Triatoma sanguisuga.First antennal segment: falling slightly short of apex of clypeus; second segment with short hairs only.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Fore: femur 4,3-4,9 times as long as wide.
Triatoma sanguisuga.General color: of pronotum dark brown to black, with lateral margins from orange-red to yellowish, the light area in many cases extending onto humeral disc and on collar including anterolateral angles.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Head: granulose, uniformly dark, about twice as long as wide across eyes (l:0,55), and very slightly shorter than pronotum
Triatoma sanguisuga.Legs: uniformly dark; femora of first and second pairs with 1 + 1 pointed denticles subapically.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Length: of male 15,5-22,0 , of female 20,5-23,0 ; maximum width of pronotum of male and female 4,0-5,5 , of abdomen of male 5,5-8,0 , of female 6-9 Overall color from dark brown to black, with orange-red or yellowish markings on neck, pronotum, hemelytra and connexivum.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Neck: reddish or dark with l + l lateral spots reddish.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with orange-red or yellowish markings on neck, pronotum, hemelytra and connexivum.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Pilosity: inconspicuous, most distinct on under surface of abdomen and on legs.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Pronotum: with fore lobe slightly granulose; discal tubercles very low or imperceptible; lateral tubercles missing.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Ratio of antennal segments: 1:3,3-3,5:2,3-2,8:2,0-2,5 Rostrum with sparse, very short setae only; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of base of neck.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Rostrum: with sparse, very short setae only; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of base of neck.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Scutellum: rugose with irregular delicate carinae limiting central depression; apical process sybcylindrical, not quite as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, apex rounded and slightly declinate.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Spiracles: close to but not contiguous with connexival suture.
Triatoma sanguisuga.Tibiae: of first and second pairs of male with small spongy fossulae, absent in female.

Triatoma sinica.Abdomen: wide, with lateral portions of urotergites not completely covered by hemelytra.
Triatoma sinica.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted slightly behind center of anteocular portion of head.
Triatoma sinica.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,4), postocular with sides rounded.
Triatoma sinica.Anterior lobe: with smooth areas dark brown or black, elevated areas yellowish brown.
Triatoma sinica.Body: integument highly polished; pilosity very short and sparse.
Triatoma sinica.Clypeus: elevated in lateral view, rather broad on anterior portion, basal third abruptly widened.
Triatoma sinica.Corium: dark, with small orange-colored narrow subbasal spot and subapical Ushaped spot.
Triatoma sinica.Eyes: in side view surpassing level of lower and not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma sinica.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercle, second reaching level of hind border of head.
Triatoma sinica.Fore: and mid femora with 3-4 small setiferous denticles.
Triatoma sinica.Genae: tapering but not pointed apically, slightly but distinctly surpassFIG.
Triatoma sinica.Head: including clypeus and genae heavily rugose transversally on dorsum and only slightly granulose; dark reddish brown, with sides black dorsally.
Triatoma sinica.Legs: uniformly dark brown, stout; fore femur six times as long as wide.
Triatoma sinica.Length: of male 22 , of female 24 ; width of pronotum of female 6 , of abdomen 9,5 Female (male not examined).
Triatoma sinica.Membrane: smoky brown, lighter than dark portion of corium.
Triatoma sinica.Ocelli: large, their diameter greater than their distance from hind border of eyes.
Triatoma sinica.Overall color: dark brown to black, with yellowish or reddish markings on pronotum, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Triatoma sinica.Posterior lobe: black, with submedian carinae, a median band arising at transversal sulcus and attaining posterior margin of pronotum, and 1 + 1 sub lateral spots at posterior margin, reddish brown.
Triatoma sinica.Posterior process: about two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subcylindrical, its apex rounded.
Triatoma sinica.Ratio of antennal segments: ( calculated from measurements given by Hsiao, 1965) 1:4,6:2,9:2,4.
Triatoma sinica.Rostrum: with short hairs except on apex of second and on third segment, but not forming brushlike structure at junction of second and third segments.
Triatoma sinica.Scutellum: dark, with central depression and posterior process rugose, yellowish brown.
Triatoma sinica.Spiracles: adjacent to connexival suture or separated from same by distance less than diameter of spiracle.
Triatoma sinica.Tibiae: without spongy fossulae (possibly present in male).
Triatoma sinica.Venter: distinctly flattened longitudinally along middle, flattened portion not sharply separated from lateral convex portion.

Triatoma sordida.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma sordida.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (l:0,30-0,35), postocular with sides slightly rounded, converging toward behind.
Triatoma sordida.Anterior lobe: with distinct discal and lateral tubercles.
Triatoma sordida.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum small but salient, narrowly rounded apically.
Triatoma sordida.Clypeus: very narrow, slightly widened behind middle.
Triatoma sordida.Corium: with triangular basal spot yellow, and with apex also yellow, or not, or corium entirely yellowish with only veins on apical two-thirds of corium conspicuously darkened.
Triatoma sordida.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under and approaching but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma sordida.First antennal segment: falling slightly short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment subcylindrical, beset with numerous inclined setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Triatoma sordida.First rostral segment: very short, not quite extending to level of apex of jugae, second attaining level of hind margin of eyes.
Triatoma sordida.Fore: and mid femora with pair of stout denticles subapically.
Triatoma sordida.Genae: narrowly tapering or rarely pointed apically, distinctly extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma sordida.General color: of hemelytra from light to very dark brown.
Triatoma sordida.Head: brown, with anteocular area yellowish; head rugose and granulose, heavily so on sides before and behind eyes.
Triatoma sordida.Hemelytra: closely approaching or attaining apex of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Triatoma sordida.Legs: with coxae and trochantera pale yellow, in some specimens with faint brownish spots.
Triatoma sordida.Length: of male 14-19 , of female 15-20 ; width of pronotum of male and female 4-5 , of abdomen of male 6,5-7,0 , offemale 7-8 Overall color from light to (rarely) dark brown, with pale yellow areas on head, neck, pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, legs, connexivum, and in some specimens, venter.
Triatoma sordida.Membrane: fumose, from light to very dark brown, veins darker than cells, especially distal two-thirds of Cu separating membranal cells, this portion of vein narrowly bordered with dark.
Triatoma sordida.Neck: dark, with a pair of light-colored spots laterally.
Triatoma sordida.Overall color: from light to (rarely) dark brown, with pale yellow areas on head, neck, pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, legs, connexivum, and in some specimens, venter.
Triatoma sordida.Pronotum: sparsely granulose, brown, in most specimens with anterolateral processes and elevated areas of anterior lobe including tubercles yellow; humeri invariably with yellow mark.
Triatoma sordida.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule, or, more frequently, with some or all segments very light yellowish brown.
Triatoma sordida.Scutellum: coarsely rugose; central depression well developed.
Triatoma sordida.Setae: of rostrum very short, a few slightly longer ones on apical segment, these setae not longer than diameter of segment.
Triatoma sordida.Spiracles: variable in position, from adjacent to cormexival margin to distant from latter by twice their diameter.
Triatoma sordida.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of male, absent in females.
Triatoma sordida.Submedian carinae: extending close to hind border of pronotum.
Triatoma sordida.Tibiae: brown, darkest at apex, and with small light-colored annulus at base.

Triatoma spinolai.Anterior lobe: deeply sculptured and granulose, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Triatoma spinolai.Clypeus: narrow, slightly widened at apex and gradually so on posterior third.
Triatoma spinolai.Connexivum: red, either entirely so, or especially dorsally, each connexival plate on disc with black spot , variable in size, attaining or not lateral margin of sclerite.
Triatoma spinolai.Eyes: in side view attaining or surpassing level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma spinolai.First antennal segment: slender, almost glabrous, extending slightly beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma spinolai.Fore: femora from 8 to IO times as long as wide.
Triatoma spinolai.Genitalia: of male as in winged form
Triatoma spinolai.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, falling slightly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma spinolai.Head: very dark, transversally rugose dorsally, weakly granulose, narrowly cylindrical, apical portion (from level of apex of antenniferous tubercles to apex) conspicuously compressed laterally; under surface of head with scattered long hairs.
Triatoma spinolai.Hemelytra: attaining or surpassing apex of abdomen by up to two , their color uniformly dark brown.
Triatoma spinolai.Legs: uniformly dark, unusually long and slender, especially third pair.
Triatoma spinolai.Length: 18-22 , width of pronotum 3,5-5 , of abdomen 4,8-6,5 Overall color dark brown, connexivum and part of adjacent sclerites red.
Triatoma spinolai.Neck: lighter than head, with l + l very faint lateral spots yellow.
Triatoma spinolai.Ocelli: large, their length equal to their distance from eyes.
Triatoma spinolai.Overall color: dark brown, connexivum and part of adjacent sclerites red.
Triatoma spinolai.Posterior process: of scutellum extremely small, subconical, only from one-sixth to one-eighth of length of main body of scutellum; its apex horizontal or upturned.
Triatoma spinolai.Pronotum: subtrapezoidal, uniformly dark, although somewhat lighter than remaining parts of body.
Triatoma spinolai.Scutellum: subtriangular, its surface from rugose to almost smooth, conspicuously elevated, and with median depression from small to indistinct.
Triatoma spinolai.Second antennal segment: with very numerous semi-erect ciliate hairs about twice as long as diameter of segment, and less numerous scattered elongate bristles from twice to more than four times as long as diameter of segment; similar hairs and bristles on third and fourth segments.
Triatoma spinolai.Setae: of posterior tarsus shown in figure 1808.
Triatoma spinolai.Spiracles: close to but not adjoining connexival suture.
Triatoma spinolai.Submedian carinae: extending slightly beyond middle of posterior lobe.
Triatoma spinolai.Venter: convex, minutely striate transversally, and with delicate elongate semierect setae most numerous on posterior segments, in preserved speciments examined appearing carinate longitudinally along middle.

Triatoma tibiamaculata.Antenniferous tubercles: located behind center of anteocular region of head.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Anterior lobe: with l + l discal and l + llateral red tubercles; submedian carinae beginning immediately behind discal tubercles, extending close to posterior margin of sclerite, red, with red stripes continuing to hind border of sclerite, their ends connected by transversal red stripe along hind border.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Connexivum: marked with black and light yellowishbrown or reddish brown.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Corium: light orangebrown, in some cases basally tinged with red, and with elongate wide black markings along some veins and in cells.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Eyes: in lateral view surpassing level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.First antennal segment: with apex very close to level of apex of clypeus; second segment with numerous short adpressed setae and other, decumbent ones as long as or slightly longer than diameter of segment.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Genae: blunt apically, falling distinctly short of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Head: black, slightly granulose-punctate, conspicuously rugose laterally.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Hemelytra: extending to or closely approaching posterior border of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Jugae: small, narrowly angular, apical portion diverging from surface of cephalic capsule.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Legs: black on coxae, trochantera and femora, the latter with short apical annulus yellowish, similarly colored on extreme base extending in some specimens to trochanter.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Length: of male 29-30 , of female 32,0-33,5 ; width of pronotum of male 7,0-7,5 , of female 7,5-8,0 ; width of abdomen of male IO.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Neck: black, with pair of lateral orangebrown spots.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Overall color: black, with red and light orange-brown markings on neck pronotum, scutellum, corium, legs, and connexivum.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Posterior process: of scutellum two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, rugose, conical, wide at base, rounded-obtuse apically.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Pronotum: black, with bright red markings on tubercles and forming narrow stripes.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Rostrum: black; first segment falling short of apex of antenniferous tubercles; second segment extending to level of posterior limit of neck.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Scutellum: black, apex of posterior process contrastingly red; median depression shallow, narrowly subtriangular.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Spiracles: close to or adjoining connexival suture.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae of males, only on fore tibiae in females.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Tibiae: light yellowish brown, their apex annulate with black.
Triatoma tibiamaculata.Venter: convex, not distinctly flattened, delicately striate transversally, with very short, sparse setae.

Triatoma venosa.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted slightly behind middle of anteocular region.
Triatoma venosa.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,33), postocular with sides very faintly rounded, distinctly converging toward behind.

Triatoma venosa.Clypeus: narrow, elongate, slightly widened on posterior half.
Triatoma venosa.Connexivum: black, with narrow transversal yellowish red markings straddling intersegmental sutures, with red area occupying anterior segment larger than that on posterior

Triatoma venosa.Genae: rounded distally, almost attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Triatoma venosa.Head: delicately rugose, reddish brown, dorsally with l+ l black stripes extending from level of base of clypeus to ocellar tubercles, enclosing median longitudinal granulose band.
Triatoma venosa.Legs: dark reddish brown, stout; fore femur about six times as long as wide.
Triatoma venosa.Length: of male 18,5 , of female 22 ; width of pronotum of male 4,5 , of female 5,0 , width of abdomen of male 6,5 , of female 9,0 Overall color dark brown or black, with head and legs reddish brown and yellowish or orange-red markings on thorax, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma venosa.Overall color: dark brown or black, with head and legs reddish brown and yellowish or orange-red markings on thorax, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma venosa.Pilosity: of venter inconspicuous, delicate, ad pressed.
Triatoma venosa.Posterior lobe: with elongate red markings, one central and 1+ 1 sublateral, all extending from transverse furrow to posterior border of pronotum.

Triatoma venosa.Scutellum: black, heavily rugose, its posterior process red, stout, two-thirds as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, subcylindrical, rounded-truncate apically.

Triatoma venosa.Submedian carinae: evanescent on posterior third of pronotum.

Triatoma vitticeps.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly beyond middle of anteocular region.

Triatoma vitticeps.Neck: dark brown, with a pair of lateral yellow spots.
Triatoma vitticeps.Overall color: very dark brown tending toward black, with reddish brown or orange-red markings on head, neck, pronotum, pleura, scutellum, hemelytra, and connexivum.
Triatoma vitticeps.Posterior process: of scutellum about as long as main body of scutellum, subcylindrical, horizontal, with apex rounded and slightly elevated.
Triatoma vitticeps.Pronotum: dark brown, with reddish pattern elements.
Triatoma vitticeps.Rostrum: as dark as head capsule; first segment falling short of level of apex of antenniferous tubercles; second segment extending to or beyond level of hind margin of eyes.

Triatoma vitticeps.Submedian carinae: relatively short, evanescent on posterior third.
Triatoma vitticeps.Urosternites: dark brown, except small light spots enclosing spiracles.

Triatoma williami.Abdomen: wide, extreme lateral portions of urotergites exposed, not covered by hemelytra .

Triatoma williami.Neck: dark, with pair of lateral yellowish spots.

Triatoma williami.Ratio of antennal segments: 1:4,95,1:3,2:? Rostrum as dark as head or lighter brown; first segment falling short of level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second attaining level of posterior margin of eyes.

Triatoma williami.Scutellum: uniformly dark, with shallow median depression; posterior process shortly subconical, not more than half as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, wide at base, very narrowly rounded apically.

Triatoma williami.Urosternites: dark brown, except minute yellow spots enclosing spiracles.

Triatoma wygodzinskyi.Antenniferous tubercles: situated slightly behind middle of anteocular region.

Triatoma wygodzinskyi.Length: of male 19,0-19,5 , of female 19-20 ; width of pronotum of male 4,5-5,0, of female 4,0-4,5 ; width of abdomen of male 6,0-6,5 , of female 6,5-7,0 Overall color black, with reddish markings on neck, humeral region of pronotum, corium, and connexivum.

Triatoma wygodzinskyi.Neck: dark, with pair of very small reddish spots laterally.
Triatoma wygodzinskyi.Overall color: black, with reddish markings on neck, humeral region of pronotum, corium, and connexivum.

Triatoma wygodzinskyi.Urosternites: uniformly dark, except minute light colored spot enclosing spiracles.
Triatoma wygodzinskyi.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened in female, delicately striate transversally, sparsely beset with short setae.

ERATYRUS STAL.Antennae: unusually long, reaching to basal portion of membrane when bent backward.
ERATYRUS STAL.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at middle of anteocular region of head.

ERATYRUS STAL.Femora: armed with series of small denticles.
ERATYRUS STAL.Head: and thorax not granulose, with short setae only.

Eratyrus cuspidatus.Abdomen: dark, with center of dorsal and ventral surface pale yellow.

Eratyrus cuspidatus.Genae: narrowly tapering apically but not pointed, falling slightly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Eratyrus cuspidatus.Head: of general color, its integument smooth, with numerous short strong bristles.

Eratyrus cuspidatus.Neck: yellowish at sides, dark at center above.

Eratyrus mucronatus.Abdomen: dark, but center of dorsal and ventral surface pale yellow.

Eratyrus mucronatus.Neck: yellowish at sides, dark above at center.

Linshcosteus Distant.Abdomen: very wide; lateral portions of urotergites exposed, not covered by hemelytra.

Linshcosteus chota.Head: with numerous small, low setigerous granules except narrowly along middle ventrally.
Linshcosteus chota.Hemelytra: leaving apical third of eighth urotergite exposed.
Linshcosteus chota.Jugae: narrowly tapering but not pointed apically.
Linshcosteus chota.Legs: uniformly dark, slender; fore femora six times as long as wide.
Linshcosteus chota.Length: 17,5 ; width of pronotum 3,9 , of abdomen 6,3 Overall color reddish brown (probably faded from dark brown or black).
Linshcosteus chota.Overall color: reddish brown (probably faded from dark brown or black).
Linshcosteus chota.Posterior lobe: strongly rugose, granulose; submedian carinae extending slightly beyond middle of posterior lobe.
Linshcosteus chota.Rostrum: with hairs shorter than diameter on first and most of second segment, as long as or longer than diameter at apex of second and on third segment.
Linshcosteus chota.Scutellum: coarsely rugose transversally, its center slightly depressed; posterior process approximately as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, conical, narrowly tapering apically.

Linshcosteus confumus.Anteocular region: approximately four times as long as postocular (1:0,25-0,30); postocular with sides faintly rounded, widest behind middle; postocular region only very slightly convex below.
Linshcosteus confumus.Anterolateral projections: small, subconical, narrowly tapering but not pointed apically.
Linshcosteus confumus.Eyes: in lateral view closely approaching level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Linshcosteus confumus.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Linshcosteus confumus.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Linshcosteus confumus.Head: with numerous setiferous granules except on narrow band along middle ventrally.
Linshcosteus confumus.Hemelytra: of male extending to middle of seventh urotergite but only to base of seventh urotergite in female.
Linshcosteus confumus.Legs: uniformly black, slender; fore femora 6-7 times as long as wide.
Linshcosteus confumus.Length: of male 21,8 , of female 23,2 ; width of pronotum of male 4,8-5,0 , of female 5 ; width of abdomen of male 9,0 , of female 10,6-10,8 Overall color very dark brown or black.
Linshcosteus confumus.Membrane: fumose, dark greyish brown, with faint cloudy dark reddish brown pattern elements; veins of membrane faintly reddish brown.
Linshcosteus confumus.Posterior lobe: rugose, wrinkled, granulose; submedian carinae extending to middle of posterior lobe.
Linshcosteus confumus.Posterior process: approximately as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, conical, narrowly tapering apically.
Linshcosteus confumus.Rostrum: with hairs shorter than diameter of segments except third segment with scattered setae longer than its diameter.
Linshcosteus confumus.Scutellum: coarsely rugose transversally, its center only shallowly depressed.

Linshcosteus costalis.Abdomen: very wide, with lateral portions of urotergites amply exposed.
Linshcosteus costalis.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular (1:0,25); postocular with sides rounded, widest slightly behind middle; postocular region faintly convex below.
Linshcosteus costalis.Anterolateral projections: small, triangular, pointed, somewhat compressed dorsoventrally.
Linshcosteus costalis.Clypeus: widened on posterior half, not strongly elevated in side view.
Linshcosteus costalis.Eyes: in side view attaining but not surpassing level of lower and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Linshcosteus costalis.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment with decumbent setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Linshcosteus costalis.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Linshcosteus costalis.Head: with numerous setiferous granules except narrowly along middle ventrally.
Linshcosteus costalis.Hemelytra: of male falling slightly short of apex of seventh urotergite, those of female extending only slightly beyond base of seventh urotergite.
Linshcosteus costalis.Legs: uniformly black, slender; fore femora 6-8 times as long as wide.
Linshcosteus costalis.Length: of male 20,5 , of female 21,5 ; width of pronotum of male and female 5,0-5,2 ; of abdomen of male 8,8-9,0 , of female 9,0-11,2 Overall color very dark brown to black, with wide band along costal margin and membranal veins, light reddish or yellowish brown.
Linshcosteus costalis.Membrane: fumose, dark brown, veins yellowish brown.
Linshcosteus costalis.Overall color: very dark brown to black, with wide band along costal margin and membranal veins, light reddish or yellowish brown.
Linshcosteus costalis.Pilosity: short, inconspicuous, except on light-colored portions of corium.
Linshcosteus costalis.Posterior lobe: strongly rugose, granulose, submedian carinae extending backward to slightly beyond middle of disc of posterior lobe.
Linshcosteus costalis.Pronotum: black, in some specimens with anterolateral projections, lateral margin
Linshcosteus costalis.Rostrum: with hairs shorter than diameter of respective segments, only third segment with a few scattered setae longer than diameter of segment.
Linshcosteus costalis.Scutellum: black, coarsely rugose transversally, its center only faintly depressed; posterior process about as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, conical, narrowly tapering apically.
Linshcosteus costalis.Venter: strongly flattened longitudinallyalong middle, in both sexes; delicately striate transversally on and near flattened area, irregularly wrinkled on lateral portions of urosternites.

Linshcosteus kali.Abdomen: wide, with lateral portions not covered by hemelytra.
Linshcosteus kali.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at center of anteocular portion of head.
Linshcosteus kali.Anteocular region: three and one-half to four times as long as postocular (1:0,25-0,30); postocular with sides faintly rounded, widest behind middle.
Linshcosteus kali.Eyes: in lateral view attaining but not surpassing level of under surface, but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Linshcosteus kali.First antennal segment: falling short of level of apex of clypeus; second segment with decumbent setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Linshcosteus kali.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Linshcosteus kali.Head: with very numerous setiferous granules, except on narrow strip along middle ventrally.
Linshcosteus kali.Hemelytra: of male and female falling short of apex of seventh urotergite.
Linshcosteus kali.Legs: uniformly black, slender; fore femora 6,0-7,5 times as long as wide.
Linshcosteus kali.Length: of male 19 , of female 20 ; width of pronotum of male and female 4,5 ; width of abdomen of male 8,8-9,0 , of female 10 Overall color very dark brown or black.
Linshcosteus kali.Posterior lobe: rugose-granulose; submedian carinae not extending beyond middle of posterior lobe.
Linshcosteus kali.Posterior process: about as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, elongate conical, narrowly tapering apically.
Linshcosteus kali.Rostrum: with hairs shorter than diameter of segments except third segment with a few scattered setae longer than diameter of segment.
Linshcosteus kali.Scutellum: black, heavily rugose transversally, its center only faintly depressed.

Dipetalogaster Usinger.Abdomen: wide, with lateral portions not covered by hemelytra.
Dipetalogaster Usinger.Antenniferous tubercles: situated at center of anteocular portion of head.
Dipetalogaster Usinger.Anterior lobe: of pronotum with discal tubercles; humeral angles rounded.
Dipetalogaster Usinger.Head: elongate subcylindrical.
Dipetalogaster Usinger.Rostrum: as long as head, extending to level of prosternum.

Dipetalogaster maximus.Abdomen: dark brown or black, with outer half of connexival plates orange or red .
Dipetalogaster maximus.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted at middle of anteocular portion of head.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Anteocular region: four times as long as postocular, the latter very short, with sides conspicuously produced at middle, almost angular.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Anterior lobe: with irregular protuberances; discal tubercles distinct but low, subhemispherical; lateral carinae with multiple constrictions, but without lateral tubercles.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Anterolateral projections: small, subconical, from pointed to blunt.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Clypeus: slightly widened on posterior half, conspicuousl y elevated in lateral view.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Eyes: in lateral view approaching but not attaining level of under and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Dipetalogaster maximus.First antennal segment: extending distinctly beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Dipetalogaster maximus.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to level of hind border of head.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Genae: very narrowly tapering apically, almost pointed, distinctly extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Head: black, delicately granulose, distinctly rugose dorsally and laterally.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Hemelytra: fully developed but falling slightly short of apex of abdomen; those of male extending to middle of urotergite VII, those of female extending at least to base of urotergite VII but not beyond base of urotergite VIII.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Length: of male 33-35 , of female 41-42 ; width of pronotum of male 8 , of female 8,5-9,5 ; width of abdomen of male 12 , of female 15-16 Overall color from dark brown to black, with reddish stripe along outer edge of connexivum.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Neck: laterally with l+ 1 faint reddish spots.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Ocelli: situated close to hind border of head.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Overall color: from dark brown to black, with reddish stripe along outer edge of connexivum.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Posterior lobe: of pronotum prominently elevated at middle, shallowly rugose.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Scutellum: coarsely rugose, with center of disc deeply depressed, lateral portions elevated; posterior process short and thick, rounded apically, horizontal or deflected distally, only about half as long as main body of scutellum.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Second antennal segment: with approximately seven trichobothria, three closely spaced at and near base, four more widely spaced along entire length of segment .
Dipetalogaster maximus.Spiracles: distant from lateral margin of urosternite by several times their diameter .
