Dipetalogaster maximus.Submedian carinae: very low, inconspicuous, distinct only on anterior half of posterior lobe of pronotum.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Urosternites: minutely striate transversally , irregularly wrinkled close to lateral border.
Dipetalogaster maximus.Venter: convex, faintly flattened longitudinally along middle in both sexes.

Panstrongylus Berg.Abdomen: wide, with lateral portions of urotergites covered by hemelytra.
Panstrongylus Berg.Antenniferous tubercles: situated close to anterior margin of eyes.
Panstrongylus Berg.Fore: lobe of pronotum with or without discal and lateral tubercles.
Panstrongylus Berg.Head: short and wide, subconical, invariably shorter than pronotum.
Panstrongylus Berg.Humeral angles: rounded or angular but not spined.
Panstrongylus Berg.Legs: with femora in most cases armed with denticles, the latter rarely obsolete.
Panstrongylus Berg.Rostrum: as long as head, extending to level of prostemum.
Panstrongylus Berg.Venter: of abdomen convex or flattened longitudinally along middle.

Panstrongylus chinai.Anteocular region: more than twice as long as postocular (1:0,35-0,45), postocular very short and wide, its sides rounded and converging posteriorly.
Panstrongylus chinai.Anterior lobe: of pronotum slightly convex, with ridges distinct, 1 + 1 small but distinct round discal tubercles, lateral tubercles obsolescent.
Panstrongylus chinai.Anterolateral projections: variable in shape, from subconical to slightly flattened and rounded apically.
Panstrongylus chinai.Connexivum: dark brown or black, with orange-red irregularly shaped spots in posterolateral angle of each connexival plate, spots increasing in size from anterior to posterior segments; spots larger on under than on upper connexival surface in some specimens.
Panstrongylus chinai.Corium: and clavus uniformly dark brown or black, membrane fumose, dark brown.
Panstrongylus chinai.Eyes: in side view extending below level of under but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus chinai.Femora: with a slight protuberance apically below but without distinct denticles.
Panstrongylus chinai.First antennal segment: attaining level of apex of clypeus; second segment with inclined stiff setae longer than diameter of segment, some more than twice as long, and also with numerous shorter sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus chinai.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of middle of neck.
Panstrongylus chinai.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, not extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus chinai.Head: uniformly black, shallowly rugose transversally on entire upper surface.
Panstrongylus chinai.Hemelytra: approaching hind margin of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Panstrongylus chinai.Legs: uniformly dark brown or black, slender, fore femora 5-7 times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus chinai.Length: of male 22-27 , of female 21-25 ; width of pronotum of male 5,5-6,5 , of female 5,5-7,0 ; width of abdomen of male 7-9 , of female 9-10 Overall color brownish black to black, many specimens with bluish waxlike pruinosity; small reddish marks on neck, pronotum and connexivum, rarely absent.
Panstrongylus chinai.Neck: black, with I+ I lateral spots reddish.
Panstrongylus chinai.Overall color: brownish black to black, many specimens with bluish waxlike pruinosity; small reddish marks on neck, pronotum and connexivum, rarely absent.
Panstrongylus chinai.Pronotum: black, with orange-red markings as follows:apex of anterolateral projections, discal tubercles, lateral carinae of fore lobe and 2 + 2 spots along hind border of sclerite, 1 + I on humeral angles and l + 1 at level of submedian carinae.
Panstrongylus chinai.Scutellum: black, posterior process reddish at apex in some individuals.
Panstrongylus chinai.Spiracles: yellowish, close to connexival border, distance equal to their diameter or less.
Panstrongylus chinai.Submedian carinae: approaching or attaining hind border of sclerite.
Panstrongylus chinai.Urosternites: striate transversally; setae of venter short, inconspicuous.
Panstrongylus chinai.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened longitudinally along middle in female.

Panstrongylus diasi.Antenniferous tubercles: with small but distinct apicolateral process.
Panstrongylus diasi.Anteocular region: less than twice as long as postocular (1:0,60-0,65); postocular with sides rounded.
Panstrongylus diasi.Anterior lobe: of pronotum moderately convex, its surface even, ridges faint; discal and lateral tubercles absent.
Panstrongylus diasi.Connexivum: yellowish brown, anterior half or third ofeach connexival plate with black subrectangularspot, adjacent to intersegmental suture.
Panstrongylus diasi.Eyes: in side view extending in both sexes below level of ventral surface of head but remote from dorsal.
Panstrongylus diasi.First antennal segment: extending beyond level of apex of clypeus by about one-third of its own length.
Panstrongylus diasi.First rostral segment: extending close to level of anterior margin of eyes, second extending to level of base of neck.
Panstrongylus diasi.Fore: femora armed with one pair of strong subapical denticles followed or not by one additional, small denticle, or with one denticle only; mid femora with similar denticles, or unarmed.
Panstrongylus diasi.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, not quite attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus diasi.Head: uniformly brown, shallowly rugose dorsally along middle, otherwise smooth, polished.
Panstrongylus diasi.Hemelytra: extending to apex of abdomen; their color yellowish brown, with large central area of corium dark brown; clavus light brown.
Panstrongylus diasi.Legs: slender, with fore femora about six times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus diasi.Length: of male 26 , of female 27 ; width of pronotum of male 6,5 , of female 7,0 ; width of abdomen of male and female 9,5 Overall color yellowish brown, with darkbrown areas on pronotum, pleura, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus diasi.Membrane: fumose, slightly lighter colored than dark areas of corium.
Panstrongylus diasi.Overall color: yellowish brown, with darkbrown areas on pronotum, pleura, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus diasi.Posterior lobe: of pronotum distinctly but not deeply rugose.
Panstrongylus diasi.Posterior process: approximately as long as main body of scutellum, horizontal, narrowly cylindrical, rounded apically.
Panstrongylus diasi.Pronotum: light reddish brown, with the following areas dark brown:center of collar, anterior lobe of pronotum anteriorly at middle behind collar and in longitudinal furrow, posterior lobe with large central longitudinal mark as wide as space separating submedian carinae anteriorly but gradually tapering posteriorly, as well as 1+ 1 sublateral markings in areas between submedian and lateral carinae, these markings most conspicuous and largest anteriorly and posteriorly; posterior margin also dark except on posterolateral angles.
Panstrongylus diasi.Scutellum: dark brown, posterior process dark or light reddish brown.
Panstrongylus diasi.Second antennal segment: with short adpressed bristles, shorter than diameter of segment.
Panstrongylus diasi.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by about three times their diameter.
Panstrongylus diasi.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae in both sexes.
Panstrongylus diasi.Submedian carinae: low, evanescent on posterior third of posterior lobe.

Panstrongylus geniculatus.Anteocular region: about twice as long as postocular (l:0,45-0,55); postocular with sides straight, slightly converging toward behind.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Anterior lobe: of pronotum with central black marking in shape of four leaf clover, and l + 1 lateral black markings in shape of interrupted H; in some specimens short dark marking extending from base of H onto posterior lobe.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum shortly subconical, rounded apically.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Connexivum: light yellowish brown with black subrectangular marks on anterior third of dorsal connexival plates, of varied shape, frequently indented posteriorly.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Corium: as light as or slightly lighter than membrane, dark at extreme apex.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Eyes: in lateral view extending below level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Femora: and tibiae dark brown or black, femora with short, orange apical annulus, in many specimens a similar though shorter annulus on base of tibiae.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.First antennal segment: slightly extending beyond level of apex of clypeus; second segment with stiff inclined setae about as long as diameter of segment, as well as with numerous sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.First rostral segment: approaching or extending to or slightly beyond level of anterior margin of eyes; second rostral segment attaining level of middle of neck.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Fore: and mid femora with 2-6 (most frequently 4) small subapical denticles arranged in two rows .
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Genae: very narrowly tapering apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Head: uniformly light colored, or, in some specimens, dorsum with l + l narrow dark submedian stripes extending from base of jugae to space between ocelli.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen, in both sexes; their overall color light brown or light yellowish brown, with veins, especially those of membrane, conspicuously darker.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Jugae: short, angular, with incipient hook-shaped process .
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Legs: with fore femur about five and one-half times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Length: of male 22-28 , of female 22,5-29,5 ; width of pronotum of male 5,5-7,0 , of female 5,5-8,0 ; width of abdomen of male 7-10 , of female 7-12 Overall color light brown or light orangebrown, with dark brown or black pattern elements on various body parts.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Overall color: light brown or light orangebrown, with dark brown or black pattern elements on various body parts.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Posterior lobe: with black band along posterior margin except at humeral area, this band parallel sided or with anterior projections.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Scutellum: and its process black, sublateral callosities limiting shallow median depression orange-yellow; apex of process in some specimens light colored.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Spiracles: close to connexival suture, distant from the latter by not more than their own diameter.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid tibiae in both sexes, those of males larger, about as long as diameter of article, those of females not more than half as long as diameter of tibia apically.
Panstrongylus geniculatus.Venter: convex, not flattened distinctly on disc; urosternites delicately striate transversally.

Panstrongylus guentheri.Anteocular region: slightly less than twice as long as postocular (l:0,55-0,65); postocular very short and wide, its sides rounded.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Anterior lobe: conspicuously convex; elevated areas low, irregularly rugose; discal tubercles obsolescent, lateral tubercles absent.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum prominent, from narrowly conical to blunt.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Connexivum: orange brown; anterior half or third of each connexival plate with dark brown or black irregularly shaped subrectangular spot, adjacent to intersegmental suture.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Eyes: in lateral view comparatively small, remote from level of upper surface of head; eyes of male extending ventrally below level of under surface of head, but those of female not quite attaining level of under surface of head.
Panstrongylus guentheri.First antennal segment: unusually long, extending beyond level of apex of clypeus by close to one-half of its own length.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Fore: and mid femora with two rows of three to five conspicuous denticles each, extending over half the length of femur.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, not quite attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Head: uniformly orange-brown, very shallowly rugose dorsally along middle, otherwise smooth, polished.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Hemelytra: extending close to apex of seventh urotergite.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Legs: with fore femur approximately five times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Length: of male 22-25 , of female 24-27 ; width of pronotum of male and female 6-7 ; width of abdomen of male 8,5-9,5, of female 9,5-10,0 Overall color reddish or orange-brown, with dark brown areas on pronotum, pleura, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Membrane: somewhat lighter than dark portion of corium, fumose.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Ocelli: surrounded by ring of dark pigment.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Overall color: reddish or orange-brown, with dark brown areas on pronotum, pleura, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Pronotum: with anterior lobe light reddish brown, posterior lobe from uniformly light reddish brown to entirely dark brown, in some specimens dark color less extensive, with area of lateral margin and submedian carinae lighter.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2248, its first segment attaining level of anterior margin of eyes; second segment extending to level of base of neck.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Scutellum: dark brown, posterior process light brown in some specimens, conspicuously rugose, with shallow median depression.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Second antennal segment: with adpressed setae shorter than diameter of segment.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Spiracles: remote from connexival suture by about three times their diameter.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Spongy fossulae: on fore and mid legs of male, in female very small and distinct only on fore tibia.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Submedian carinae: low, evanescent on posterior half or third of posterior lobe.
Panstrongylus guentheri.Venter: convex, slightly flattened longitudinally along middle, delicately striate transversally.

Panstrongylus herreri.Antennae: with first and second segment black.
Panstrongylus herreri.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,30-0,35); postocular with sides faintly rounded, strongly converging toward behind.
Panstrongylus herreri.Anterior lobe: slightly convex, elevated areas slightly uneven, with 1 + 1 comparatively small discal tubercles, followed or not by 1 + 1 similar but smaller tubercles at base of submedian carinae; lateral tubercles present, well developed although smaller than discal tubercles; l+ 1 additional, sublateral tubercles invariably present, situated between posterior submedian and lateral tubercles.
Panstrongylus herreri.Body: surface with very short, inconspicuous golden setae.
Panstrongylus herreri.Eyes: in side view surpassing level of under and distant from level of upper surface of head, in lateral view.
Panstrongylus herreri.First antennal segment: approaching but not attaining level of apex of clypeus; second with inclined stiff setae not longer than diameter of segment, and with numerous short sensory hairs mainly on under surface of article.
Panstrongylus herreri.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to level of neck.
Panstrongylus herreri.Fore: and mid femora with 1 + 1 subapical denticles.
Panstrongylus herreri.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, attaining but not surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus herreri.Head: light brownish yellow, including genae and antenniferous tubercles; bucculae and entire under surface of head black.
Panstrongylus herreri.Hemelytra: closely approaching tip of abdomen, light yellowish brown or yellow, with complex dark brown and black pattern elements as illustrated in figure 225.
Panstrongylus herreri.Length: of male 20,5-22,0 , of female 23,0-27,5 ; width of pronotum of male 5,3-6,2 , of female 6,5-7,0 , width of abdomen of male 6,8-7
Panstrongylus herreri.Overall color: light brownish yellow dorsally, dark brown or black ventrally.
Panstrongylus herreri.Posterior lobe: of pronotum coarsely rugose, conspicuously flaring posterolaterally.
Panstrongylus herreri.Posterior process: of scutellum very short, about one-third as long as main body of scutellum, only slightly elevated at base, its apex knobbed.
Panstrongylus herreri.Scutellum: black, with light brown or yellowish median longitudinal stripe including entire posterior process, and light again at sides.
Panstrongylus herreri.Submedian carinae: attaining posterior third of posterior lobe.
Panstrongylus herreri.Urosternites: delicately striate transversally, with short, inconspicuous setae.
Panstrongylus herreri.Venter: convex, flattened longitudinally along middle, more strongly so in female than in male.

Panstrongylus howardi.Anteocular region: slightly over twice as long as postocular (l:0,40-0,45), postocular short and wide, with sides converging toward behind.
Panstrongylus howardi.Anterior lobe: of pronotum slightly convex, elevated areas not prominent.
Panstrongylus howardi.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum prominent, subconical, rounded apically.
Panstrongylus howardi.Connexivum: light reddish brown, each segment anteriorly with subrectangular black spot adjacent to intersegmental suture; spots occupying from one-third to one-half of total length of respective segment, extending over entire width of sclerite on under surface, but anterolaterally situated on dorsal connexival segments.
Panstrongylus howardi.Eyes: large, in lateral view considerably surpassing level of under surface but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus howardi.Femora: with slight subapical protuberance but without denticles.
Panstrongylus howardi.First antennal segment: attaining or slightly surpassing level of apex of clypeus; second segment with inclined stiff setae up to twice as long as diameter of segment, and with numerous short sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus howardi.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of middle of neck.
Panstrongylus howardi.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, not quite extending to level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus howardi.Head: entirely black, coarsely rugose on entire dorsal surface including clypeus.
Panstrongylus howardi.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen, their overall color pale yellowish brown, extreme base of corium and spot close to apex dark, cu-pcu cross-vein with short adjacent portions of other veins conspicuously darkened; apical two-thirds or three-fourths of membranal cells with some adjacent areas also darker brown.
Panstrongylus howardi.Legs: uniformly black, slender, fore femora seven times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus howardi.Length: 25-29 , width of pronotum 6,0-6,5 , of abdomen 8,5-11,0 Overall color dark brown or black, with reddish or yellowish areas on pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, and abdomen with connexivum.
Panstrongylus howardi.Overall color: dark brown or black, with reddish or yellowish areas on pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, and abdomen with connexivum.
Panstrongylus howardi.Posterior lobe: with l + l submedian triangular spots enclosing posterior two-thirds of submedian carinae, as well as I+ I large lateral markings, including humeral area and region immediately anterior to it but without attaining, or only narrowly attaining, transverse furrow of pronotum.
Panstrongylus howardi.Pronotum: black; orange-red on anterolateral processes, discal tubercles of anterior Jobe and lateral carinae with lateral tubercles.
Panstrongylus howardi.Scutellum: black, strongly rugose, its depression shallow, not extending to base of posterior process.
Panstrongylus howardi.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by about three times their own diameter.
Panstrongylus howardi.Submedian carinae: extending close to posterior margin of sclerite.
Panstrongylus howardi.Venter: convex, almost imperceptibly flattened longitudinally along middle, delicately striate transversally; setae short, inconspicuous.

Panstrongylus humeralis.Antennae: with first and second articles black.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (1:0,30-0,35); postocular with sides rounded, strongly converging toward behind.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Anterior lobe: slightly convex, elevated areas faintly granulose, with 1 + 1 large although not high discal tubercles, followed posteriorly by 1 + 1 similar but smaller tubercles at base of submedian carinae; lateral tubercles present, well developed although smaller than discal ones.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Body: surface with short, goldencolored setae, most distinct on head.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Clypeus: narrow, slightly widened on posterior half.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Connexivum: light orangebrown; each segment anteriorly with short black marking adjacent to intersegmental suture; posterior margin of dark spots deeply emarginate on upper connexival plates, straight across or oblique on ventral connexival plates.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Eyes: large, in side view surpassing level of under surface of head in both sexes but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Femora: with subapical annulus black, base of femora adjacent to trochanter yellow.
Panstrongylus humeralis.First antennal segment: almost attaining level of apex of clypeus; second with stiff setae as long as diameter of segment, and, mostly on under surface, with numerous short sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus humeralis.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles, second extending to level of middle of neck.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Fore: and mid tibiae with well developed spongy fossulae, in both sexes.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, falling slightly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Head: light brown, with dark markings as follows:a median stripe extending from level of jugae to level of anterior margin of ocelli, stripe wide anteriorly, narrowed toward behind; antenniferous tubercles, genae, bucculae, base of ocelliferous tubercles and entire under surface of head.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Hemelytra: closely approaching or attaining apex of abdomen, light brown, with complex dark brown or black pattern elements on corium and membrane, as illustrated ; base of membranal cells conspicuously sooty black.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Integument: of head faintly rugose and punctuate above.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Jugae: with conspicuous slightly curved spinelike projection.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Legs: with coxae black; trochantera yellow, remaining segments rust colored.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Length: of male 27,0-27,5 , of female 30-32 ; width of pronotum of male 8 ,of female 9 ; width of abdomen of male9-10 , of female 11,5-12,0 Overall color light brown dorsally and darkbrown or black below.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Overall color: light brown dorsally and darkbrown or black below.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Posterior process: of scutellum short, half or less than half as long as body of scutellum, conspicuously humped at base, apical portion slightly widened, rounded, elevated in lateral view.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Scutellum: light yellowish brown, with median dark longitudinal marking, basally as wide as central depression, almost linear apically, extending to dorsum of posterior process to close to its apex.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Tibiae: with basal and apical annulus black.
Panstrongylus humeralis.Venter: convex, distinctly flattened longitudinally along middle, in both sexes.

Panstrongylus lenti.Antenniferous tubercles: with small but distinct apicolateral process.
Panstrongylus lenti.Anteocular region: slightly less than twice as long as postocular (1:0,55), postocular short and wide, with sides slightly convex, converging toward behind.
Panstrongylus lenti.Corium: and clavus pale yellow, except cell adjoining clavus and extreme apex of corium which are brown.
Panstrongylus lenti.Eyes: in lateral view exceeding level of under but remote from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus lenti.First antennal segment: reddish brown, falling short of apex of clypeus; remaining segments not preserved.
Panstrongylus lenti.First rostral segment: attaining level of anterior margin of eyes, second extending to level of center of neck.
Panstrongylus lenti.Fore: femora five times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus lenti.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus lenti.Head: light yellowish brown, very faintly rugose transversally on dorsum along middle, otherwise smooth, polished.
Panstrongylus lenti.Length: 19 ; width of pronotum 5 ; of abdomen 7,5 Overall color very light reddish brown, with dark markings on pronotum, hemelytra, pleura and abdomen with connexivum.
Panstrongylus lenti.Membrane: brown, fumose, base of membranal cells and closely adjacent areas darker brown.
Panstrongylus lenti.Overall color: very light reddish brown, with dark markings on pronotum, hemelytra, pleura and abdomen with connexivum.
Panstrongylus lenti.Posterior lobe: of pronotum distinctly and irregularly wrinkled.
Panstrongylus lenti.Pronotum: of general body color; hind lobe with entire area between submedian carinae and lateral borders, and inner portion of areas between submedian carinae and lateral borders dark brown.
Panstrongylus lenti.Scutellum: with process dark brown, rugose, central depression well developed, extending onto base of posterior process.
Panstrongylus lenti.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by approximately three times their own diameter.
Panstrongylus lenti.Submedian carinae: low, evanescent on posterior third of hind lobe.
Panstrongylus lenti.Urosternites: IIIVI each with 1 + 1 conspicuous black sub lateral spots .

Panstrongylus lignarius.Antennae: with first and second segments black.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Anteocular region: from three to four times as long as postocular, the latter with sides faintly rounded, strongly converging posteriorly.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Anterior lobe: slightly convex, elevated areas faintly granulose, with 1 + 1 comparatively small discal tubercles, followed or not by 1 + 1 similar but smaller tubercles at base of submedian carinae; lateral tubercles present, well developed although smaller than discal tubercles; 1+ 1 additional, sublateral tubercles invariably present, situated between posterior submedian and lateral tubercles.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Body: surface with very short inconspicuous golden setae.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Eyes: large in both sexes, in lateral view surpassing level of under and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus lignarius.First antennal segment: approaching level of apex of clypeus; second with inclined stiff setae not longer than diameter of segment, and with numerous short sensory hairs mainly on under surface of article.
Panstrongylus lignarius.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second extending to level of neck.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Fore: and mid femora with 1 + 1 subapical denticles.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, attaining but not surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Head: light brown, including part or all of genae and antenniferous tubercles; bucculae and entire under surface of head black; dorsally, a faded dark stripe of irregular shape longitudinally along middle, extending from level of jugae to that of ocelli.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Hemelytra: closely approaching apex of abdomen, light brown, with complex dark brown or black pattern elements as illustrated in figures 234, 235.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Legs: ferrugineous or black, with yellow markings.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Length: of male 25-26 , of female 30-31 ; width of pronotum of male 7,0-7,5 , of female 8,0-8,5 ; width of abdomen of male 8-9 , of female 11-12 Overall color light brown dorsally; ferrugineous, dark brown or black ventrally.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Overall color: light brown dorsally; ferrugineous, dark brown or black ventrally.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Posterior process: of scutellum very short, one-half to one-third as long as main body of scutellum, only slightly elevated at base, its apex knobbed.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Scutellum: black, with light brown or yellowish median longitudinal stripe including entire posterior process, and again at sides of sclerite.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Submedian carinae: short, not attaining posterior third of hind lobe.
Panstrongylus lignarius.Venter: convex, flattened longitudinally along middle, more distinctly so in female than in male.

Panstrongylus Lutzi.Antenniferous tubercles: very short, with small but distinct apicolateral process.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Anteocular region: twice as long as postocular (1:0,50-0,55); postocular very short and wide, its sides rounded and covered from above by large, laterally protruding ocelli.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Anterior lobe: of pronotum convex; ridges low, inconspicuous; discal tubercles large, rounded; lateral tubercles much smaller than discal ones, mere elevations of lateral carinae.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Anterolateral projections: of pronotum about as large as discal tubercles, from conical to rounded.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Connexivum: yellowish brown, anterior third of half of each connexival segment with dark brown or black irregularly subrectangular spot adjacent to intersegmental suture.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Corium: yellowish brown, at center with large, irregularly shaped dark brown spot; apex of corium equally dark brown.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Eyes: in side view remote from level of upper but projecting below level of lower surface of head.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.First antennal segment: extending beyond level of apex of clypeus by one-third of its own length; second segment with inclined stiff setae and numerous short sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Fore: and mid femora with numerous denticles , arranged in two rows on apical twothirds, irregularly arranged near base of article, progressively increasing in size from base to apex of femora.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Genae: very narrowly tapering apically, falling slightly short of level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Head: uniformly dark yellowish brown, antenniferous tubercles dark brown, shallowly rugose dorsally along middle, otherwise smooth.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Legs: with fore femur approximately five times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Length: of male 24,0-28,5 , of female 28-29 ; width of pronotum of male 6,5-8,0, of female 7,5-8,0 ; width of abdomen of male 8-11 , of female 10,5-11,5 Overall color yellowish brown, with dark brown markings on head, pronotum, pleura, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Membrane: almost as dark as dark portion of corium, fumose.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Overall color: yellowish brown, with dark brown markings on head, pronotum, pleura, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2398; first segment attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercle, second segment extending to level of base of neck.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Scutellum: dark brown, with posterior process in some specimens lighter brown.
Panstrongylus Lutzi.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by about three times their diameter.

Panstrongylus megistus.Anteocular region: from two to three times as long as postocular (1:0,30-0,45); postocular very short and wide, its sides rounded, strongly convergent toward behind.
Panstrongylus megistus.Anterior lobe: convex, smooth, with elevated areas almost imperceptible; discal tubercles in most specimens large, subconical, with apex narrowly pointed but not spinelike; lateral tubercles well developed, similar to discal tubercles, as large as or smaller than latter.
Panstrongylus megistus.Body: surface with short, sparse, inconspicuous setae.
Panstrongylus megistus.Connexivum: black; connexival plates with transversal red markings on posterior fourth dorsally and on posterior third ventrally.
Panstrongylus megistus.Corium: and membrane black; corium with red spots at base and subapically.
Panstrongylus megistus.Eyes: large, in side view considerably surpassing level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus megistus.First antennal segment: distinctly surpassing level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus megistus.First rostral segment: attaining level of apex of antenniferous tubercles or, rarely, of anterior margin of eyes; second segment extending to level of middle of neck.
Panstrongylus megistus.Fore: and mid femora with subapical pair of small denticles.
Panstrongylus megistus.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, not extending beyond level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus megistus.Head: black, shallowly rugose transversally and slightly punctate above.
Panstrongylus megistus.Hemelytra: extending close to apex of abdomen.
Panstrongylus megistus.Humeral angles: narrowly rounded or angular, reflexed, explanate.
Panstrongylus megistus.Jugae: terminating with prominent, pointed free projection .
Panstrongylus megistus.Legs: black, with fore femora 4,5-6,0 times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus megistus.Length: of male 26-34 , of female 29-38 ; width of pronotum of male 7-10 , of female 8-10 ; width of abdomen of male 11-13 , of female 12-14 Overall color black, with red or light reddishbrown markings on neck, pronotum, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus megistus.Overall color: black, with red or light reddishbrown markings on neck, pronotum, scutellum, corium, and connexivum.
Panstrongylus megistus.Pronotum: with anterior lobe entirely black, rarely with I+ I small reddish marks between dorsal tubercles and collar, or with tubercles reddish; posterior lobe black, with 2+2 large red markings on posterior half or third,
Panstrongylus megistus.Scutellum: with lateral portions smooth; median depression extremely shallow, slightly rugose transversally, reddish, the red color continuing onto posterior process.
Panstrongylus megistus.Second antennal segment: with inclined stiff setae about as long as diameter of segment, and with numerous short sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus megistus.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by about their own diameter.
Panstrongylus megistus.Submedian carinae: low, not extending to posterior half of lobe.
Panstrongylus megistus.Urosternites: delicately striate transversally; setae of venter short, inconspicuous.
Panstrongylus megistus.Venter: convex, very slightly flattened at center longitudinally in female.

Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Antennae: with first and second articles black.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Anteocular region: three to four times as long as postocular (l:0,25-0,35); postocular with sides rounded, strongly converging toward behind.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Anterior lobe: black, with anterolateral projections and discal and lateral tubercles red.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Anterolateral projections: strongly compressed dorsoventrally, subrectangular, their apex obliquely truncate, anterolaterally and slightly upwardly directed.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Clypeus: reddish, black only at base; dorsal surface of head with elongate reddish mark extending longitudinally along center, approximately Y-shaped, bifurcate anteriorly, extending from level of jugae to interocellar space.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Connexivum: spotted with light and dark, the light portions orange or rust-red and yellow.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Corium: streaked with brown mostly along veins; membrane dotted with dark, outer membranal cell with compact dark area subbasally.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Eyes: large in most specimens, in lateral view surpassing level of under but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Fore: and mid femora with three or four short denticles, rarely only two, in some specimens up to three minute accessory ones.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Genae: tapering distally, falling short of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Head: blackish, including antenniferous tubercles, genae, bucculae, and entire under surface of head.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Hemelytra: extending to apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Humeral angles: salient, from narrowly rounded to subangular, narrowly explanate.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Integument: of dorsal body surface with conspicuous golden colored adpressed setae, many scalelike .
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Legs: stout, fore femora 3,8-4,7 times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Length: of male 24-27 , of female 25-28 ; width of pronotum of male and female 6-7 , of abdomen of male 8-9 , of female 9-IO Overall color dark brown or black, with light yellowish brown or red markings on head, neck, thorax, legs, and abdomen; hemelytra tinged with pale green, their markings dark brown.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Overall color: dark brown or black, with light yellowish brown or red markings on head, neck, thorax, legs, and abdomen; hemelytra tinged with pale green, their markings dark brown.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Posterior lobe: with part of submedian carinae, explanate portion of humeral angles and l + l small spots posterior to termination of submedian carinae, red; one large central spot adjacent to hind margin and l + l sublateral spots on disc of humeri, yellowish or orange red.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Posterior process: shorter than main body of scutellum, subconical, horizontal, not elevated at base, its apex rounded, suboval or subglobose.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Rostrum: with first and second articles black, thirddark reddish brown.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Scutellum: black, posterior process apically or entirely red.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Setae: of venter golden colored, numerous, slender, inclinate, well perceptible.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Spiracles: either adjoining connexival suture or distant from latter by not more than their own diameter.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Submedian carinae: extending over three-fourths of length of posterior lobe.
Panstrongylus rufotuberculatus.Venter: convex, distinctly flattened longitudinally along middle, in both sexes.

Panstrongylus tupynambai.Antenniferous tubercles: with very small but distinct apicolateral process.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Anteocular region: about twice as long as postocular (1:0,45-0,60), postocular very short and wide, its sides rounded but obscured from above by protruding ocelli.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Body: surface with short, sparse hairs, appearing glabrous.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Connexivum: reddish brown; anterior half or third of each connexival segment with black, subrectangular spot adjoining intersegmental suture.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Corium: dark reddish brown, light reddish brown at base and narrowly along margin, as well as an irregular reddish spot subapically adjacent to base of outer membranal cell.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Eyes: in side view extending below level of under surface but distant from level of upper surface of head.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.First antennal segment: extending slightly beyond level of apex of clypeus; second antennal segment with inclined stiff setae about as long as diameter of segment as well as with numerous dedicate short sensory hairs.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Fore: femora 5,5 times as long as wide.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Genae: narrowly rounded apically, not quite attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Head: uniformly dark brown, neck reddish brown.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Hemelytra: of male extending to apex of abdomen, but only to middle of seventh urotergite in female .
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Length: of male 22 , of female 25 ;width of pronotum of male 5 , of female 6 ; width of abdomen of male 7,5 , of female 9 Overall color light reddish brown, with dark brown areas on pronotum, corium and connexivum.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Overall color: light reddish brown, with dark brown areas on pronotum, corium and connexivum.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Posterior lobe: reddish brown, with central dark brown marking on anterior half of space between submedian carinae; 1 + 1 wide dark markings on spaces between submedian and lateral carinae, extending from transversal sulcus to posterior margin of sclerite.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Pronotum: with collar and anterior lobe reddish brown or dark brown.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2480, E; first segment as long as or slightly longer than second, extending beyond level of anterior margin of eyes; second segment attaining level of center of neck.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Scutellum: dark brown, posterior process dark or light brown.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Spiracles: distant from connexival suture by two or three times their own diameter.
Panstrongylus tupynambai.Submedian carinae: low, evanescent on posterior third of posterior lobe of pronotum.

Paratriatoma Barber.Antenniferous tubercles: situated behind middle of anteocular portion of head.
Paratriatoma Barber.First rostral segment: much shorter than second but longer than third; third without rostral organ.
Paratriatoma Barber.Fore: lobe of pronotum without discal or lateral tubercles.
Paratriatoma Barber.Head: elongate subconical or ovoid, strongly convex above.
Paratriatoma Barber.Legs: with femora unarmed; spongy fossulae absent.
Paratriatoma Barber.Rostrum: as long as head, extending to level of prosternum.
Paratriatoma Barber.Venter: convex, slightly flattened along middle longitudinally.

Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Abdomen: convex below, distinctly flattened longitudinally along middle, more strongly so in female.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted near anterior margin of eyes.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Anteocular region: twice as long as postocular (1:0,5-0,6); postocular with sides straight or convex, in many specimens widest behind middle.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Clypeus: narrow anteriorly, unusually wide on posterior half, limited posteriorly by transverse impression.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Connexivum: wide dorsally , visible portion of ventral connexival plates narrow .
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Corium: darker than membrane, covered with numerous long setae.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Eyes: small, in lateral view not attaining levels of under and upper surface of head, more distant from latter than from former.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Genae: narrowly tapering apically, attaining level of apex of clypeus.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Head: , rugose transversally along middle, with long forwardly inclined setae.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen in male, extending to seventh or base of eighth urotergite in female.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Legs: short , fore femur 4,3-4,8 times as long as wide.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Length: of male 12,0-13,5 , of female 12,5-14,5 ; width of thorax of male 3,0 , of female 3,5 ; width of abdomen of male 3,5 , of female 5,0 Overall color pattern consisting of various shades of brown , from light yellow brown to dark brownish black; in dark specimens corium and legs distinctly lighter.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Overall color: pattern consisting of various shades of brown , from light yellow brown to dark brownish black; in dark specimens corium and legs distinctly lighter.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Posterior lobe: rugose transversally, with submedian carinae obsolescent, distinctly perceptible only on anterior third of posterior lobe of pronotum.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Posterior process: of scutellum varied in length, from as long as, to only half as long as, main body of sclerite.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Pronotum: with anterior lobe slightly convex, without discal or lateral tubercles.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Rostrum: subcylindrical, with long setae on all articles.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Scutellum: coarsely rugose, in many cases darker than pronotum; median impression shallow but in most specimens distinct, limited by 1 + 1 distinct narrow carinae.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Spiracles: distant from lateral border of urostemites by several times their diameter.
Paratriatoma hirsuta Barber.Urosternites: faintly striate transversally in central portion, irregularly wrinkled on lateral half of each side; microsculpture difficult to make out due to highly polished, reflective integument.

RHODNIINI PINTO.Abdomen: with urostemites covering part or all of ventral connexival segments, connected to latter by simple membrane.
RHODNIINI PINTO.Body: surface from smooth to moderately rugose, with very short bristles only.
RHODNIINI PINTO.Genae: from slightly to considerably surpassing apex of clypeus, the latter slightly but distinctly widened apically.
RHODNIINI PINTO.Head: not strongly convex above.
RHODNIINI PINTO.Ocelli: situated posterolaterally behind eyes, in most cases inserted on conspicuous elevations behind interocular sulcus, the latter not fully developed.
RHODNIINI PINTO.Second antennal segment: with 4-6 trichobothria arranged in one row along length of article, and two ancillary trichobothria laterad of base of main row.

Rhodnius Stal.Abdomen: convex below, in some cases center of urostemites slightly flattened.
Rhodnius Stal.Antennae: with first segment unusually short, attaining level of apex of clypeus; second article at least four and onehalf times as long as first, third slightly shorter than second (except in brethesi where third is longer than second), fourth shorter than the two preceding.
Rhodnius Stal.Antenniferous tubercles: short, insertion of antennae situated near apex of head.
Rhodnius Stal.Anteocular region: in most species at least three times as long as postocular; postocular not more than twice as long as wide.
Rhodnius Stal.Anterolateral angles: shortly projecting, rounded or angular apically.
Rhodnius Stal.Clypeus: narrow, parallel-sided but widened at apex.
Rhodnius Stal.Connexivum: wide dorsally, ventral portion partially or entirely covered by stemite, in former case much narrower than dorsal portion.
Rhodnius Stal.Femora: from parallel-sided to fusiform, without spines or tubercles.
Rhodnius Stal.Fore: lobe simple; hind lobe granulose and rugose.
Rhodnius Stal.Genitalia: of female truncate, eighth and ninth tergites subvertical.
Rhodnius Stal.Genae: situated below level of clypeus, slightly surpassing the latter apically.
Rhodnius Stal.Head: slender and elongate, subcylindrical, from two to three times as long as wide across eyes, in most cases longer than pronotum.
Rhodnius Stal.Legs: long and slender, with scattered short setae.
Rhodnius Stal.Ocelli: well developed, inserted on small lateral protuberances, their distance slightly larger than dorsal interocular distance.
Rhodnius Stal.Rostrum: attammg prostemum, slender, subcylindrical, slightly flattened dorsoventrally.
Rhodnius Stal.Scutellum: coarsely rugose transversally, with depressed area at center; apical process short, subcylindrical, rounded apically.
Rhodnius Stal.Spiracles: distant from lateral border of urostemite.
Rhodnius Stal.Tibiae: of first and second pairs of legs with short spongy fossulae, in both sexes.

Rhodnius brethes.Anteocular region: between three and four times as long as postocular (l:0,25-0,30).
Rhodnius brethes.Connexivum: with ventral portion narrowly visible, black dorsally and ventrally, each segment with orange or reddish rectangular spot on posterior half.
Rhodnius brethes.Eyes: large, attaining level of under and in lateral view attaining or closely approaching level of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius brethes.General color: black, with light brown spots and stripes on dorsal surface of head and neck, on pronotum, scutellum, hemelytra, connexivum, and ventral surface of abdomen.
Rhodnius brethes.Head: granulose, black, with narrow dorsal longitudinal stripe yellowish.
Rhodnius brethes.Hemelytra: dark brown to blackish on corium and membrane, with veins included in prominent light brown bands.
Rhodnius brethes.Length: of male 19,0-19,5 , of female 19-20 Maximum width of pronotum4,0-4,5 , in both sexes; maximum width ofabdomen 5-6 , in both sexes.
Rhodnius brethes.Neck: black, with lightcolored stripe longitudinally along center.
Rhodnius brethes.Pronotum: black, with l+I submedian longitudinal light brown stripes extending from collar over submedian carinae to hind border of pronotum; stripes thus dividing pronotum into three black areas.
Rhodnius brethes.Scutellum: black, with l + l basally unusually wide light brown carinae meeting at base of posterior process, with light color continuing on process.

Rhodnius domesticus.Antennae: with second article brown, turning black toward apex; third article with basal half black and apical half whitish or yellow; fourth yellow, its tip dark.
Rhodnius domesticus.Anteocular region: from two and one-half to three times as long as postocular (l:0,3-0,4).
Rhodnius domesticus.Connexivum: only very narrowly visible from below.
Rhodnius domesticus.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of under but not upper surface of head.
Rhodnius domesticus.General color: light orange-brown, with dark brown markings on several areas of body and appendages.
Rhodnius domesticus.Head: dark, with dorsum narrowly light-colored longitudinally, about two and one-half times as long as wide across eyes (1:0,5), and as long as or only slightly longer than pronotum (1:0,95:1,0).
Rhodnius domesticus.Hemelytra: pale, with corium reddish brown and membrane faintly pigmented.
Rhodnius domesticus.Legs: with coxae, trochantera, and femora uniformly dark brown; tibiae light brown with dark apical annulus.
Rhodnius domesticus.Length: of male 15-17 , of female 16,5-18,0 Maximum width of pronotum of male 4 , of female 4,0-4,5 ; maximum width of abdomen of male 5,5-6,0 , of female 6-7 General color light orange-brown, with dark brown markings on several areas of body and appendages.
Rhodnius domesticus.Neck: light colored dorsally, with l + l submedian black stripes.
Rhodnius domesticus.Pronotum: with submedian carinae and lateral ridges bright yellow.
Rhodnius domesticus.Scutellum: black; l+ 1 lightcolored carinae, shortly bifurcate at anterior extremity, meeting before base of posterior process, the latter light colored above.
Rhodnius domesticus.Submedian carinae: with l + I mediad directed lightcolored projections; space between carinae and lateral margin with complex shaped light-colored areas.

Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Abdomen: light yellowish brown ventrally, irregularly mottled with dark brown.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,40-0,45).
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Genitalia: of male with median process of pygophore shortly triangular, its apex pointed
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.General color: light brown with dark brown markings on body and appendages, in form of stripes or small irregularly shaped spots, the latter especially conspicuous on legs.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Head: granulose, twice as long as wide across eyes (1:0,5), and only little longer than pronotum (1:0,90-0,95).
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Hemelytra: straw colored including veins; spaces between veins with irregularly shaped dark stripes and spots, dotted with lighter.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Legs: light yellowish brown, mottled with dark brown, most conspicuously so on femora, comparatively stout, fore femora four and one-half times as long as wide.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Length: of male 12,5-13,5 , of female 14,5 Maximum width of pronotum of male 2,5-3,0 , of female 2,8-3,2 , maximum width of abdomen of male 3,8-4,2, of female 4,8-5,2 General color light brown with dark brown markings on body and appendages, in form of stripes or small irregularly shaped spots, the latter especially conspicuous on legs.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Neck: light colored dorsally, dark at sides.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Pronotum: with anterior lobe granulose and posterior lobe granulose-rugose.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2588; second segment attaining or slightly surpassing level of ocelli but not attaining neck.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Scutellum: with 2+2 distinct anterior light-colored carinae, fused into 1 + 1 at level of center of scutellum and into a single carina posteriorly, with light color extending onto upper surface of posterior process.
Rhodnius ecuadoriensis.Second antennal segment: light brown on basal three-fifths, slightly speckled with darker; apical two-fifths dark brown.

Rhodnius nasutus.Antennae: reddish brown with apex of second and apical half of third articles darker; ratio of antennal segments 1:6,2-7,0:3,2:2,5.
Rhodnius nasutus.Anteocular region: slightly over three times as long as postocular (1:0,3).
Rhodnius nasutus.Connexivum: narrowly visible from below, dorsally with not very prominent darker spots on anterolateral angle of each segment ; these spots in some cases with pointed posterior projection, or of washed-out appearance.
Rhodnius nasutus.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius nasutus.Genitalia: of male with median process of pygophore relatively short, wide at base, narrowly rounded
Rhodnius nasutus.General color: pale yellowish brown, frequently tinged with reddish, with faint darker brown spots on some regions of body and appendages.
Rhodnius nasutus.Head: about two and one-half times as long as wide across eyes (1:0,35-0,40), distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,6-0,7).
Rhodnius nasutus.Hemelytra: light reddish brown, with veins narrowly pale yellow; veins of cells and apical extracellular space suffused with lighter color at center.
Rhodnius nasutus.Legs: uniformly light reddish brown, slender, fore femora six times as long as wide.
Rhodnius nasutus.Length: of male 12,5-16,5 , of female 14-18 ; maximum width of pronotum ofmale 2,5-3,5 , of female 3,0-4,5 ;maximum width of abdomen of male 3,5-5,0, of female 4-6 General color pale yellowish brown, frequently tinged with reddish, with faint darker brown spots on some regions of body and appendages.
Rhodnius nasutus.Neck: light colored above, dark at sides.
Rhodnius nasutus.Pronotum: with anterior lobe granulose and posterior lobe granulose-rugose, the latter with area between submedian carinae dark, faintly subdivided by median light-colored stripe; the 1 + 1 areas between submedian carinae and lateral border with dark stripes confluent, forming uniform dark area.
Rhodnius nasutus.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2618; second segment attaining neck; ratio of rostral segments 1:3,4-3,7:0,9-1,0.
Rhodnius nasutus.Scutellum: dark, with 1+ 1 light-colored carinae, shortly bifurcate anteriorly, fused posteriorly and continuing on to posterior process which is light colored above and dark at sides.

Rhodnius neglectus.Abdomen: with under surface of general brown color, but center of anterior urostemites yellow, thus wide percurrent yellow band extending along center of venter, in many cases extending onto metasternum.
Rhodnius neglectus.Anteocular region: over three times as long as postocular (1:0,25-0,30).
Rhodnius neglectus.Connexivum: narrowly visible from below, dorsally with anterior half or two-thirds brown, theremainder yellow.
Rhodnius neglectus.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of under but remote from level of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius neglectus.General color: light brown, with dark brown markings on head, pronotum, scutellum, corium, and connexivum, and yellowish areas on abdomen ventrally, on connexivum and on coxae and trochantera.
Rhodnius neglectus.Head: faintly granulose, about three times as long as wide across eyes (1:0,35-0,40), and much longer than pronotum (1:0,75-0,80).
Rhodnius neglectus.Hemelytra: dark brown, with veins lighter colored.
Rhodnius neglectus.Legs: dark brown; coxae, trochantera, and short basal annulus of tibiae yellowish.
Rhodnius neglectus.Neck: light colored dorsally, dark at sides.
Rhodnius neglectus.Pronotum: with anterior lobe almost entirely smooth, posterior lobe rugosegranulose.
Rhodnius neglectus.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2648; second segment attaining neck.
Rhodnius neglectus.Scutellum: with 2+ 2 short but distinct anterior light-colored carinae, fused into l + 1 carinae at level of anterior third of scutellum and into a single carina posteriorly, with light color extending over entire dorsal surface of posterior process.
Rhodnius neglectus.Submedian carinae: extending from collar to hind border of pronotum, light yellowish brown; lateral margins of pronotum also light yellowish brown, light-colored border wider on hind than on fore lobe.

Rhodnius neivai.Abdomen: with connexival segments narrowly visible ventrally.
Rhodnius neivai.Anteocular region: three times as long as postocular (l:0,3).
Rhodnius neivai.Anterior lobe: granulose, with glabrous areas; posterior lobe rugose.
Rhodnius neivai.Eyes: comparatively small, in lateral view not quite attaining level of lower and distant from level of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius neivai.First rostral segment: attaining level of base of antenniferous tubercles, second extending slightly beyond level of ocelli but not reaching neck.
Rhodnius neivai.Genitalia: of male with median process of pygophore simple, narrowly
Rhodnius neivai.General color: uniformly dark brown or blackish; rostrum, antennae, and ventral surface of abdomen reddish brown; second to fifth or sixth connexival segments dorsally and ventrally with small, irregularly shaped spot on posterolateral angles.
Rhodnius neivai.Head: granulose, two and one-half times as long as wide across eyes (l:0,4), and much longer than pronotum (1:0,75-0,80).
Rhodnius neivai.Hemelytra: falling considerably short of apex of abdomen, not extending much beyond base and at most reaching middle of seventh urotergite.
Rhodnius neivai.Legs: uniformly blackish, slender, fore femora approximately six times as long as wide.
Rhodnius neivai.Length: of male 17-18 , of female 20-21 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 3,5-4,0 , of female 4,0-4,5 ; maximum width of abdomen of male 5,5-6,0 , of female 6,0-6,5 General color uniformly dark brown or blackish; rostrum, antennae, and ventral surface of abdomen reddish brown; second to fifth or sixth connexival segments dorsally and ventrally with small, irregularly shaped spot on posterolateral angles.
Rhodnius neivai.Scutellum: with posterior process short, strongly tapering apically.

Rhodnius pallescens.Antennae: of general body color, second article black on apical third or half, in some specimens third article darkened at base.
Rhodnius pallescens.Anteocular region: slightly more than three times as long as postocular (1:0,30).
Rhodnius pallescens.Connexivum: light yellowish brown, anterior half of each segment with rectangular dark spot, this spot in some cases lighter at center.
Rhodnius pallescens.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of under but remote from level of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius pallescens.General color: yellowish brown with dark brown spots, in many cases dotted with lighter.
Rhodnius pallescens.Head: light colored longitudinally on dorsum, about two and one-half times as long as wide (1:0,35-0,40), and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,800,85).
Rhodnius pallescens.Hemelytra: straw-colored, clouded with darker, some of the dark areas dotted with lighter color.
Rhodnius pallescens.Legs: with femora and tibiae irregularly speckled with light and dark, slender, fore femora approximately seven and one-half times as long as wide.
Rhodnius pallescens.Length: of male 21,5, of female 22,0-23,5 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 4,5 , of female 4,5-5,0 , of abdomen of male 7 , of female 6,5-7,0 General color yellowish brown with dark brown spots, in many cases dotted with lighter.
Rhodnius pallescens.Neck: light-colored dorsally, with 1 + l sublateral very dark stripes.
Rhodnius pallescens.Pronotum: with anterior lobe slightly granulose, with irregularly shaped dark spots; posterior lobe rugose and granulose, overall aspect of hind lobe mottled.
Rhodnius pallescens.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2708; ratio of rostral segments 1:3,7-4,6:0,9-1,2.
Rhodnius pallescens.Scutellum: dark, with 2+2 yellowish carinae on anterior portion, fused into 1 + I at level of center of scutellum, and into a single carina posteriorly, light color extending onto dorsal surface of scutellar process.

Rhodnius paraensis.Abdomen: yellowish brown ventrally, irregularly clouded with dark.
Rhodnius paraensis.Anteocular region: less than twice as long as postocular (1:0,65).
Rhodnius paraensis.First antennal segment: yellowish brown; second and basal three-fifths of third black, apical portion of third whitish; fourth white with short basal annulus dark.
Rhodnius paraensis.Head: granulose, especially so on sides; its color light brown, with anteclypeus, genae, antenniferous tubercles, ocelliferous tubercles, lateral surface except behind eyes and entire under surface, dark brown, almost black.
Rhodnius paraensis.Hemelytra: dark brown; narrowly yellowish brown at base.
Rhodnius paraensis.Legs: light yellowish brown, with coxae, one large basal and one large apical annulus on femora, apical fourfifths of fore tibia, and one large submedian and one large apical annulus on mid and hind tibiae, dark brown.
Rhodnius paraensis.Length: of male 10,5-11,0 , of female 10,8-12,0 ; width of pronotum of male 2,8 , of female 3,0 ; width of abdomen of male and female 4 Overall color light brown, with very dark brown markings on body and appendages; hemelytra almost entirely dark .
Rhodnius paraensis.Neck: black, yellowish brown at center and laterally.
Rhodnius paraensis.Overall color: light brown, with very dark brown markings on body and appendages; hemelytra almost entirely dark .
Rhodnius paraensis.Pronotum: with anterior lobe feebly granulose, posterior lobe distinctly, irregularly rugose.
Rhodnius paraensis.Scutellum: with 1 + 1 distinct anterior light-colored carinae fused posteriorly into a single carina; light color extending along entire posterior process.

Rhodnius pictipes.Abdomen: light yellowish brown, areolate, with dark brown spots.
Rhodnius pictipes.Antennae: with second article yellow on basal and black on apical half; third article yellow with dark subbasal annulus.
Rhodnius pictipes.Anteocular region: about three times as long as postocular (1:0,30-0,35).
Rhodnius pictipes.Eyes: large, in lateral view attaining level of ventral but not of dorsal surface of head.
Rhodnius pictipes.General color: yellowish brown, with dark brown spots on various body regions and appendages; overall aspect mottled .
Rhodnius pictipes.Head: granulose, about two and one-half times as long as wide across eyes (1:0,40-0,45), and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,85-0,95).
Rhodnius pictipes.Hemelytra: straw-colored; corium with numerous irregular small dark spots; membrane rugose; intracellular and extracellular areas dark, with central faintly lighter colored confluent spots.
Rhodnius pictipes.Length: of male 15-20 , of female 16,5-22,0 Maximum width of pronotum of male and female 4,5 , of abdomen of male 5-7 , of female 5,5-8,0 General color yellowish brown, with dark brown spots on various body regions and appendages; overall aspect mottled .
Rhodnius pictipes.Neck: light-colored dorsally, with I+ I dark sublateral stripes.
Rhodnius pictipes.Pronotum: with posterior lobe granulose-rugose; basic color dark brown or black, with granules light colored; overall aspect mottled.
Rhodnius pictipes.Rostrum: as shown in figure 2758; second segment attaining neck; ratio of rostral segments 1:3,9-4,5:0,9-1,2.
Rhodnius pictipes.Scutellum: with 2+2 distinct basal light-colored carinae, fused into 1 + 1 at central portion of scutellum and into a single carina posteriorly, with light color extending to upper surface of scutellar process.
Rhodnius pictipes.Tibiae: yellowish, with blackish brown annulus on basal third and on apex.

Rhodnius prolixus.Antennae: dark, with apical three-fifths of third article, and fourth article entirely except tip, whitish.
Rhodnius prolixus.Anteocular region: approximately three, rarely up to four times as long as postocular (l:0,20-0,35).
Rhodnius prolixus.Connexivum: narrowly visible from below, or completely covered by urosternites.
Rhodnius prolixus.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius prolixus.General color: light yellowish brown, with dark brown markings on various regions of body and appendages.
Rhodnius prolixus.Head: dark yellowish brown, granulose at sides; dorsally with narrow light-colored percurrent stripe extending from clypeus to neck, this region not granulose but shortly setose, rest of dorsal surface of head dark, only faintly granulose.
Rhodnius prolixus.Hemelytra: with veins narrowly margined with pale yellow, remainder of hemelytron dark brown, uniform on corium, brown areas on membrane observable with diffuse illumination.
Rhodnius prolixus.Legs: uniformly brownish ; femora in some instances darker on certain areas; tibiae darker at apex, slender, about six times as long as wide.
Rhodnius prolixus.Length: of male 17,5-20,0 , of female 19,5-21,5 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 4,0-4,5 , of female 4-5 ; maximum width of abdomen of male 5,5-6,0 , of female 6-7 General color light yellowish brown, with dark brown markings on various regions of body and appendages.
Rhodnius prolixus.Posterior lobe: with two dark brown, distinctly separated longitudinal stripes between submedian carinae and on each side between submedian carinae and lateral margin.
Rhodnius prolixus.Pronotum: with submedian carinae and lateral margins light yellowish brown.
Rhodnius prolixus.Scutellum: dark, with I+ I light yellowish brown carinae, somewhat widened anteriorly and fused at base of scutellar process, the latter light colored above.

Rhodnius robustus.Abdomen: in some specimens rather uniformly dark brown ventrally, but in most brown speckled with yellow; longitudinal percurrent dark line along center, widened slightly at middle of each segment; venter also on each segment with 1 + 1 submedian oblique and 1 + 1 sublateral longitudinal marks.
Rhodnius robustus.Antennae: with second article uniformly blackish brown, third light yellow except dark brown basal fourth; fourth article light colored.
Rhodnius robustus.Anteocular region: approximately four times as long as postocular (1:0,25).
Rhodnius robustus.Connexivum: narrowly visible from below or completely covered by urostemites; dorsally light yellowish brown, each segment with large brownish black spot occupying at least anterior half of each segment, with posterior narrowly pointed projection.
Rhodnius robustus.Eyes: large, in lateral view surpassing level of under but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
Rhodnius robustus.General color: yellowish brown, with very dark brown markings on various regions of body and appendages.
Rhodnius robustus.Head: very dark brown, granulose laterally and ventrally; dorsally with narrow light-colored median longitudinal stripe extending from clypeus to neck.
Rhodnius robustus.Hemelytra: dark brown, veins very conspicuously although narrowly bordered with light color; space between veins uniformly dark on corium, suffused with light on membrane.
Rhodnius robustus.Legs: with coxae and trochantera partially or entirely dark; femora reddish brown, tibiae of identical color or yellowish brown, darker at apex.
Rhodnius robustus.Length: of male 20,0-23,5 , of female 23-26 Maximum width of pronotum ofmale 4,5-5,0 , of female 5-6 ; maximum width of abdomen of male 6-7 , offemale 6,0-7,5 General color yellowish brown, with very dark brown markings on various regions of body and appendages.
Rhodnius robustus.Pronotum: as inprolixus, but anterolateral angles less prominent .
Rhodnius robustus.Rostrum: as shown in figure 281A; second segment extending beyond level of ocelli, almost attaining neck; ratio of rostral segments 1:4,1-4,4:0,9-1,0.

Psammolestes Bergroth.Abdomen: convex below, small central area on each urosternite somewhat flattened.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Antenniferous tubercles: short; antennal insertion closer to apex of head than to anterior margin of eyes.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Anteocular region: from two to three times as long as postocular; postocular very short, from one fourth to onethird as long as wide.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Clypeus: short, parallel-sided or slightly widened apically.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Connexivum: wide dorsally, ventral portion partially covered by urosternites.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Femora: and tibia laterally compressed, the femora very conspicuously so.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Genitalia: of female truncate, last tergites subvertical.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Head: compressed dorsoventrally, short, only slightly longer than wide across eyes, and shorter than pronotum.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Hemelytra: attaining or almost attaining apex of abdomen; their veins normally developed.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Legs: short, stout without spines or tubercles.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Ocelli: well developed, inserted on protuberances behind above-mentioned sulcus, their distance slightly larger than dorsal interocular distance.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Pronotum: with sides carinate; its surface smooth, without tubercles or granules.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Rostrum: strongly flattened dorsoventrally, first and third segments short, subequal, second segment twice as long as first.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Scutellum: coarsely rugose transversally, slightly depressed anteriorly at center.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Spiracles: distant from lateral border of urosternites.
Psammolestes Bergroth.Tibiae: of first and second pairs with short spongy fossulae, in both sexes.

Psammolestes arthuri.Abdomen: with venter yellowish brown, irregularly reticulated with dark.
Psammolestes arthuri.Anteocular region: almost three times as long as postocular (1:0,35-0,40).
Psammolestes arthuri.Anterior lobe: with 1 + l anterolateral, more or less oval, dark spots, and lateral and submedian dark glabrous spots of irregular shape.
Psammolestes arthuri.Anterolateral angles: pronounced, pointed, projecting forward to level of ocelli and postocular callosities.
Psammolestes arthuri.Clypeus: parallelsided; genae parallel, inconspicuous, attaining or slightly surpassing clypeus.
Psammolestes arthuri.Eyes: small, in lateral view not attaining level of lower surface of head.
Psammolestes arthuri.Genitalia: of male with basal plate struts large, fused at base ; dorsal sclerotization of phallosoma slightly angular distally .
Psammolestes arthuri.General color: pale straw yellow with scattered brownish spots, setae short, golden colored, Integument shining, appearing varnished.
Psammolestes arthuri.Head: distinctly longer than wide (1:0,80-0,85) and as long as or shorter than pronotum (1:0,95-1,15), dorsally with wide longitudinal percurrent yellowish stripe occupying entire dorsal interocular space, tapering anteriorly and posteriorly, covering clypeus as well as interocellar space and center of neck.
Psammolestes arthuri.Hemelytra: of male attaining, those of female falling very slightly short of, apex of abdomen.
Psammolestes arthuri.Legs: with femora light brown, with irregularly scattered dark brown spots.
Psammolestes arthuri.Length: of male 11-13 , of female 12-14 Width of pronotum of male 3,0-3,5, offemale 3,2-4,0 , width of abdomen ofmale 4-5 , of female 4,5-5,5 General color pale straw yellow with scattered brownish spots, setae short, golden colored, Integument shining, appearing varnished.
Psammolestes arthuri.Overall color: of hemelytra yellowish, cells of membrane only slightly darkened.
Psammolestes arthuri.Posterior lobe: rugose, depressed anteriorly, sublaterally on each side with a distinct longitudinal depression, separating humerus from disc of pronotum.
Psammolestes arthuri.Pronotum: conspicuously flattened, light brown; densely beset with short yellowish setae except on smooth dark areas on fore lobe.
Psammolestes arthuri.Tibiae: dark brown, with lightcolored basal annulus.

Psammolestes coreodes.Abdomen: with venter yellowish brown, irregularly reticulated with dark, and with longitudinal rows of dark spots.
Psammolestes coreodes.Antennae: yellowish, spotted with dark; second article entirely dark apically, third darkened submedially.
Psammolestes coreodes.Anteocular region: about twice as long as postocular (l:0,45-0,55).
Psammolestes coreodes.Anterolateral angles: flattened, acuminate, short, not attaining level of ocelli.
Psammolestes coreodes.Eyes: large, in lateral view attaining or not, but not surpassing, level of lower and closely approaching level of dorsal surface of head.
Psammolestes coreodes.Genitalia: of male with basal plate struts very small, separated, hookshaped ; dorsal sclerotization of phallosoma semielliptical .
Psammolestes coreodes.Genae: conspicuous, strongly diverging, considerably surpassing clypeus.
Psammolestes coreodes.General color: light yellowish brown, speckled and spotted irregularly with dark brown or blackish; setae short, golden colored, Integument dull, slightly rugose.
Psammolestes coreodes.Head: as long as or slightly longer than wide (l:0,8-1,0), and distinctly shorter than pronotum (1:1,2-1,3); its color yellowish dorsally, irregularly mottled with dark brown.
Psammolestes coreodes.Hemelytra: of male attaining, of female approaching, apex of abdomen.
Psammolestes coreodes.Legs: light brown, with Irregularly scattered dark brown spots.
Psammolestes coreodes.Length: of male 12-14 , of female 13,5-15,0 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 4,0 , of female 4,5 , of abdomen of male 5,5 , of female 6,0 General color light yellowish brown, speckled and spotted irregularly with dark brown or blackish; setae short, golden colored, Integument dull, slightly rugose.
Psammolestes coreodes.Ocelli: inserted on conspicuous elevations; head strongly declivous behind ocelli.
Psammolestes coreodes.Pronotum: not conspicuously flattened, of general body color; fore lobe and anterolateral angles with small irregularly shaped black areas.
Psammolestes coreodes.Scutellum: coarsely rugose transversally, median depression slight, posterior process narrowly tapered apically.

Psammolestes tertius.Anteocular region: from two to two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,4-0,5).
Psammolestes tertius.Eyes: large, in lateral view attaining level of under and closely approaching level of upper surface of head.
Psammolestes tertius.Genitalia: of male with basal plate struts of medium size, separated, broadly Sshaped; dorsal sclerotization of phallosoma broadly rounded apically.
Psammolestes tertius.Genae: conspicuous, strongly divergent, surpassing clypeus considerably.
Psammolestes tertius.General color: light yellowish brown with scattered dark brown spots.
Psammolestes tertius.Head: slightly longer than wide across eyes (1:0,85-0,95) and from slightly to distinctly shorter than pronotum
Psammolestes tertius.Hemelytra: attaining apex of abdomen in both sexes, of general body color, with cells of membrane distinctly darkened.
Psammolestes tertius.Integument: dull, with short golden colored setae.
Psammolestes tertius.Legs: of body color, with irregularly scattered dark spots .
Psammolestes tertius.Length: of male 11,5-12,5 , of female 12,5-13,5 Maximum width of pronotum of male 4 , of female 4,5 , of abdomen of male and female 5,5-6,0 General color light yellowish brown with scattered dark brown spots.
Psammolestes tertius.Ocelli: inserted on distinct elevations, the latter somewhat less prominent than in coreodes.
Psammolestes tertius.Pronotum: not conspicuously flattened, of general body color; anterior lobe with numerous dark brown spots.
Psammolestes tertius.Scutellum: coarsely rugose transversally, median depression small and shallow, posterior process narrowly tapering toward apex.

CAVERNICOLINI USINGER.Body: surface smooth, without granulations or conspicuous rugosities, covered with long delicate hairs.
CAVERNICOLINI USINGER.Genae: inapparent, not extending beyond apex of clypeus.
CAVERNICOLINI USINGER.Head: strongly convex above.
CAVERNICOLINI USINGER.Ocelli: not elevated, inconspicuous, situated in or immediately behind interocular sulcus, the latter strongly backwardly curved and almost attaining level of posterior border of head.
CAVERNICOLINI USINGER.Urosternites: covering part of ventral connexival segments, connected to latter by simple membrane.

Cavernicola Barber.Antennae: inserted close to anterior border of eye.
Cavernicola Barber.Connexivum: wide dorsally, perceptible ventral portion very narrow, only about one-third as wide as dorsal connexival plates.
Cavernicola Barber.First antennal segment: short; the remaining progressively longer from second to fourth.
Cavernicola Barber.Head: oval, about twice as long as wide across eyes, strongly convex dorsally; anteocular and postocular regions subequal in length.
Cavernicola Barber.Legs: with femora widened, fusiform without denticles.
Cavernicola Barber.Pronotum: convex, strongly declivous anteriorly, its surface dull, smooth, or faintly rugose, without dorsal or lateral tubercles.
Cavernicola Barber.Rostrum: attaining prostemum, with first and third segments very short, second much longer.
Cavernicola Barber.Scutellum: with disc elevated, convex; posterior process much shorter than disc, blunt, subvertical.
Cavernicola Barber.Second antennal segment: with three closely spaced subbasal trichobothria, as well as one median and one subapical one.

Cavernicola pilosa.Abdomen: with spiracles remote from connexival suture .
Cavernicola pilosa.Anteocular region: as long as postocular, the latter elongate with sides gradually converging toward behind, in dorsal view.
Cavernicola pilosa.Anterolateral angles: with short apically somewhat rounded processes.
Cavernicola pilosa.Body: abundantly pilose except membrane of hemelytra; general color from dark brown to piceous, except stramineous on corium, veins of hemelytra, wedge-shaped area adjacent to inner cell of membrane, and coxae, trochantera, and base of femora.
Cavernicola pilosa.Corium: more than twothirds of length of hemelytron.
Cavernicola pilosa.Eyes: small, in lateral view approaching but not attaining level of ventral and distant from level of dorsal surface of head.
Cavernicola pilosa.Fore: femora about 4,5 times as long as wide.
Cavernicola pilosa.Head: as in generic description and figures 291, 292, 2938, C, fusiform, slightly longer than pronotum (l:0,8-0,9).
Cavernicola pilosa.Hemelytra: as in generic description and figures 291, 292, 2930.
Cavernicola pilosa.Legs: as in generic description and figures 291, 292.
Cavernicola pilosa.Length: of male 11,0-11,5 , of females 12,0-13,5 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 3,0-3,2 , of female 3,5-4,0 ; maximum width of abdomen of male.
Cavernicola pilosa.Pronotum: as in generic description and figures 291, 292, 293E.
Cavernicola pilosa.Rostrum: with first segment very short, not attaininglevel of apex of antenniferous tubercle; secondsegment very long, attaining level of hindborder of head; third segment short.
