Cavernicola pilosa.Scutellum: with posterior process subhorizontal, rounded apically .

BOLBODERINI USINGER.Body: integument rugose and with small setigerous granules; body and appendages only with short hairs.
BOLBODERINI USINGER.Genae: salient, large, spinelike or platelike, projecting beyond apex of clypeus at least by distance equal to width of clypeus apically.
BOLBODERINI USINGER.Head: not strongly convex dorsally; genae surpassing clypeus by distance equal to width of clypeus apically; eyes situated laterally behind middle of head; antenniferous tubercles with conspicuous apicolateral process; fourth antennal article only very slightly longer than longest of the others; only fourth antennal segment delicately annulate; stridulatory sulcus present; fore and mid femora from subcylindrical to slightly incrassate, with or without denticles; femora without trichobothria; fore tarsi much shorter than half the length of tibiae; abdomen without series of large tubercles dorsally along middle.
BOLBODERINI USINGER.Ocelli: situated somewhat before middle of disc of postocular portion of head, not elevated, inconspicuous.
BOLBODERINI USINGER.Overall color: light, with more or less extensive dark areas on body and appendages, but never mottled; setae simple or spinulose; fourth antennal segment not longer than first, second and third combined; stridulatory sulcus present; mesonotum longer at midline than at sides; metanotal plates small, distance between plates more than twice their width; femora without trichobothria; posterior tarsi apically without specialized
BOLBODERINI USINGER.Second antennal segment: with 1-4 trichobothria arranged in a single row.
BOLBODERINI USINGER.Urosternites: covering part of ventral connexival segments, connected to latter by simple membrane.

Bolbodera Valdes.Antennae: inserted apical of center of anteocular region.
Bolbodera Valdes.Anterior lobe: with 1 + 1 discal tubercles and with 1 + 1 acute projections on lateral margin posteriorly.
Bolbodera Valdes.Connexivum: wide, without dorsal longitudinal ridge, its margins reflexed.
Bolbodera Valdes.Eyes: small, in lateral view not attaining levels of upper and lower surface of head.
Bolbodera Valdes.Genae: pointed, very slightly compressed laterally at base, surpassing clypeus, the latter widened subbasally, tapering at base; bucculae fully exposed.
Bolbodera Valdes.Head: elongate fusiform, about twice as long as wide.
Bolbodera Valdes.Hemelytra: almost attaining apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
Bolbodera Valdes.Ocelli: small but normally developed, situated on dorsal surface of head, slightly mesad of inner tangent of eyes.
Bolbodera Valdes.Posterior lobe: carinate laterally, with 1 + 1 abbreviated submedian carinae; humeral angles obtuse.
Bolbodera Valdes.Pronotum: with anterior lobe narrow; median constriction prominent.
Bolbodera Valdes.Rostrum: attaining prostemum, subcylindrical, only slightly compressed dorsoventrally; first segment short, attaining level of antenniferous tubercles, second about twice as long as first; third the shortest.
Bolbodera Valdes.Scutellum: subtriangular, without anterolateral projections; posterior process subcylindrical, more than half as long as scutellum.

Bolbodera scabrosa.Connexivum: pink or red, with anterolateral angles of segments IV and V black; connexival segments VI-IX entirely
Bolbodera scabrosa.Corium: irregularly rugose, more strongly so on basal angle, falling distinctly short of level of apex of inner cell of membrane, and extending to level of center of fifth connexival segment.
Bolbodera scabrosa.Fore: femora 4,3 times as long as wide, widest at middle.
Bolbodera scabrosa.Head: coarsely granulose, with short inconspicuous setae, black, twice as long as wide (1:0,55), slightly longer than pronotum (1:0,95).
Bolbodera scabrosa.Hemelytra: black, with corium red on its posterior two-thirds; a whitish line separating corium from membrane.
Bolbodera scabrosa.Legs: uniformly black, their structure as in generic description and figure 297C.
Bolbodera scabrosa.Length: 8,8 ; maximum width of pronotum 2,3 , of abdomen 3,4 Head coarsely granulose, with short inconspicuous setae, black, twice as long as wide (1:0,55), slightly longer than pronotum (1:0,95).
Bolbodera scabrosa.Pronotum: and upper portion of propleura uniformly red; rest of thorax, including scutellum, black.
Bolbodera scabrosa.Rostrum: with sparse, short, inconspicuous setae; ratio of antennal segments 1:2,5:0,6.
Bolbodera scabrosa.Scutellum: rugose; posterior process subcylindrical, as long as disc of pronotum.

BELMINUS ST.Antennae: inserted slightly apicad of middle of anteocular region.
BELMINUS ST.Clypeus: approximately parallel-sided, slightly tapering at base.
BELMINUS ST.Connexivum: wide dorsally, perceptible ventral portion of connexivum very narrow, from one-third to one-fourth as wide as dorsal connexival plates.
BELMINUS ST.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view attaining level of ventral but not of dorsal surface of head.
BELMINUS ST.Genae: compressed laterally, platelike, their apex widely rounded, considerably surpassing clypeus.
BELMINUS ST.Head: elongate fusiform, two and one-half to three times as long as wide.
BELMINUS ST.Hemelytra: falling distinctly short of apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
BELMINUS ST.Ocelli: small or obsolescent, laterally oriented, situated at or slightly laterad of levels Fm.
BELMINUS ST.Posterior lobe: of pronotum with sides carinate; submedian carinae almost attaining posterior margin; surface of lobe heavily rugose transversally.
BELMINUS ST.Pronotum: with fore lobe narrow; median constriction prominent.
BELMINUS ST.Rostrum: attaining prosternum, subcylindrical, only very slightly compressed dorsoventrally; first and second segments elongate, subequal in length, third very short.
BELMINUS ST.Scutellum: triangular, with l + l lateral subtriangular projections; posterior process subconical or slightly flattened, as long as main body of scutellum.
BELMINUS ST.Spiracles: very close to apparent connexival suture.
BELMINUS ST.Tibiae: slender, slightly curved, distinctly compressed laterally, with distinct ventral carina.

Belminus costaricensis.Abdomen: with posterior fourth of each connexival segment yellowish or reddish dorsally and ventrally, light color continued ventrally onto lateral portions of urosternites.
Belminus costaricensis.Corium: over half as long as hemelytron, attaining level of apex of third visible connexival segment, and almost attaining level of apex of inner cell of membrane, the latter not widened subapically.
Belminus costaricensis.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head.
Belminus costaricensis.Fore: femora four times as long as wide, with two spinelike processes; mid and hind femora with only one, larger process.
Belminus costaricensis.General color: black, with yellow or orangebrown spots on membrane of hemelytr a and on abdomen.
Belminus costaricensis.Head: two and one1Spanish version of key, p.
Belminus costaricensis.Hemelytra: as shown in figures 289, 299, attaining level of center of seventh urotergite.
Belminus costaricensis.Length: of male 8,5 , of female 9 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 2,3, of female 3 , maximum width of abdomen of male 3,5 , of female 5 General color black, with yellow or orangebrown spots on membrane of hemelytr a and on abdomen.
Belminus costaricensis.Pronotum: of general body color, its shape as shown in figures 297, 298.
Belminus costaricensis.Rostrum: with first segment closely approaching level of center of eye, second segment shorter, third shortest; ratio of length of segments 1:0,70:0,35.
Belminus costaricensis.Scutellum: excavate on disc; scutellar process lanceolate, depressed dorsoventrally, sulcate longitudinally above.
Belminus costaricensis.Spiracles: very close to lateral margin of urostemites.

Belminus herreri.Anteocular region: twice as long as postocular (1:0,5), the latter subcircular, with sides conspicuously convergent posteriorly.
Belminus herreri.Corium: over half as long as hemelytra, attaining level of center of third visible connexival segment, and falling considerably short of apex of inner cell of membrane.
Belminus herreri.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of lower but not of upper surface of head.
Belminus herreri.Femora: with one or two spinelike projections, if two then of very different size.
Belminus herreri.Fore: femora four times as long as wide.
Belminus herreri.Head: granulose, two and one-half times as long as wide (1:0,4) and distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,8).
Belminus herreri.Hemelytra: attaining basal third of seventh tergite in male (hemelytra of female not examined).
Belminus herreri.Legs: as in generic description and figures 301, 302E.
Belminus herreri.Length: of male 8,5 , of female 9,0; maximum width of pronotum of male and female 2,5 , of abdomen of male 3,8 , of female 4,0 General color black.
Belminus herreri.Membrane: smoky black, with veins enclosed by deeper black areas.
Belminus herreri.Ocelli: small, about as large as individual granule of head integument.
Belminus herreri.Rostrum: with basal segment falling slightly short of level of anterior border of eyes; ratio of rostral segments 1:0,90:0,45.
Belminus herreri.Spiracles: very close to lateral margin of urosternites .

Belminus peruvianus.Abdomen: with spiracles close to external margin of sternites.
Belminus peruvianus.Anteocular region: two and one-half times as long as postocular (1:0,4), the latter subrectangular, with sides almost straight, subparallel, only very slightly converging toward behind.
Belminus peruvianus.Corium: half as long as hemelytron, its apex attaining level of extreme base of third visible abdominal tergite, and extending only slightly beyond level of middle of internal cell of membrane, the latter cell slightly widened subapically.
Belminus peruvianus.Eyes: in lateral view not attaining level of dorsal or ventral surface of head.
Belminus peruvianus.Femora: with one large and two or three smaller denticles or processes, the larger ones up to one-half as long as diameter of femur.
Belminus peruvianus.Genitalia: as in generic description and figure 23F,
Belminus peruvianus.General color: black, in some cases faintly tinged with pink.
Belminus peruvianus.Head: strongly granulate, granules largest on dorsal surface.
Belminus peruvianus.Hemelytra: and wings as in generic description and figures 304, 305C, F, not quite attaining center of seventh urotergite, in both sexes.
Belminus peruvianus.Legs: with fore femora three and one-half times as long as wide.
Belminus peruvianus.Length: of males 10,2-10,8 , of female 11,2 ; maximum width of pronotum 2,8-2,9 ; maximum width of abdomen of male 4,1-4,7 , of female 4,8-5,0 General color black, in some cases faintly tinged with pink.
Belminus peruvianus.Ocelli: very small, obsolescent, not larger than average granule of head.
Belminus peruvianus.Pronotum: black, its shape as shown in figure 304.
Belminus peruvianus.Rostrum: with first segment not extending beyond level of posterior third of anteocular region; ratio of rostral segments 1:1,0:0,45.
Belminus peruvianus.Setae: of second antennal segment as shown in figure 61, trichobothrial pattern as shown in figure 9A.

Belminus rugulosus.Anteocular region: about twice as long as postocular (1:0,45-0,50), the latter faintly rounded laterally, with sides strongly converging posteriorly.
Belminus rugulosus.Corium: approximately half as long as hemelytron, its apex attaining level of center of third visible connexival segment, and approaching level of apex of inner membranal cell, the latter comparatively wide.
Belminus rugulosus.Eyes: in lateral view attaining level of under but not of upper surface of head; ratio width of eye to synthlipsis 1:2,20-2,35.
Belminus rugulosus.Femora: with two or three spinelike processes.
Belminus rugulosus.Head: granulose, granules of various sizes.
Belminus rugulosus.Hemelytra: almost attaining level of posterior border of tergite VII.
Belminus rugulosus.Legs: as in generic description and figures 306, 307.
Belminus rugulosus.Length: 10,5-11,0 Maximum width of pronotum 2,5-2,8 , of abdomen 4,0-4,3 General color black.
Belminus rugulosus.Pronotum: black, most heavily granulose on fore lobe, with 7 + 7 distinct tubercles.
Belminus rugulosus.Rostrum: with first segment not quite attaining level of anterior border of eyes; ratio of antennal segments 1:0,75-0,85:0,4-0,5.
Belminus rugulosus.Scutellum: excavate on disc; scutellar process shallowly sulcate dorsally.
Belminus rugulosus.Venter: with spiracles very close to lateral margin of stemites.

Parabelminus Lent.Abdomen: heavily rugose dorsally and ventrally; portion of basal tergite exposed between hemelytra.
Parabelminus Lent.Antennae: inserted on anterior third of anteocular region.
Parabelminus Lent.Connexivum: very wide dorsally, connexival segments as wide as one-fifth of width of abdomen; perceptible ventral portion of connexivum very narrow, from one-fourth to one-fifth of width of dorsal connexival segments.
Parabelminus Lent.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view surpassing level of ventral but not attaining level of dorsal surface of head.
Parabelminus Lent.Femora: stout, with l + 1 short, spinelike teeth on under surface subapically.
Parabelminus Lent.Genitalia: of female truncate apically, terminal tergites vertical.
Parabelminus Lent.Genae: compressed laterally, their apex widely rounded, considerably surpassing clypeus, and completely covering bucculae.
Parabelminus Lent.Head: from one and one-half to twice as long as wide, shallowly but distinctly excavate longitudinally on under surface for reception of rostrum.
Parabelminus Lent.Hemelytra: falling distinctly short of apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
Parabelminus Lent.Ocelli: very small, obsolescent, laterally oriented, situated at level of inner tangents of eyes.
Parabelminus Lent.Posterior lobe: with humeri rounded; submedian carinae almost attaining hind border; surface of posterior lobe rugose-granulose.
Parabelminus Lent.Pronotum: with anterior lobe covered by setiferous granules forming distinct pattern; anterolateral angles short.
Parabelminus Lent.Rostrum: attaining prosternum, distinctly flattened dorsoventrally; first and third segment shortest, second much longer.
Parabelminus Lent.Scutellum: subsemicircular, exposed portion subtrapezoidal; posterior process absent.
Parabelminus Lent.Spongy fossulae: present on all three pairs of legs, small, not longer than width of tibia apically.
Parabelminus Lent.Tibiae: short, widened, distinctly compressed laterally, conspicuously narrowed at base.

Parabelminus carioca.Abdomen: of general body color; posterolateral angles of connexival segments with small light reddish spots .
Parabelminus carioca.Femora: each with one pair of distinct spinelike processes; fore femora widest on anterior third, slightly over three times as long as wide.
Parabelminus carioca.General color: black, antennae brown; hemelytra with yellowish spots at base of membrane and adjacent to corium.
Parabelminus carioca.Head: almost twice as long as wide (1:0,5-0,6) and as long as or very slightly longer than pronotum (1:0,9-1,0); anteocular region distinctly longer than postocular (1:0,7).
Parabelminus carioca.Hemelytra: and hind wings as in generic description and figures 309, 310, 3110.
Parabelminus carioca.Legs: as in generic description and figures 309, 310, 311C.
Parabelminus carioca.Length: of male 9,0-9,5 , of female 10 , maximum width of pronotum of male 2,5, of female 3,0 , of abdomen of male 4,0-4,5, of female 5,0 General color black, antennae brown; hemelytra with yellowish spots at base of membrane and adjacent to corium.
Parabelminus carioca.Pronotum: as shown in figures 309, 310, 311; median constriction not pronounced, sides of anterior and posterior lobes forming an almost straight line.
Parabelminus carioca.Rostrum: as in generic description and figure 311; ratio of rostral segments 1:2,8:0,9.

Parabelminus yurupucu.Abdomen: and genitalia as in carioca; genital region of female as shown in figure
Parabelminus yurupucu.Fore: femora about three and onehalf times as long as wide, with one pair of short denticles; mid and hind femora each with one pair of spinelike processes.
Parabelminus yurupucu.Head: twice as long as wide (1:0,5), distinctly longer than pronotum (1:0,8-0,9); anteocular region almost twice as long as postocular (1:0,60-0,65).
Parabelminus yurupucu.Hemelytra: much as in carioca, yellowish spots slightly smaller.
Parabelminus yurupucu.Length: of male 8,9 , of female 9,5-9,7 , width of pronotum of male 2,3 , of female 2,5 ; width of abdomen of male 3,9 , of female 4,3-4,4 General color pattern much as in P.
Parabelminus yurupucu.Pronotum: bell-shaped, median constriction pronounced, sides of anterior and posterior lobes meeting at conspicuous angle,

MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Antennae: inserted at center of anteocular portion of head.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Connexivum: very wide dorsally; perceptible ventral portion of connexivum very narrow, from one-fourth to one-fifth of width of dorsal connexival segments.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Eyes: medium-sized, in lateral view surpassing level of lower but not attaining level of upper surface of head.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Genitalia: of female truncate posteriorly, eighth and ninth tergites vertical.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Genae: compressed laterally, their apex widely rounded, considerably surpassing clypeus, and completely covering bucculae.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Head: from 1,2-1,7 times as long as wide, not distinctly sulcate on under surface.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Hemelytra: almost attaining apex of abdomen, in both sexes.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Legs: short, femora not as much thickened as in Parabelminus and without denticles.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Ocelli: very small, laterally oriented, situated at level of inner tangents of eyes.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Posterior lobe: with humeri widely rounded; submedian carinae almost attaining hind border.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Posterior process: lanceolate, slightly shorter than disc of scutellum.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Pronotum: with anterior lobe granulose, posterior lobe rugose-granulose; anterolateral angles short; discal and lateral tubercles absent.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Rostrum: attaining prostemum, distinctly flattened; first segment attaining level of insertion of antennae.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Spongy fossulae: present on all three pairs of legs, small, not longer than width of tibiae apically.
MICROTRIATOMA PROSEN AND MARTINEZ.Tibiae: short, compressed laterally, not conspicuously narrowed at base.

Microtriatoma borbai.Anteocular region: varying from slightly longer than, to as long as, postocular region (1:0,9-1,0).
Microtriatoma borbai.Head: stout in lateral view, and twice as long as high.
Microtriatoma borbai.Hemelytra: and hind wings as in trinidadensis, but membrane of hemelytra concolorous dark .
Microtriatoma borbai.Pronotum: as in trinidadensis; anterolateral angles pointed in most specimens .
Microtriatoma borbai.Rostrum: as shown in figure 315A; ratio of rostral segments

Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Anteocular region: varying from slightly longer to slightly shorter than postcoular (l:0,8-1,1).
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Anterolateral angles: of pronotum from blunt to distinctly pointed.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Connexivum: dorsally and ventrally with narrow transversal yellowish bands before each intersegmental suture, widest near outer margin of connexival segments.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Corium: distinctly pilose; general color of hemelytra dark, membrane speckled with whitish.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Fore: femur widest at anterior third, almost four times as long as wide.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Genitalia: of female as in generic description, of male as in figures 230,
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Head: of general body color, with adpressed setae.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Hemelytra: and hind wings as in general description and figures 316, 317.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Legs: as in generic description and figures 316, 317, of general body color, with coxae and trochantera yellowish.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Length: of male 7,5-8,0 , of female 7,5 ; maximum width of pronotum of male 2,0 , of female 2,3 , of abdomen of male 3,3, of female 3,5 General color piceous to black.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Pronotum: of general body color, its shape as shown in figures 316, 317, 318A; sides of anterior and posterior lobes almost continuous, not forming conspicuous angle.
Microtriatoma trinidadensis.Rostrum: as in generic description and figure 3188, I, N, P, X; ratio of segments 1:1,5-1,7:0,7-0,8.

ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Antenniferous tubercles: adjacent to anterior border of eyes, short, without apicolateral projections.
ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Body: integument minutely granulose and rugose; body and appendages onlywith short setae.
ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Genitalia: of male not examined in detail.
ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Genae: inconspicuous, not projecting beyond level of apex of clypeus.
ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Head: extraordinarily short and wide, with anteocular portion shorter than length of eyes, in dorsal view.
ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Ocelli: large, inserted on well-developed ocelliferous elevations on disc of postocular portion of head.
ALBERPROSENIINI MARTINEZ AND CARCAVALLO.Urosternites: covering part of ventral connexival segments, connected to latter by simple membrane.

Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Antennae: short, with second and fourth articles the longest, third slightly shorter.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Antenniferous tubercles: inserted close to anterior margin of eyes.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Clypeus: widest before middle, its apex slightly convex.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Connexivum: wide dorsally; perceptible ventral portion of connexivum very narrow, only about one-third as wide as dorsal connexival plates, the latter without ridges.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Eyes: large, occupying considerable portion of lateral surf ace of head.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Head: very short, approximately as long as wide across eyes.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Posterior lobe: rugose, with humeral angles narrow, somewhat flaring; submedian carinae well developed, almost attaining posterior margin.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Posterior process: of scutellum slightly longer than body of scutellum, stout, horizontal, subcylindrical, rounded apically.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Pronotum: with fore lobe divided by deep longitudinal median sulcus into two strongly convex portions, without tubercles.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Spiracles: distant from lateral margin of urosternites by several times their own diameter.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Spongy fossulae: on first pair of legs in male (female unknown).
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Tibiae: slender, straight; fore tibiae strongly compressed laterally.
Alberprosenia Martinez and Carcavallo.Urosternites: irregularly wrinkled, minutely carinulate along base of each urosternite.

Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Antennae: with first segment slightly less than twice as long as wide, second with five trichobothria as shown in figure 320C.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Antenniferous tubercles: very short, adjoining anterior margin of eyes.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Anteocular region: four times as Jong as postocular, the latter subsemicircular, four times as wide as long, entirely occupied on dorsum by large ocelliferous tubercles separated by a longitudinal furrow.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Corium: and basal third of clavus piceous; corium reddish at base, conspicuously yellowish white apically.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Eyes: in lateral view considerably surpassing level of under and cl sely approaching level of upper surface of head.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Head: piceous, sides of postocular region light brown; surface granulose, especially on ocelliferous tubercles and on apically bifurcate dorsal longitudinal ridge along center.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Hemelytra: as in generic descriptions and figures 319A, 320F.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Integument: of venter delicately wrinkled, irregularly so on disc of urostemites, minutely canaliculate longitudinally along posterior margin of sclerites .
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Jugae: and genae inconspicuous in lateral view, genae not quite attaining level of apex of clypeus in dorsal flew.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Legs: as in generic description and figure 320 D, I, M, stout, fore femora 3,5 times as long as wide.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Membrane: brown, fumose, with large yellowish white subcircular spot occupying basal half of inner membranal cell and adjacent areas.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Overall color: from dark reddish brown to black, with light brown and yellow pattern elements.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Pronotum: piceous, gradually lighter toward behind; humeri and anterolateral angles yellowish white.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Rostrum: as in generic description and figure 3208; second and third segments slightly flattened.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Scutellum: irregularly and coarsely wrinkled; median depression not delimitated by distinct carinae.
Alberprosenia goyovargasi.Spiracles: remote from lateral margin of urostemites .
